text.ori_cn: §第一章 道可道，非常道。
text.man_en: 1The Tao that can be told of is not the Absolute Tao;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER I. The Way can be the Way, but it is not the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 1 The Tao is Tao, but it is very Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter One: The Tao that can be spoken of is not the eternal Tao.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1 可以讲述的 "道 "不是绝对的 "道"；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 1 可以说的道，不是绝对的道；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道可道，非常道；

text.ori_cn: 名可名，非常名。
text.man_en: the Names that can be given are not Absolute Names.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A name can be a name, but it is not a name.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Famous, very famous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The name that can be named is not the eternal Name.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 可以给出的名称并非绝对名称。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 可以给出的名称不是绝对名称。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 可名者非恒名。

text.ori_cn: 无名天地之始，有名万物之母。
text.man_en: The Nameless is the origin of Heaven and Earth; the Named is the Mother of All Things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no name for the beginning of heaven and earth, but there is a name for the mother of all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The beginning of the nameless heaven and earth, the name of the mother of all things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nameless is the beginning of heaven and earth; the named is the mother of all things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无名者，天地之本；有名者，万物之母。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无名者，天地之本也；被命名者是万物之母。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无名，天地之始；有名，万物之母。

text.ori_cn: 故常无欲，以观其妙； 常有欲，以观其徼。
text.man_en: Therefore: oftentimes, one strips oneself of passion in order to see the Secret of Life; oftentimes, one regards life with passion, in order to see its manifest forms.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, we should always have no desire to see the beauty of it; and we should always have desire to see its mere existence.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, always have no desire in order to observe its wonderfulness; always have desire in order to observe its pleasure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, always without desire, one can observe its subtleties; always with desire, one can observe its manifestations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此：很多时候，人们为了看到生命的秘密而摒弃自己的激情；很多时候，人们为了看到生命的显现形式而带着激情看待生命。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此：很多时候，一个人要去掉自己的激情，才能看到生命的秘密；很多时候，人们会怀着激情对待生活，以便看到它的表现形式。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此：常常，人们剥离激情以洞察生命的秘密；常常，人们以激情看待生命，以观察其显现的形式。

text.ori_cn: 此两者同出而异名，同谓之玄，玄之又玄，众妙之门。
text.man_en: These two (the Secret and its manifestations) are (in their nature) the same; they are given different names when they become manifest. They may both be called the Cosmic Mystery: reaching from the Mystery into the Deeper Mystery is the Gate to the Secret of All Life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: These two are of the same origin and different names, and they are both called Xuan, Xuan and Xuan, the gateway to all the wonders.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The two have the same origin but different names. They are both called xuan, and they are both mysterious and mysterious. They are the door to all mysteries.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: These two emerge together yet are named differently. Together, they are called the mysterious; the deepest of the mysterious, the gateway to all wonders.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这两者（奥秘及其显现）（在本质上）是相同的，只是在显现时被赋予了不同的名称。它们都可以被称为 "宇宙之谜"：从 "之谜 "进入 "更深之谜 "是通往 "万物之秘 "的大门。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这两者（秘密及其表现形式）（本质上）是相同的；当它们显现时，它们被赋予不同的名称。它们都可以被称为宇宙奥秘：从奥秘进入更深的奥秘是通向所有生命秘密的大门。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这两者（秘密及其表现）在本质上是一样的；当它们显现出来时，它们被赋予了不同的名称。它们都可以称为宇宙奥秘：从奥秘深入更深的奥秘，这是通往生命一切秘密之门。

text.ori_cn: § 第二章 天下皆知美之为美，斯恶已。
text.man_en: 2When the people of the Earth all know beauty as beauty, there arises (the recognition of) ugliness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 2 The world knows that beauty is beautiful, and that evil is already there.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 2 Everyone in the world knows that beauty is beautiful, but this is evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Two: When everyone in the world knows beauty as beauty, there is already ugliness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 2当地球人都知道美是美时，就会产生（对）丑的认识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 2当地球上的人们都知道美就是美的时候，丑就产生了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当世人皆知美之为美时，即有丑之认识。

text.ori_cn: 皆知善之为善，斯不善已。
text.man_en: 1When the people of the Earth all know the good as good, there arises (the recognition of) evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: We all know that good is good, but it is not good enough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everyone knows that good is good, but this is not good.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When everyone recognizes the good as good, there is already non-good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1 当地球上的人们都知道善是好的时候，就会产生（对）恶的认识。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 1当地球上的人们都知道善为善时，邪恶就会出现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当世人皆知善为善时，恶便随之而生。

text.ori_cn: 故有无相生，难易相成，长短相较，高下相倾，音声相和，前后相随。
text.man_en: Therefore:being and nonbeing interdepend in growth; difficult and easy interdepend in completion; long and short interdepend in contrast; high and low interdepend in position; tones and voice interdepend in harmony; front and behind interdepend in company.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the existence and the absence of each other, the difficulty and the ease of each other, the length and the shortness of each other, the height and the bottom of each other, the sound and the sound of each other, the front and the back of each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, existence and non-existence arise from each other, difficulty and ease complement each other, long and short compare with each other, high and low are inclined to each other, sound and sound harmonize with each other, and front and rear follow each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, being and non-being give rise to each other, difficulty and ease complement each other, length and shortness compare with each other, height and depth incline towards each other, sound and tone harmonize with each other, and before and after follow each other.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，有与无在成长中相互依存；难与易在完成中相互依存；长与短在对比中相互依存；高与低在位置中相互依存；音调与声音在和谐中相互依存；前与后在陪伴中相互依存。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此：存在与非存在相互依存而生长；难易相互依存完成；长短相互依存，对比鲜明；地位高低相互依存；音调和声音相互依存和谐；公司前后相互依存。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此：有与无相生；难与易相成；长与短相形；高与下相盈；音与声相和；前与后相随。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人处无为之事，行不言之教；万物作焉而不辞，生而不有，为而不恃， 功成而弗居。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage: manages affairs without action; preaches the doctrine without words; all things take their rise, but he does not turn away from them; he gives them life, but does not take possession of them; he acts, but does not appropriate; accomplishes, but claims no credit.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is why the saints do nothing, do not say the teachings; all things are made and do not resign, born and do not have, for and do not rely on, success and not live.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage does nothing, and teaches without saying anything; he does all things without saying anything, he is born without being, he does things without relying on them, and he does not dwell on his achievements.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage manages affairs without action, and teaches without words. All things arise, and he does not reject them; he creates but does not possess; he acts but does not rely on his actions; he accomplishes his task but does not dwell on it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人：无为而治，无言而传；万物各取所需，但不背离；赋予生命，但不占有；有所作为，但不占有；有所成就，但不邀功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人：治事无为；无言传教；万物自生，而他不离弃。他赋予他们生命，但并不占有他们；他行动，但不适当；取得了成就，但不声称有功劳。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 是以圣人：处事无为；传道不言；万物作焉而不辞；生而不有；为而不恃；功成而弗居。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯弗居，是以弗去。
text.man_en: It is because he lays claim to no credit that the credit cannot be taken away from him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only way to live is to not go.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you only live in Ephesus, you will go to Ephesus.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because one does not cling to anything that nothing is lost.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正因为他没有功劳，所以功劳也不能从他身上拿走。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正是因为他不主张任何功劳，所以功劳不能从他身上夺走。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正因为他不居功，所以功劳不会被夺走。

text.ori_cn: § 第三章 不尚贤，使民不争；不贵难得之货，使民不为盗；不见可欲，使民心不乱。
text.man_en: 3Exalt not the wise, so that the people shall not scheme and contend; prize not rare objects, so that the people shall not steal; shut out from site the things of desire, so that the people's hearts shall not be disturbed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER III. Do not honour the virtuous, so that the people will not contend; do not value goods that are hard to obtain, so that the people will not steal; do not see what is desirable, so that the people's hearts will not be in turmoil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 3: If you do not value the virtuous, the people will not fight; if you do not value hard-to-find goods, the people will not steal; if you do not see the desirable, the people will not be confused.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Three: By not exalting the worthy, the people will not compete; by not valuing rare treasures, the people will not become thieves; by not displaying what is desirable, the people's hearts will not be disturbed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 3 不要夸奖贤人，以免百姓计较；不要珍视珍品，以免百姓偷盗；不要把欲望的东西放在显眼的地方，以免扰乱百姓的心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 3 不要高举智者，使百姓不谋谋争竞；不珍稀之物，使民不盗；把欲望之物排除在外，使人心不被扰乱。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不尚贤，使民不争；不贵难得之货，使民不为盗；不见可欲，使民心不乱。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人之治，虚其心，实其腹， 弱其志，强其骨。
text.man_en: Therefore in the government of the Sage: he keeps empty their hearts makes full their bellies, discourages their ambitions, strengthens their frames;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the rule of the saints that their hearts are weak, their bellies are solid, their wills are weak, and their bones are strong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the rule of the sage is to make his heart weak and his belly strong, to weaken his will and strengthen his bones.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage governs by emptying their minds, filling their bellies, weakening their ambitions, and strengthening their bones.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，在圣人的治理下：他让他们的心空虚，让他们的肚子饱满，挫败他们的野心，增强他们的体魄；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人之政，虚其心，饱其腹，抑其志，强其体；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，在圣人的治理下：他使他们的心灵空虚，使他们的肚子充实，抑制他们的野心，强健他们的体魄；

text.ori_cn: 常使民无知无欲。
text.man_en: so that the people may be innocent of knowledge and desires.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Often the people are made ignorant and uninterested.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It often makes people ignorant and desireless.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Always keep the people without knowledge and desires.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 让人们远离知识和欲望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 使人民无知无欲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这样人们就可以没有知识和欲望而保持纯真。

text.ori_cn: 使夫智者不敢为也。
text.man_en: And the cunning ones shall not presume to interfere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: So that the wise will not dare to do so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A wise man would not dare to do anything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the wise dare not act recklessly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 狡猾的人不会妄加干涉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 狡猾之人不得擅自干涉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 狡猾的人不应擅自干预。

text.ori_cn: 为无为，则无不治。
text.man_en: By action without deeds may all live in peace.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the sake of inaction, there is no cure.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you do nothing, everything will be cured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By doing nothing, nothing remains undone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无为而无不为，愿所有人都生活在和平之中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以行无业，则一切皆得安乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无为而为，天下太平。

text.ori_cn: §第四章 道冲而用之或不盈，渊兮似万物之宗；挫其锐，解其纷，和其光，同其尘，湛兮似或存。
text.man_en: 4Tao is a hollow vessel, and its use is inexhaustible! Fathomless! Like the fountain head of all things, its sharp edges rounded off, its tangles untied, its light tempered, its turmoil submerged, yet dark like deep water it seems to remain.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 4 The Tao rushes and uses it or does not fill it, the abyss is like the ancestor of all things; thwarting its sharpness, resolving its disputes, harmonising with its light, and sharing its dust, Zhan is like or exists.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 4: When the Tao rushes and is used, it may not be full, and the abyss is like the origin of all things; it dampens its sharpness, resolves its confusion, and harmonizes its light, like its dust, and its abyss seems to exist.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Four: The Tao is like an empty vessel that yet cannot be filled, an abyss it seems, the source of all things; it blunts sharpness, resolves complexities, harmonizes the light, and unites with the dust. It is tranquil, as though it may ever remain.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 4 "道 "是一个中空的容器，它的用途取之不尽，用之不竭！深不可测！就像万物的源头，它的锋芒被磨圆了，它的纠结被解开了，它的光明被锤炼了，它的骚动被淹没了，但它似乎仍像深水一样幽暗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 4道是一个空心器皿，它的用处是无穷无尽的！深不可测！就像万物的源头一样，它锋利的边缘被磨圆，它的纠结被解开，它的光芒被调和，它的混乱被淹没，但它似乎仍然像深水一样黑暗。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道是空虚的器皿，其用途是取之不尽的！深不可测！像是万物的本源，其锋利的边缘被磨圆，其缠结被解开，其光芒被柔化，其动荡被沉淀，然而它似乎依然深黑如深水。

text.ori_cn: 吾不知谁之子，象帝之先。
text.man_en: I do not know whose Son it is, an image of what existed before God.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I don't know whose son, like the first of the Emperor.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I don’t know whose son is the first of Emperor Xiang.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I do not know whose child it is; it existed before the Emperor of Heaven.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我不知道这是谁的儿子，是上帝之前存在的形象。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我不知道这是谁的儿子，是上帝之前存在的形象。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我不知道它是谁的儿子，是神之前存在的形象。

text.ori_cn: §第五章 天地不仁，以万物为刍狗； 圣人不仁，以百姓为刍狗。
text.man_en: 5 Nature is unkind: it treats the creation like sacrificial strawdogs. The Sage is unkind: he treats the people like sacrificial strawdogs.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER V. Heaven and earth are unkind, and take all things for ruminants; the sages are unkind, and take the people for ruminants.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 5 The heaven and the earth are unkind and regard all things as stupid dogs; the saints are unkind and regard the common people as stupid dogs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Five: Heaven and Earth are not benevolent; they treat all things as straw dogs. The sage is not benevolent; he treats the common people as straw dogs.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 5 大自然是不仁慈的：它对待造物就像对待牺牲品一样。圣人是不仁的：他把人当作牺牲品。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 5 大自然是不仁慈的：它对待造物就像对待献祭的稻草狗一样。圣人是不仁慈的，他对待百姓就像祭祀的草狗一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地不仁，以万物为刍狗；圣人不仁，以百姓为刍狗。

text.ori_cn: 虚而不屈，动而愈出。
text.man_en: Empty, yet it gives a supply that never fails; the more it is worked, the more it brings forth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The more you move, the more you come out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Virtual and unyielding, moving and out.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Empty yet not yielding, moving and constantly emerging.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它是空的，但它提供的供给却永不枯竭；它越是工作，就越能带来更多。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 空无一物，却能提供永不枯竭的供应；它工作得越多，产生的成果就越多。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虚而不屈，动而愈出。

text.ori_cn: 多言数穷，不如守中。
text.man_en: By many words is wit exhausted. Rather, therefore, hold to the core.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is better to be poor in many words than to keep the centre.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to keep the center than to talk too much.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Talking excessively leads to trouble; it is better to remain centered.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 多言无益于机智。因此，请抓住核心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 说多了，就已经智穷了。因此，一定要抓住核心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 言多必失，倒不如坚守要点。

text.ori_cn: § 第六章 谷神不死，是谓玄牝。
text.man_en: 6The Spirit of the Valley never dies. It is called the Mystic Female.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER VI. The Valley God is immortal, and it is called the Xuan Mare.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6 The God of Grain is immortal and is called the mysterious female.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Six: The valley spirit never dies; it is called the mysterious female.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 6山谷之灵永不逝去。它被称为神秘女性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 6 山谷精神永不消亡。它被称为神秘女性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谷神不死，是谓玄牝。

text.ori_cn: 玄牝之门，是谓天地根。
text.man_en: The Door of the Mystic Female is the root of Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gate of Xuan Mai is the root of heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The gate of Xuanfei is called the root of heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The mysterious female is the gateway; it is termed the root of Heaven and Earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 神秘女性之门是天地之根。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 玄女之门，是天地之根本。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 玄牝之门，是天地之根。

text.ori_cn: 绵绵若存，用之不勤。
text.man_en: Continuously, continuously, it seems to remain. Draw upon it and it serves you with ease.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sheep are not used if they are stored.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If it persists, it will not be used diligently.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It seems to persist, yet is seldom utilized.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不断地，不断地，它似乎依然存在。汲取它的力量，它就会轻松地为你服务。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 持续不断，持续不断，它似乎依然存在。利用它，它可以轻松地为您服务。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 持续不断，仿佛永存。取之不尽，用之顺畅。

text.ori_cn: § 第七章 天长地久。
text.man_en: 7The universe is everlasting.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 7: The Sky's the Limit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 7 Forever.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Seven: Eternal.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 7宇宙是永恒的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 7 宇宙是永恒的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宇宙是永恒的。

text.ori_cn: 天地所以能长且久者，以其不自生，故能长生。
text.man_en: The reason the universe is everlasting is that it does not life for Self. Therefore it can long endure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The reason why heaven and earth can be long and durable is that they do not generate themselves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The reason why heaven and earth can be long-lasting is because they do not generate themselves, so they can live forever.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The reason why heaven and earth can last long is because they do not live for themselves, and thus they can endure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 宇宙之所以永恒，是因为它不为自我而生。因此，它可以长存。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宇宙之所以永恒，是因为它不为自我而存在。故能长久。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宇宙之所以永恒，是因为它不为自己而生存。因此它可以长久存在。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人后其身而身先；外其身而身存。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage puts himself last, and finds himself in the foremost place; regards his body as accidental, and his body is thereby preserved.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that the saint is after his body but before his body; outside his body but in his body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage follows his body and comes first; his body is outside and his body exists.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore the sage places his own interests last and yet finds his interests are served; he puts himself outside his own concern and yet his concerns are sustained.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人把自己放在最后，发现自己处于最重要的位置；视自己的身体为偶然，身体因此得以保存。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人把自己放在最后，而把自己放在首位；认为自己的身体是偶然的，因此他的身体得以保存。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人处于最后，反而位居最前；轻视自己的身体，而身体因此得到保全。

text.ori_cn: 非以其无私邪，故能成其私。
text.man_en: Is it not because he does not live for Self that his Self is realized?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not because it has no selfishness that it can become selfish.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not because he is selfless that he can become selfish.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Is it not because of their selflessness that they can achieve their own interests?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 难道不是因为他不为 "自我 "而活，他的 "自我 "才得以实现吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 难道不是因为他不为自我而活，他的自我才得以实现吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不正是因为他不为自己而活，他的自我才得以实现吗？

text.ori_cn: § 第八章 上善若水。
text.man_en: 8The best of men is like water;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter VIII. The Goodness of the Lord is Like Water.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 8 The best is like water.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 8: The highest goodness is like water.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 8 人上人如水；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 8 人之至善如水；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上善若水；

text.ori_cn: 水善利万物而不争，处众人之所恶， 故几于道。
text.man_en: water benefits all things and does not compete with them. It dwells in (the lowly) places that all disdain Wherein it comes near to the Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Water is good for all things but does not compete, in the evil of all people, so a few in the road.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Water is good for all things and does not compete with it. It is disliked by everyone, so it is close to the Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Water benefits all things without contending, and dwells in places that others disdain; therefore, it is close to the Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 水利万物而不争。它居住在众人不屑一顾的（卑微的）地方，在那里它接近道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 水利万物而不与万物相争。居于众所鄙视之处，近于道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上善若水，水善利万物而不争，处众人之所恶，故几于道。

text.ori_cn: 居善地，心善渊，与善仁，言善信，正善治，事善能，动善时。
text.man_en: In his dwelling, (the Sage) loves the (lowly) earth; in his heart, he loves what is profound; in his relations with others, he loves kindness; in his words, he loves sincerity; in government, he loves peace; in business affairs, he loves ability; in hi actions, he loves choosing the right time.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Live in a good place, have a good heart, be kind to others, speak well and trustworthy, govern well, do good things, and move at the right time.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Live in a good place, have a good heart, be kind and benevolent, speak good faith, govern well, do good things, and act at good times.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dwelling in a good place, with a heart like a deep pool, associating with kindness, speaking with trustworthiness, governing with righteousness, handling affairs with capability, and acting according to the right timing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在居处，（圣人）爱（卑微的）大地；在内心，他爱深邃的东西；在与人交往中，他爱仁慈；在言语中，他爱真诚；在政事中，他爱和平；在商业事务中，他爱能力；在行动中，他爱选择正确的时机。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （圣人）在其居所爱（卑）地；他内心喜爱深奥的事物；为人处事，喜爱仁慈；用他的话说，他爱真诚；在政上，他爱好和平；在政上，他爱好和平；做事，爱能力；做事，爱能力；做事，爱能力。在他的行动中，他喜欢选择正确的时机。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在他的居所，（圣人）爱（低洼的）土地；在他的心中，他爱深刻；在与他人的关系中，他爱仁慈；在他的言语中，他爱诚实；在治理中，他爱和平；在事务中，他爱能力；在他的行动中，他爱选择合适的时机。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯不争，故无尤。
text.man_en: It is because he does not contendthat he is without reproach.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that is not in dispute is that there is no injustice.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband does not fight, so there is no need for you.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is because they do not contend that they are without fault.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正因为他不争辩，所以他无可指责。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正因为他不争辩，所以他才无罪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正因为他不争辩，所以他没有受责备。

text.ori_cn: § 第九章 持而盈之，不如其已；揣而锐之，不可长保。
text.man_en: 9Stretch (a bow) to the very full, and you will wish you had stopped in time. Temper a (swordedge) to its very sharpest, and the edge will not last long.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER IX Holding and filling is not as good as it has been; speculating and sharpening is not long preserved.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9 If you hold on to it and gain it, it will not be as good as it is; if you hold on to it and sharpen it, you will not be able to maintain it for a long time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Nine: To hold and fill it to the brim is not as good as stopping in time; to sharpen it excessively cannot be preserved for long.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 9把（弓）拉到最长，你会希望自己及时停下来。把（剑刃）淬火到最锋利，剑刃也不会长久。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 9把（鞠躬）伸展到最大程度，你会希望自己及时停下来。把剑磨到最锋利的程度，刀刃就不会长久。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 拉弓至满，你会希望自己适可而止；将剑锋磨至最锐利，其锋芒便不会持久。

text.ori_cn: 金玉满堂，莫之能守； 富贵而骄，自遗其咎。
text.man_en: When gold and jade fill your hall, you will not be able to keep them safe. To be proud with wealth and honor is to sow seeds of one's own downfall.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are rich and proud, you will leave yourself open to blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A house full of gold and jade cannot be guarded; if one is rich and arrogant, he will bring his own fault.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A house full of gold and jade cannot be preserved; pride in wealth brings about one's own misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当金玉满堂时，你将无法保证它们的安全。以财富和荣誉为荣，就是为自己的衰亡埋下种子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当金玉满堂时，你将无法保全它们。以财富和荣誉为荣，就是为自己播下失败的种子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 金玉满堂，莫之能守。富贵而骄，自遗其咎。

text.ori_cn: 功成身退，天之道也。
text.man_en: Retire when your work is done, such is Heaven's way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the way of heaven to achieve success.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Retirement after success is the way of heaven.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Achieving success and then stepping back is the way of Heaven.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 功成身退，天道如此。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 干完事就退休，这是天道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 功成身退，天之道也。

text.ori_cn: 生之，畜之。
text.man_en: Live it, livestock it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Born of it, animal of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Live it, livestock it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Give birth to them and nurture them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生活它，畜牧它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 生活它，饲养它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 活得洒脱，畜牧得宜。

text.ori_cn: 生而不有，为而不恃，长而不宰，是谓玄德。
text.man_en: To be born without having something, to work without relying on it, to grow without being killed is called Xuande.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be born and not to have, to be and not to be relied upon, to grow and not to dominate, is to be Xuan De.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be born without having something, to work without relying on it, to grow without being killed is called Xuande.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Create without possessing, act without expecting, guide without constraining. This is profound virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生而不有，为而不恃，长而不杀，是谓玄德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 生而无有，劳而不恃，长而不被杀，谓之玄德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 生而不有，為而不恃，長而不宰，曰玄德。

text.ori_cn: § 第十一章 三十辐共一毂，当其无，有车之用。
text.man_en: 11 Thirty spokes unite around the nave; from their notbeing (loss of their individuality) arises the utility of the wheel.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XI Thirty spokes in one hub, when it is not, and there is a car for it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 11: Thirty spokes make up one hub. If it is not there, it can be used as a car.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 11: Thirty spokes converge upon a single hub; yet it is the space where there is nothing that the utility of the cart lies.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 11 三十根辐条围绕着中殿联合在一起；从它们的不存在（失去个性）中产生了车轮的效用。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 11 三十根辐条围绕中殿；从它们的不存在（失去它们的个性）中产生了轮子的效用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 三十辐共一毂，当其无，有车之用。

text.ori_cn: 埏埴以为器，当其无，有器之用。
text.man_en: Mold clay into a vessel; from its notbeing (in the vessel's hollow) arises the utility of the vessel.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When there is nothing in the clay, there is the use of the vessel.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The 叟埴 is regarded as a utensil, but it should be used as a utensil if it is not there.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Molded clay is used to make vessels; it is the emptiness within that makes them useful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 将粘土塑造成器皿；由于它（在器皿中空处）不存在，所以器皿才有用。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 将粘土模制成容器；从它的不存在（在容器的空心中）产生了容器的效用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 塑造陶土成器皿；正因为它的空无（在器皿的空洞中）才产生了器皿的用途。

text.ori_cn: 凿户牖以为室，当其无，有室之用。
text.man_en: Cut out doors and windows in the house (wall), from their notbeing (empty space) arises the utility of the house.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chiseling a door and lattice as a room, when it is not, there is a room for it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Cut out the door to make a room, pretend it doesn't exist, and use it as a room if there is one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By chiseling windows and doors to form a room, it is the empty space within that makes it functional.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在房屋（墙壁）上凿开门窗，从它们的不存在（空隙）中产生房屋的实用性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 把房子（墙）上的门窗剪掉，从它们的不存在（空的空间）中产生房子的实用性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 凿门窗于屋（墙）之中，屋之实处的功能源于这些空处之用。

text.ori_cn: 故有之以为利，无之用。
text.man_en: Therefore by the existence of things we profit. And by the nonexistence of things we are served.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, what is there for profit is not there.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is beneficial to have it, but it is of no use.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, usefulness comes from what is there, but the function arises from what is not there.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，事物的存在使我们获益。而事物的不存在则使我们受益。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，我们通过事物的存在而获利。由于事物的不存在，我们得到了服务。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故有之以利，无之以用。

text.ori_cn: § 第十二章 五色令人目盲，五音令人耳聋，五味令人口爽，驰骋畋猎令人心发狂，难得之货令人行妨。
text.man_en: 12The five colors blind the eyes of man; the five musical notes deafen the ears of man; the five flavors dull the taste of man; horseracing, hunting and chasing madden the minds of man; rare, valuable goods keep their owners awake at night.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 12 The five colours make the eyes blind, the five tones make the ears deaf, the five flavours make the mouth feel good, the galloping and hunting make the heart go mad, and the rare goods make one's life difficult.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 12: The five colors make one blind, the five tones make one deaf, the five tastes make one's mouth happy, the pursuit of hunting makes one's heart go crazy, and the rare goods make one's travels difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Twelve: The five colors blind the eyes, the five sounds deafen the ears, the five flavors dull the taste, racing and hunting derange the mind, and rare goods cause harmful behavior.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 12 五色蒙蔽了人的眼睛，五音震聋了人的耳朵，五味钝化了人的味觉，赛马、狩猎和追逐使人疯狂，稀有贵重的物品让主人夜不能寐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 12五种颜色使人的眼睛失明；五个音符震聋了人的耳朵；五味淡化人的味觉；赛马、打猎、追逐使人疯狂；稀有、贵重的物品让它们的主人彻夜难眠。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 五色令人目盲；五音令人耳聋；五味令人口爽；驰骋畋猎令人心发狂；难得之货令人行妨。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人为腹不为目，故去彼取此。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage: provides for the belly and not the eye. Hence, he rejects the one and accepts the other.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the saints are for the belly and not for the eye, so they go to the other side and take this one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is because the sage is his belly and not his eyes, so he goes to that place and takes this one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage values nourishment over appearance, hence he discards the superficial and embraces the substantive.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人：供养的是肚子，而不是眼睛。因此，他拒绝了一个，接受了另一个。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人曰：养腹而不养目。因此，他拒绝其中之一并接受另一个。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 是以圣人：为腹不为目，故取此舍彼。

text.ori_cn: § 第十三章 宠辱若惊，贵大患若身。
text.man_en: 13"Favor and disgrace cause one dismay; what we value and what we fear are within our Self. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XIII Favouring and disgracing, your great trouble if you are in the body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter Thirteen: Favor and disgrace are astonishing, and honor and disgrace are as great as their own.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Thirteen: Honor and disgrace come as a surprise; treat great trouble as you would your own body.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 13 "宠辱不惊，看淡看轻都是自我。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 13、“恩与辱，令人惊惶；我们所珍视的，我们所畏惧的，都在我们自己之中。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宠辱若惊，贵大患若身。

text.ori_cn: 宠为下，得之若惊，失之若惊，是谓宠辱若惊。
text.man_en: Those who receive a favor from above are dismayed when they receive it, and dismayed when they lose it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Favour is the next best thing, if you get it, you will be surprised, if you lose it, you will be spoiled.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be favored is to be humbled, to be surprised when you get it, and to be surprised when you lose it, is to say that you are frightened by being favored or humiliated.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Regard favor as something beneath you, and be startled when you receive it, and startled when you lose it; this is called being equally startled by both honor and disgrace.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从上天得到恩惠的人，在得到恩惠时会感到沮丧，在失去恩惠时也会感到沮丧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些从上头得到恩惠的人，在得到时会感到沮丧，在失去时会感到沮丧。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从上面获得恩惠的人，得到时惊慌失措，失去时也惊慌失措。

text.ori_cn: 故贵以身为天下，若可寄天下；爱以身为天下，若可托天下。
text.man_en: Therefore he who values the world as his self may then be entrusted with the government of the world; and he who loves the world as his self the world may then be entrusted to his care.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you are worthy of the world with your body, if you can send it to the world; if you love the world with your body, if you can trust it to the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you value your body as a person in the world, you can send it to the world; if you love your body as a person, it can support the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, he who values his life for the sake of the world may be entrusted with the world; he who cherishes his life for the sake of the world may be relied upon to govern the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，"以天下为己任 "的人就可以受托治理天下；"以天下为己任 "的人就可以受托照管天下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，以天下为己，则可以治理天下；以天下为己，则可以治理天下。爱世界如爱己的人，世界就可以托付给他照顾。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故贵以身为天下者，则可寄天下；爱以身为天下者，乃可托天下。

text.ori_cn: § 第十四章 视之不见名曰夷，听之不闻名曰希，搏之不得名曰微。
text.man_en: 14 Looked at, but cannot be seen that is called the Invisible (yi). Listened to, but cannot be heard that is called the Inaudible (hsi). Grasped at, but cannot be touched that is called the Intangible (wei).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XIV The name of seeing what is not seen is called barbaric, the name of hearing what is not heard is called Greek, and the name of wrestling what is not allowed is called microscopic.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 14: To see something but not see it is called barbarian; to hear it but not to be known is called Xi; to fight something but not to be called Wei is called Wei.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fourteen: What is looked at and cannot be seen is called the invisible. What is listened to and cannot be heard is called the inaudible. What is grasped and cannot be held is called the intangible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 14 望而不见，谓之隐（yi）。听而不闻，谓之罔（hsi）。抓而不可触，谓之无形（wei）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 14 虽见而不能见者，谓之无形。闻而不能闻者，谓之不可闻。抓住而不能触及的，称为无形（未）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 十四章：不可见，称之为夷；不可闻，称之为希；不可触，称之为微。

text.ori_cn: 此三者，不可致诘，故混而为一。
text.man_en: These three elude our inquiries and hence blend and become One.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: These three are not to be interrogated, so they are mixed together as one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: These three cannot be questioned, so they are mixed into one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: These three things cannot be thoroughly examined, hence they are merged into one.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这三者躲过了我们的探究，从而融为一体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这三者逃避了我们的询问，因此融合并合而为一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这三个问题逃脱了我们的探究，因此融合并成为一体。

text.ori_cn: 其上不皎，其下不昧。
text.man_en: Not by its rising, is there light, nor by its sinking, is there darkness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Its top is not bright and its bottom is not obscure.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The upper part is not bright, the lower part is not ignorant.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is neither bright above nor dark below.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不因它的上升而有光明，也不因它的下沉而有黑暗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不升则明，不沉则暗。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不是因为日出而有光明，也不是因为日落而有黑暗。

text.ori_cn: 绳绳不可名，复归于无物。
text.man_en: Unceasing, continuous, it cannot be defined, and reverts again to the realm of nothingness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The rope is unnamable and returns to nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The rope is nameless and returns to nothingness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The rope cannot be named, it returns to nothingness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 绵延不断，连绵不绝，无法定义，再次回归虚无的境界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 绵绵不绝，连续不断，无法界定，又归于虚无境界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无尽、连续，没有办法定义，又再次回到虚无之境。

text.ori_cn: 是谓无状之状，无物之象，是谓惚恍。
text.man_en: That is why it is called the Form of the Formless, the Image of Nothingness. That is why it is called the Elusive:
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is called the formless form, the image of nothing, and it is called the trance.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is called the state of being without form, the image of nothing, it is called trance.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called the form without form, the image without substance, and it is called indistinct and vague.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，它被称为无形之形、虚无之象。因此，它被称为 "难以捉摸"：
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故名无相之相、无相之象。这就是为什么它被称为难以捉摸的：
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么它被称为无形之形，无相之象。这就是为什么它被称为难以捉摸的原因：

text.ori_cn: 迎之不见其首，随之不见其后。
text.man_en: meet it and you do not see its face; follow it and you do not see its back.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I don't see the head when I welcome it, and I don't see the back when I follow it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When you welcome someone, you don't see the first one, and when you follow it, you don't see the rear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Approaching it, one cannot see its head; following it, one cannot see its tail.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 相见不相识，相随不见背。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 遇见它却看不见它的脸；跟着它走，你就看不到它的背影。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 迎之不见其首，随之不见其后。

text.ori_cn: 执古之道，以御今之有。
text.man_en: Adhere to the ancient ways to control the present.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To enforce the ancient ways against the present.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Adhere to the ancient ways to control the present.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By adhering to the ancient ways, one can manage the present.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 坚持古法，掌控当下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 坚持古法驾驭当下。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 依古法以治今。

text.ori_cn: 能知古始，是谓道纪。
text.man_en: Being able to know the beginning of ancient times is called Taoism.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be able to know the ancient beginnings is to be called a Taoist discipline.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being able to know the beginning of ancient times is called Taoism.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To know the beginning of the ancient times is called the essence of the Dao.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知古之始，谓之道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 能知太古之始，谓之道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 能知古始，谓之道。

text.ori_cn: § 第十五章 古之善为士者，微妙玄通，深不可识。
text.man_en: 15The wise ones of old had subtle wisdom and depth of understanding, so profound that they could not be understood.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XV The subtle and profound knowledge of those who were good as scholars in ancient times is incomprehensible.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 15: Those who were good scholars in ancient times had subtle and profound knowledge that was difficult to discern.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 15: The ancient masters of skillful leadership possessed subtlety and profound wisdom, incomprehensible and elusive.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 15 古代的智者有微妙的智慧和深邃的理解力，深邃得让人无法理解。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 15 古时的智者，有微妙的智慧和深奥的理解，深奥到无法理解。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古代的智者拥有精微的智慧和深刻的理解，他们的智慧深奥到难以理解。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯不可识，故强为之容﹕豫兮若冬涉川，犹兮若畏四邻，俨兮其若客，涣兮若冰之将释，敦兮其若朴，旷兮其若谷，浑兮其若浊。
text.man_en: And because they could not be understood, Perforce must they be so described: cautious, like crossing a wintry stream, irresolute, like one fearing danger all around, grave, like one acting as guest, Selfeffacing, like ice beginning to melt, genuine, like a piece of undressed wood, openminded, like a valley, and mixing freely, like murky water.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that is not recognisable, and therefore strong for the face: hesitant to wade through the river, if winter, if fearful of neighbours, just like a guest, lax, if the ice will be released, Dunxi, if it is simple, if it is open, if it is a valley, if it is muddy, if it is turbid.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I can't recognize it, so I made it look like: hesitant as if crossing the river in winter, still as if afraid of his neighbors, as if he were a guest, sluggish as if the ice was about to be released, calm as if he were plain, open as if in a valley, muddy It looks like turbidity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because it is elusive that I endeavor to describe its appearance: cautious like crossing a river in winter, watchful as if surrounded by danger, solemn like a guest, ready to melt like ice about to thaw, simple like uncarved wood, vast like a valley, and blending like muddy water.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为无法理解他们，所以必须这样描述他们：小心翼翼，就像趟过寒风凛冽的溪流；犹豫不决，就像担心周围会有危险；严肃认真，就像充当客人；自以为是，就像冰开始融化；真诚，就像一块没有穿衣服的木头；豁达，就像山谷；自由混合，就像浑浊的水。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为他们无法被理解，所以他们必须这样描述：小心翼翼，像渡过一条寒冷的小溪，优柔寡断，像一个担心周围有危险的人，严肃，像一个做客的人，谦虚，像冰开始融化，真诚，像一块未经修饰的木头，心胸开阔，像山谷，自由混合，像浑水。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 而且因为他们不能被理解，不得不这样形容——谨慎，像过冬日之河；犹豫，像畏险恐惧之人；庄重，像做客之人；谦逊，像初融之冰；真诚，像未雕琢之木；开放，像山谷；自在，像混浊之水。

text.ori_cn: 保此道者不欲盈，夫唯不盈，故能蔽不新成。
text.man_en: He who embraces this Tao Guards against being overfull. Because he guards against being overfull, he is beyond wearing out and renewal.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who protect this way do not want to be full, but only do not want to be full, so they can hide not new.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who protect this way do not want to be full, but they are not full, so they can hide and not be new.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who uphold this path do not wish to be full. Only by not being full can they avoid being worn out by constant renewal.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。因为守住了 "不餍"，所以才有 "不磨 "和 "不坠"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 奉此道者，防止过满。因为他防止过度充实，所以他不会疲惫和更新。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 抱道者，慎防盈满。因其慎防盈满，故不致磨损与更新。

text.ori_cn: § 第十六章 致虚极，守静笃。
text.man_en: 16 Attain the utmost in Passivity, hold firm to the basis of Quietude.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XVI To the Ultimate of Voidness, Keeping the Stillness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 16: Go to the extreme of emptiness and keep quiet.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 16: Attain utmost emptiness, uphold steadfast tranquility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 16 在被动中达到极致，坚守宁静的基础。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 16、被动至极，静基坚守。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 致虚极，守静笃。

text.ori_cn: 万物并作，吾以观复。
text.man_en: The myriad things take shape and rise to activity, but I watch them fall back to their repose.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All things work together, and I will observe the rest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All things are working together, and I observe them again.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things flourish together, and I watch their cyclical renewal.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 万物成形，活动起来，但我却看着它们归于平静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 万物成形并活跃起来，但我却看着它们又归于静止。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 万物生于行动，我观其归于宁静。

text.ori_cn: 夫物芸芸，各复归其根。
text.man_en: Like vegetation that luxuriantly grows but returns to the root (soil) from which it springs.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are many things, each returning to its roots.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Husband, everything is in a cloud, and each one returns to its roots.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things flourish and each returns to its root.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 就像植物生长茂盛，但又回归到它的根部（土壤）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 就像植物生长茂盛，但又回到它发芽的根部（土壤）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 像茂盛生长的植被，最终归根（泥土）而返。

text.ori_cn: 归根曰静，是曰复命。
text.man_en: To return to the root is Repose; it is called going back to one's Destiny.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Returning to the roots is said to be quiet, and it is said to be restorative.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Returning to the root is called tranquility, and this is called restoring life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Returning to the root is called tranquility; it is said to be the reversion to destiny.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 归根就是 "安息"，也就是回到自己的命运中去。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 回归本源，就是安息；这就是所谓的回到自己的命运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 复归于根是安宁；这被称为回归本命。

text.ori_cn: 复命曰常，知常曰明。
text.man_en: Going back to one's Destiny is to find the Eternal Law.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Restoration of life is said to be constant, and knowledge of constant is said to be clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Returning to life is called Chang, knowing Chang is called Ming.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Returning to the origin is called constancy, knowing constancy is called enlightenment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 回到自己的命运，就是找到永恒的法则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 回到自己的命运，就是寻找永恒的法则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 回归命运就是找到永恒的法则。

text.ori_cn: 不知常，妄作凶。
text.man_en: To know the Eternal Law is Enlightenment. And not to know the Eternal Law Is to court disaster.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I don't know what's normal and I'm making a mistake.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I don't know what's normal, and I act recklessly.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ignorance of the norm leads to reckless actions and disaster.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 了解永恒法则就是启蒙。而不了解永恒法则则会招致灾难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知道永恒的法则就是开悟。不知道永恒的法则，就是自招灾难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知晓永恒之法即是觉悟。不知永恒之法则是自取灭亡。

text.ori_cn: 知常容，容乃公，公乃王，王乃天，天乃道，道乃久，没身不殆。
text.man_en: He who knows the Eternal Law is tolerant; being tolerant, he is impartial; being impartial, he is kingly; being kingly, he is in accord with Nature; being in accord with Nature, he is in accord with Tao; being in accord with Tao, he is eternal, and his whole life is preserved from harm.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowing that there is always tolerance, tolerance is public, public is king, king is heaven, heaven is the way, the way is long, and there is no danger of losing one's body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Know that the appearance is permanent, the appearance is the male, the male is the king, the king is the sky, the sky is the Tao, the Tao is the long-term, and the body is not destroyed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To know constancy is to be tolerant. Tolerance leads to impartiality. Impartiality leads to kingliness. Kingliness leads to heaven. Heaven leads to the Tao. The Tao endures, and to the end of life, one is free from danger.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知永恒之法者，容也；容则大公，大公则王，王则顺乎自然，顺乎自然则合乎道，合乎道则永恒，永恒则终生不害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 懂得永恒法则的人是宽容的；宽容，则公正；不偏不倚，则为王；作为王，他顺应自然；合自然，则合道；合自然，则合道；合自然，则合道。合于道，则永恒，一生无害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知晓永恒法则的人是宽容的；宽容，他便是公正的；公正，他便是王者的；王者，他便是顺应自然的；顺应自然，他便是顺应道的；顺应道，他便是永恒的，而他的一生将免受伤害。

text.ori_cn: § 第十七章 大上，下知有之，其次亲而誉之，其次畏之，其次侮之。
text.man_en: 17 Of the best rulers the people (only) know that they exist; the next best the love and praise; the next they fear; and the next they revile.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XVII The great above, the next knows what is there, the next kisses and honours, the next fears, and the next insults.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 17 The superiors and subordinates know about them, the second is to be close to them and praise them, the third is to fear them, and the third is to insult them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Seventeen: The supreme ruler is scarcely known to his subjects. Next in line is the ruler who is loved and praised. Next comes the one who is feared. Lastly, is the ruler who is despised.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 17 对于最好的统治者，人民（只）知道他们的存在；其次是爱戴和赞美；再次是恐惧；再次是谩骂。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 17 最好的统治者只有人民知道他们的存在；其次是爱和赞美；接下来他们害怕；接下来他们就会辱骂。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 最好的统治者，人们仅仅知道他们的存在；其次好的，人民爱戴与称赞；再次的，人民畏惧；最差的，人民憎恨与诋毁。

text.ori_cn: 信不足焉，有不信焉。
text.man_en: When they do not command the people's faith, some will lose faith in them, and then they resort to oaths!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a lack of faith and there is disbelief.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't believe it enough, you don't believe it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the trust is insufficient, some may not believe.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当他们不能唤起民众的信仰时，一些人就会失去对他们的信任，然后他们就会诉诸誓言！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当他们不命令人民的信仰时，有些人就会对他们失去信心，然后他们就会诉诸誓言！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当他们不受人民的信任时，有些人就会失去对他们的信任，然后他们就会诉诸誓言！

text.ori_cn: 悠兮其贵言，功成事遂，百姓皆谓我自然。
text.man_en: But (of the best) when their task is accomplished, their work done, the people all remark, "We have done it ourselves. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The people are all saying that I am natural.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With his noble words, things come true, and the people all call me natural.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sage is reserved in speech, and when his work is accomplished and things are done, the people all say, 'We did it naturally.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但（最好的）任务完成后，工作完成后，人们都会说："是我们自己完成的。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但是（最好的人）当他们的任务完成、工作完成时，人们都会说：“我们自己完成了。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是（最优秀的）当他们的任务完成，他们的工作做完时，所有的人都说，‘我们自己完成了。’

text.ori_cn: § 第十八章 大道废，有仁义；智慧出，有大伪；六亲不和，有孝慈；国家昏乱，有忠臣。
text.man_en: 18 On the decline of the great Tao, the doctrine of "humanity" and "justice" arose. When knowledge and cleverness appeared, great hypocrisy followed in its wake. When the six relationships no longer lived at peace, there was (praise of) "kind parents" and "filial sons. " When a country fell into chaos and misrule, there was (praise of) "loyal ministers. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XVIII When the great way is abolished, there is benevolence and righteousness; when wisdom comes out, there is great hypocrisy; when the six relatives are not in harmony, there is filial piety and kindness; when the country is in a state of fugue, there are loyal ministers.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 18: When the great righteousness fails, there is benevolence and righteousness; when wisdom emerges, there is great hypocrisy; when relatives are at odds, there is filial piety and kindness; when the country is in chaos, there are loyal ministers.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 18: When the Great Tao ceases, there is benevolence and righteousness. When wisdom arises, there is great hypocrisy. When familial harmony is lacking, there is filial piety and parental love. When the state is in chaos, there are loyal ministers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 18 在大道衰落之时，"人道 "和 "正义 "学说应运而生。当知识和聪明出现时，巨大的虚伪随之而来。六亲不和，"父母慈"、"儿子孝 "就出现了。当国家陷入混乱和弊政时，人们（赞美）"忠臣"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 18 大道衰落，“仁”、“义”之说兴起。当知识和聪明出现时，随之而来的是巨大的虚伪。六亲不和时，有“慈父母”、“孝子”。国家乱乱，有“忠臣”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大道废，仁义出；智慧出，有大伪。六亲不和，有孝慈；国家昏乱，有忠臣。

text.ori_cn: §第十九章 绝圣弃智，民利百倍；绝仁弃义，民复孝慈；绝巧弃利，盗贼无有。
text.man_en: 19 Banish wisdom, discard knowledge, and the people shall profit a hundredfold; banish "humanity, " discard "justice, " and the people shall recover love of their kin; banish cunning, discard "utility, " and the thieves and brigands shall disappear.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XIX. If you give up wisdom for sainthood, the people will be benefited a hundredfold; if you give up righteousness for benevolence, the people will be filial and kind; if you give up profit for ingenuity, there will be no thieves and no robbers.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 19: If you abandon the sage and abandon wisdom, the people will benefit a hundredfold; if you abandon the benevolent and righteous, the people will return to filial piety and kindness; if you abandon the skillful and profitable, there will be no thieves.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Nineteen: Abandon wisdom, discard knowledge, and the people will benefit a hundredfold; abandon benevolence, discard righteousness, and the people will return to filial piety and compassion; abandon ingenuity, discard profit, and there will be no thieves or robbers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 19 放逐智慧，抛弃知识，人民将获利百倍；放逐 "人道"，抛弃 "正义"，人民将重拾亲情；放逐狡诈，抛弃 "实用"，盗贼和强盗将销声匿迹。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 19 摒弃智慧，抛弃知识，人民将得到百倍的利益；消灭“人性”，抛弃“正义”，人民就会恢复亲情；去掉狡诈，抛弃“功利”，盗贼就消失了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 废除智慧，丢弃知识，人民将获利百倍；废除“仁爱”，丢弃“正义”，人民将恢复对亲人的爱；废除狡诈，丢弃“功利”，盗贼和强盗将消失。

text.ori_cn: 此三者以为文不足，故令有所属﹕见素抱朴，少私寡欲。
text.man_en: As these three touch the externals and are inadequate, the people have need of what they can depend upon: reveal thy simple self, embrace thy original nature, check thy selfishness, curtail thy desires.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: These three thought that the text is not enough, so that there are affiliated: see vegetarian embrace simplicity, less selfish desire.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: These three people think that the literature is not enough, so they have their own affiliations: see simplicity, embrace simplicity, and have few selfish desires.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Considering these three as insufficient to create a comprehensive text, they are thus gathered under one principle: see the plainness, embrace the unadorned, reduce selfishness, and diminish desires.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 由于这三者触及外在而不足，人们需要他们可以依赖的东西：展现你的简单自我，拥抱你的原始本性，抑制你的自私，减少你的欲望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由于这三者是外在的，不够的，所以人民需要依靠：显露本性，拥抱本性，克制自私，节制欲望。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于这三点都涉及外在且不够全面，所以人们需要依靠可以信赖的东西：显现你纯真的自我，拥抱你原本的本性，克制你的私心，减少你的欲望。

text.ori_cn: 人之所畏，不可不畏。
text.man_en: That which men fear is indeed to be feared;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The fear of man is not to be feared.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What people fear, we must not be afraid of.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What man fears, one cannot but fear.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人之所畏，实为所惧；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人所畏惧的，确实值得畏惧；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们所害怕的确实是值得害怕的；

text.ori_cn: 众人熙熙，如享太牢，如春登台。
text.man_en: The people of the world are merrymaking, as if partaking of the sacrificial feasts, as if mounting the terrace in spring;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The crowd was as happy as if they were enjoying the dungeon, as if they were on stage in the spring.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The crowd was bustling, as if they were enjoying being in a prison, or as if they were on stage in spring.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People flock together, as if enjoying a grand feast, like ascending a stage in spring.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世人狂欢，犹如参加祭祀盛宴，犹如登上春天的阳台；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天下人欢腾，如祭祀盛宴，如登春台；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天下的人们都在欢庆，就像参与祭祀的筵席，又像在春天登上高台；

text.ori_cn: 我独泊兮其未兆，如婴儿之未孩；乘乘兮，若无所归。
text.man_en: I alone am mild, like one unemployed, like a newborn babe that cannot yet smile, unattached, like one without a home.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am alone in my boat and I have no sign of it, like a baby before it is born; I am riding on it, as if I have no place to return to.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I am alone, as if there is no sign of it, just like a baby without a child; I take advantage of it, as if I have nowhere to go.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I am solitary and unformed, like an infant not yet a child; drifting, as if having no place to return.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有我是温和的，就像一个失业者，像一个还不会笑的新生儿，无牵无挂，像一个没有家的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我一个人很温和，像一个失业者，像一个还不能微笑的新生婴儿，孤单，像一个没有家的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我独自一人温和，就像一个没有工作的人，像一个还不会笑的新生婴儿，无所依附，像一个没有家的流浪者。

text.ori_cn: 众人皆有余，而我独若遗。
text.man_en: The people of the world have enough and to spare, but I am like one left out,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is room for all, but I am the only one who is left behind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everyone has more than enough, but I am the only one left behind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Everyone seems to have more than enough, while I alone seem as if I have lost something.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世界上的人已经够多了，而且还有剩余，而我却像一个被遗弃的人、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天下人有余有余，我却如遭遗弃，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天下的人们都有足够的，没有缺乏，但我却像是被遗忘的人。

text.ori_cn: 我愚人之心也哉﹗ 沌沌兮，俗人昭昭，我独若昏。
text.man_en: my heart must be that of a fool, being muddled, nebulous!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I'm a fool's heart, too! Chaos is in the air, and the world is clear, but I'm alone in the dark.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I have a foolish heart! Chaos, common people are clear, I am alone like a coma.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Oh, my foolish heart! How confused and ignorant I am, while ordinary people are clear-minded; I alone seem to be in the dark.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我的心一定是个傻瓜，浑浑噩噩，模糊不清！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我的心一定是愚人般的，糊涂的，模糊的！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的心一定是个傻瓜，既糊涂，又朦胧！

text.ori_cn: 俗人察察，我独闷闷。
text.man_en: The vulgar are clever, selfassured; I alone, depressed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The common people are looking at it, and I'm bored.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The common people look at me, but I am alone.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The common people are busy and superficial, while I alone remain introspective and thoughtful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 庸人聪慧、自信；我孤独、消沉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 庸人聪明，自信；我一个人，郁闷。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 俗人精明、自信；唯我独自忧郁。

text.ori_cn: 澹兮其若海，漂兮若无止。
text.man_en: Patient as the sea, adrift, seemingly aimless.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Tanya is like the sea, drifting as if there is no end to it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It's as dull as the sea and floating as if it's endless.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Calm like the sea, drifting as if without end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 耐心如海，漂泊不定，似乎漫无目的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 耐心如大海，随波逐流，看似漫无目的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如大海般耐心，漂泊不定，似乎毫无目的。

text.ori_cn: 众人皆有以，而我独顽似鄙。
text.man_en: The people of the world all have a purpose; I alone appear stubborn and uncouth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am the only one who is stubborn and despicable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Everyone has it, but I am stubborn and despicable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All people have their purposes, but I alone am stubborn and seem foolish.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世界上的人都有自己的目标，只有我显得固执而粗鲁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世人皆有目的；唯独我显得固执、粗鲁。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世上的人都有目标；唯独我似乎固执而粗野。

text.ori_cn: 我独（欲）异于人，而贵食母。
text.man_en: I alone differ from the other people, and value drawing sustenance from the Mother.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I alone (wish) to be different from men, but I am worthy to eat my mother.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I only (desire) to be different from others, but I value my mother-in-law.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I alone value what is different from others, and cherish the nourishment of the source.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有我与其他人不同，我重视从母亲那里汲取养分。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 唯独我与其他人不同，重视从母亲那里汲取养料。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我独自不同于其他人，并重视从母亲那里汲取养分。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十一章 孔德之容，惟道是从。
text.man_en: 21 The marks of great Character follow alone from the Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXI The Compassion of Confucius and Virtue, but the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 21: Confucius’s appearance is based on the Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Twenty-One: The expression of great virtue follows only the Dao.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 21 伟大品格的标志只源于 "道"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 21 伟大品格的标志只能来自于道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 21 伟大品格的标志唯有源于道。

text.ori_cn: 道之为物，惟恍惟惚。
text.man_en: The thing that is called Tao is elusive, evasive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Tao is a thing of the world, but it is in a trance.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Tao is a thing, but it is in a daze.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Dao as a concept is elusive and indistinct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 被称为 "道 "的东西是难以捉摸、难以捉摸的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所谓“道”的东西是难以捉摸的、难以捉摸的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所谓的道是难以捉摸、难以掌握的。

text.ori_cn: 惚兮恍兮，其中有象；恍兮惚兮，其中有物。
text.man_en: Evasive, elusive, yet latent in it are forms. Elusive, evasive, yet latent in it are objects.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Trance, in which there is an image; Trance, in which there is something.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In a trance, there are images in it; in a trance, there are things in it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Vague and shadowy, yet within it there is form; shadowy and vague, yet within it there is substance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 朦胧的、难以捉摸的，但又潜藏其中的是形式。难以捉摸、难以捉摸却又潜藏其中的是物体。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 形式是难以捉摸的、难以捉摸的，但潜伏在其中。物体难以捉摸、难以捉摸，但潜伏在其中。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 闪烁、难以捉摸，但其中隐藏着形态。难以捉摸、闪烁，但其中隐藏着物体。

text.ori_cn: 窈兮冥兮，其中有精；其精甚真，其中有信。
text.man_en: Dark and dim, yet latent in it is the lifeforce. The lifeforce being very true, latent in it are evidences.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is a fair and meditative place, in which there is essence; its essence is very true, in which there is faith.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The beauty is dark, but there is essence in it; the essence is so true, there is faith in it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Deep and profound, within it there is essence; this essence is most real, and within it there is trustworthiness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 暗淡无光，却潜藏着生命力。生命力是非常真实的，其中潜藏着证据。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 黑暗而昏暗，却蕴藏着生命力。生命力非常真实，蕴藏在其中的就是证据。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 黑暗而幽暗，但其中隐藏着生命力。生命力非常真实，其中隐藏着证据。

text.ori_cn: 自今及古，其名不去，以阅众甫。
text.man_en: From the days of old till now its Named (manifested forms) have never ceased, by which we may view the Father of All Things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Since the present and the ancient times, its name does not go to read the House of Fathers.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: From now on and from ancient times, his name will never go away, so that he can be read by many famous people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From ancient times to the present, its name endures, witnessing countless generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从古至今，它的命名（显现的形式）从未停止过，我们可以通过它来观察万物之父。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从古至今，其名号（显现形式）从未停止过，借此我们可以见到万物之父。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 自古以来，它的命名（显现的形式）从未停止，通过这些我们可以看到万物之父。

text.ori_cn: 以此。
text.man_en: Through these (manifested forms)!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Take this.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As such.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过这些（表现形式）！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 通过这些（表现形式）！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过这些（表现形式）！

text.ori_cn: § 第二十二章 曲则全，枉则直，洼则盈，敝则新，少则得，多则惑。
text.man_en: 22 To yield is to be preserved whole. To be bent is to become straight. To be hollow is to be filled. To be tattered is to be renewed. To be in want is to possess. 6 To have plenty is to be confused.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXII. If it is crooked, it is whole; if it is in vain, it is straight; if it is puddled, it is full; if it is shabby, it is new; if it is little, it is gained; if it is much, it is confounded.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 22: The crooked one is complete, the wrong one is straight, the hollow one is full, the weak one is new, the less one is gained, and the more one is confused.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 22: The bent shall be made straight; the crooked, straight; the empty, full; the worn out, new; the few, obtain; the many, confused.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 22 屈就就是保持完整。弯曲就是变直。中空即被填满。破损是为了更新。匮乏就是拥有。6 丰富就是迷惑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 22、屈服就是保持完整。弯曲就是变直。空虚就要被填满。破烂就是更新。想要的就是拥有。 6 拥有充足，就会感到困惑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 屈则全，枉则直，洼则盈，弊则新，少则多，多则惑。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人抱一为天下式。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage embraces the One, and becomes the model of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the saints who hold one for the world style.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is the common practice of the world for a saint to hold one in his arms.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage embraces the One as a model for the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人拥抱 "一"，成为世界的典范。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人怀一，而为天下之范。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故圣人抱一，为天下式。

text.ori_cn: 不自见故明，不自是故彰，不自伐故有功，不自矜故长。
text.man_en: He does not reveal himself, and is therefore luminous. He does not justify himself, and is therefore farfamed. He does not boast of himself, and therefore people give him credit. He does not pride himself, and is therefore the chief among men.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Do not see yourself, therefore you are clear; do not be self-evident, therefore you are manifest; do not cut yourself down, therefore you are meritorious; do not boast, therefore you are long.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't see yourself, you will be wise; if you don't know what you are, you will be enlightened; if you don't cut yourself off, you will have merit; if you don't care about yourself, you will grow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He does not show himself, therefore he is luminous. He does not affirm himself, therefore he is prominent. He does not boast of himself, therefore he has merit. He does not glorify himself, therefore he is enduring.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他不显露自己，因此光彩照人。他不为自己辩解，因此远近闻名。他不自吹自擂，因此人们给予他赞誉。他不自傲，因此是人中的佼佼者。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他不显露自己，因此是发光的。他不为自己辩护，因此声名远播。他不自夸，所以人们才相信他。他不骄傲，因此是人类中的佼佼者。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他不自我表现，所以光彩照人。他不自我辩解，所以名声远扬。他不自我吹嘘，所以人们信任他。他不自我骄傲，所以成为了人中之首。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯不争，故天下莫能与之争。
text.man_en: My husband does not fight, so no one in the world can fight with him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that is not to be contended with is that there is no one in the world who can contend with it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: My husband does not fight, so no one in the world can fight with him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Because he does not compete, the world cannot contend with him.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我丈夫不打架，所以世界上没人能和他打架。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我丈夫不打架，所以天下没有人能与他打架。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我丈夫不争，所以世上没有人能与他争斗。

text.ori_cn: 古之所谓曲则全者，岂虚言哉﹗诚全而归之。
text.man_en: Is it not indeed true, as the ancients say, "To yield is to be preserved whole?”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The ancient so-called song is full of people, is it not a false statement!
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The ancient saying that the music is complete is not true! Return sincerely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The ancient saying that 'crooked will be made straight' is not an empty phrase! It is indeed true and can be returned to.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 古人云："屈则全"，难道不是这样吗？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真不是古人所说的“屈服，才能完整”吗？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古人说的“曲则全”难道不是真的么？

text.ori_cn: §第二十三章 希言自然。
text.man_en: Thus he is preserved and the world does him homage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: chapter xxiii. hippocratic nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 23: Hope it’s natural.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 23: Few Words, More Nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 就这样，他得到了保护，世人向他致敬。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此他得以保存，世人向他致敬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，他得以保存，世界向他致敬。

text.ori_cn: 故飘风不终朝，骤雨不终日。
text.man_en: 23Nature says few words: Hence it is that a squall lasts not a whole morning. A rainstorm continues not a whole day.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the wind does not end in the morning and the rain does not end in the day.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the wind does not last forever, and the showers last all day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a fierce wind does not last all morning, nor does a sudden downpour last all day.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 23大自然不善言辞：因此，狂风不会持续一上午。暴雨不会持续一整天。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 23大自然很少说话：因此，一场暴风雨不会持续整个早晨。暴雨持续不了一天。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 自然很少言语：因此，狂风不会持续整个上午。暴风雨不会持续整整一天。

text.ori_cn: 天地。
text.man_en: From Nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heaven and Earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven and Earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 摘自《自然》。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 来自自然。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 来自自然。

text.ori_cn: 故从事于道者，道者同于道，德者同于德，失者同于失。
text.man_en: Therefore it is that: he who follows the Tao is identified with the Tao. He who follows Character (Teh) is identified with Character. He who abandons (Tao) is identified with abandonment (of Tao).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, those who are engaged in the Way are the same as the Way, those who are virtuous are the same as the virtuous, and those who are lost are the same as the lost.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, those who practice Tao are the same as Tao, those who are virtuous are the same as virtue, and those who lose are the same as failure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, those who engage in the Way are one with the Way; those who engage in Virtue are one with Virtue; those who lose the Way and Virtue are one with their loss.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，遵循 "道 "的人与 "道 "相一致。从 "性 "者，即是 "性"；弃 "道 "者，即是弃 "道"。弃（道）者，弃（道）也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故曰：行道者，与道同一。遵循品格（Teh）的人就认同品格。放弃（道）的人就等同于放弃（道）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此：遵循道的人与道同一。遵循德的人与德同一。抛弃（道）的人与抛弃（道）同一。

text.ori_cn: 同于道者，道亦乐得之；同于德者，德亦乐得之；同于失者，失亦乐得之。
text.man_en: He who is identified with Tao Tao is also glad to welcome him. He who is identified with character Character is also glad to welcome him. He who is identified with abandonment Abandonment is also glad t welcome him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are the same as the Way, you will enjoy the Way; if you are the same as virtue, you will enjoy virtue; if you are the same as loss, you will enjoy loss.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are the same as Tao, Tao is also happy to gain it; those who are the same as virtue, virtue is also happy to gain it; those who are the same as loss, loss is also happy to gain it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are in harmony with the Way find joy in the Way; those who are in harmony with Virtue find joy in Virtue; those who are in harmony with loss find joy in loss.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 道者，道也。品格之人，亦喜迎之。弃者，弃也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 认同涛涛的人也很高兴地欢迎他。认同性格的人也很高兴地欢迎他。那些认同被遗弃的人也很高兴欢迎他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 同道者，道亦乐得之；同德者，德亦乐得之；同失者，失亦乐得之。

text.ori_cn: 信不足焉，有不信焉。
text.man_en: He who has not enough faith will not be able to command faith from others.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a lack of faith and there is disbelief.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't believe it enough, you don't believe it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If trust is insufficient, there will be distrust.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有足够信心的人，是无法命令别人有信心的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个人没有足够的信心，就无法要求别人有信心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 信念不足的人，无法让别人对他产生信念。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十四章 企者不立，跨者不行，自见者不明，自是者不彰，自伐者无功，自矜者不长。
text.man_en: 24He who stands on tiptoe does not stand (firm); he who strains his strides does not walk (well); he who reveals himself is not luminous; he who justifies himself is not farfamed; he who boasts of himself is not given credit;he who prides himself is not chief among men.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXIV He who attempts is not established, he who crosses himself is not able to do so, he who sees himself is not clear, he who is self-righteous is not manifest, he who cuts himself down has no success, and he who boasts of himself does not grow.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 24: Those who strive will not be established, those who cross will not be able to do it, those who see themselves will not understand, those who are self-righteous will not show themselves, those who cut down on themselves will have no success, and those who are proud of themselves will not grow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 24: Those who stand on tiptoe do not stand firm; those who stride do not walk far. Those who seek to shine dim their own light. Those who are self-righteous are not respected. Those who boast achieve nothing. Those who are arrogant do not endure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 24 踮脚的，站不稳；迈步的，走不好；显露自己的，不发光；为自己辩解的，不出名；自夸的，不得意；自傲的，不是人中的佼佼者。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 24、踮起脚尖的人，站立不稳；迈步不前的人，走得不好；显露自己的人，并不光明；为自己辩解的人，名声并不远；自我夸耀的人，不会得到荣誉；自我夸耀的人，不会为人所尊崇。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 踮脚站立者不稳，跨步过大者不行，显露自己者不光明，自我辩解者无远名，自夸者不信，自大者不为人上。

text.ori_cn: 其在道也，曰余食赘行。
text.man_en: These in the eyes of Tao are called "the dregs and tumors of Virtue, "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is also in the way, said the rest of the food is burdensome.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In the Tao, it is called "excessive food".
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As for being on the path, it is said to be like surplus food or an extra limb.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在道的眼中，这些被称为 "美德的糟粕和毒瘤"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这些在道的眼中被称为“德的糟粕和毒瘤”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这些在道的眼中被称为“德的渣滓和肿瘤，”

text.ori_cn: 物或恶之，故有道者不处。
text.man_en: which are things of disgust. Therefore the man of Tao spurns them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Things may be evil, so those who have the way do not live.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Things may be evil, so those who have the Tao will not live there.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Things that are disliked or evil, thus those who follow the Way do not dwell upon them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这些都是令人厌恶的东西。因此，"道 "之人唾弃它们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这是令人厌恶的事情。故道人鄙视之。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是令人厌恶的事情。所以，有道之人摒弃它们。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十五章 有物混成，先天地生。
text.man_en: 25Before the Heaven and Earth existed there was something nebulous:
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXV Something is mixed up and born before heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 25: There are things mixed together, born from heaven and earth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 25: There is a thing formless yet complete, born before heaven and earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 25在天地存在之前，有一种虚无缥缈的东西：
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 25天地还没有形成之前，有一个模糊的东西：
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地未形成之前，有一个模糊的存在：

text.ori_cn: 寂兮寥兮，独立而不改，周行而不殆，可以为天下母。
text.man_en: silent, isolated, standing alone, changing not, eternally revolving without fail, worthy to be the Mother of All Things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Silence, independence, and circumambulation can be the mother of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Silent and desolate, independent without changing, moving around without peril, she can be the mother of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Silent and vast, it remains unchanged in solitude, moving in cycles without exhaustion, it can be considered the mother of all under heaven.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无声无息，与世隔绝，茕茕孑立，不离不弃，永恒旋转，不愧为万物之母。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 寂静孤寂，独立不变，永转不衰，堪为万物之母。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 寂静、孤立、独自伫立、不变、永恒循环不息，堪称万物之母。

text.ori_cn: 吾不知其名，字之曰道，强为之名，曰大。
text.man_en: I do not know its name and address it as Tao. If forced to give it a name, I shall call it "Great. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I don't know its name, the word is Tao, and the strong name is Da.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I don't know its name, but it is called Tao. The name given by Qiang is Da.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I do not know its name, so I call it Tao. If I must assign it a name, I call it Great.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我不知道它的名字，只称呼它为 "道"。如果硬要给它起个名字，我就叫它 "大"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我不知道它的名字，称呼它为“道”。如果一定要给它起个名字，我会叫它“伟大”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我不知道它的名字，就称它为道。如果非要给它一个名字，我会称它为“大”。

text.ori_cn: 大曰逝，逝曰远，远曰反。
text.man_en: Being great implies reaching out in space, reaching out in space implies farreaching, farreaching implies reversion to the original point.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The big one is said to pass away, the pass away is said to be far away, and the far away is said to be the opposite.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The big day is called passing, the passing day is said to be far away, and the far away day is called reverse.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The great goes forth, what goes forth becomes distant, what becomes distant returns.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 伟大意味着拓展空间，拓展空间意味着深远，深远意味着回归原点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 伟大，就是向太空延伸，向太空，就是深远，深远，就是返璞归真。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 伟大意味着向外延伸，向外延伸意味着广泛影响，广泛影响意味着回到原点。

text.ori_cn: 故道大，天大，地大，王亦大。
text.man_en: Therefore: Tao is Great, the Heaven is great, the Earth is great, the King is also great.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the Tao is great, the sky is great, the earth is great, and the king is great.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the Tao is great, the sky is great, the earth is great, and the king is also great.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the Way is great, Heaven is great, Earth is great, and the king is also great.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故：道大，天大，地大，王亦大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故：道大，天大，地大，王也大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此：道大，天大，地大，王亦大。

text.ori_cn: 域中有四大，而王居其一焉。
text.man_en: There are the Great Four in the universe, and the King is one of them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are four great kingdoms in the domain, and the king lives in one of them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are four major ones in the domain, and the king occupies one of them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Among the domains, there are four great ones, and the king stands as one of them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 宇宙中有四大天王，国王就是其中之一。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宇宙中有四大天王，天王就是其中之一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宇宙中有四大强者，而国王是其中之一。

text.ori_cn: 人法地，地法天，天法道，道法自然。
text.man_en: Man models himself after the Earth; the Earth models itself after Heaven; the Heaven models itself after Tao; Tao models itself after nature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Man follows the law of the earth, the law of the earth follows the law of the sky, the law of the sky follows the law of the road, and the law of the road follows nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Man follows the earth, earth follows heaven, heaven follows Tao, and Tao follows nature.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People follow the earth, the earth follows the sky, the sky follows the Way, and the Way follows nature.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人法地，地法天，天法道，道法自然。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人类以地球为榜样；地效仿天；天以道为范本；道以自然为榜样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人法地，地法天，天法道，道法自然。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十六章 重为轻根，静为躁君。
text.man_en: 26 The Solid is the root of the light; the Quiescent is the master of the Hasty.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXVI Heavy is the root of lightness, and quiet is the king of restlessness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 26: Heaviness is the root of lightness, tranquility is the king of impatience.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 26: Heaviness is the root of lightness, and tranquility is the master of restlessness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 26 坚固者是光明的根源，安静者是匆忙者的主人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 26、实体是光的根；静止者是仓促者的主人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 重为轻根，静为躁君。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人终日行不离辎重。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage travels all day yet never leaves his provisioncart.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is why the saints travelled without provisions all day long.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the saint travels all day long without leaving his luggage.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage does not part with his provisions throughout the day.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人终日奔波，却从未离开过他的辎重车。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人终日行路而不离辎车。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人整日行走，却从不离开他的供应车。

text.ori_cn: 虽有荣观，燕处超然。
text.man_en: In the midst of honor and glory, He lives leisurely, undisturbed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Though there are honourable views, Yan is in a transcendent place.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although there is a view of glory, Yan is aloof.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Even amidst honor and splendor, one remains detached and serene.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在荣誉和荣耀中，他悠闲地生活着，不受干扰。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他生活在尊贵和荣耀之中，悠闲自在，不受干扰。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在荣誉和光辉之中，他悠闲地生活，不受打扰。

text.ori_cn: 轻则失本，躁则失君。
text.man_en: In light frivolity, the Center is lost; in hasty action, selfmastery is lost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are light, you will lose your roots, and if you are restless, you will lose your king.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you act lightly, you will lose your roots; if you act impetuously, you will lose your authority.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Impulsiveness leads to losing one's foundation, and rashness results in losing the ruler's favor.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 轻浮，失去了中心；匆忙，失去了自我。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在轻率的轻浮中，中心就消失了；行动仓促，就会失去自制力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 轻浮之时，中心迷失；急躁行动，自我克制丧失。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十七章 善行无辙迹，善言无瑕谪；善数不用筹策；善闭无关楗而不可开，善结无绳约而不可解。
text.man_en: 27A good runner leaves no track. A good speech leaves no flaws for attack. A good reckoner makes use of no counters. A wellshut door makes use of no bolts, and yet cannot be opened. A welltied knot makes use of no rope, and yet cannot be untied.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 27: Good actions have no ruts, good words have no flaws; good numbers do not need to be calculated; good closures have no doors that cannot be opened; good knots have no ropes that cannot be untied.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 27 Good deeds have no traces, good words have no flaws; good numbers do not require planning; good closures have no ties but cannot be opened; good knots have no ties but cannot be broken.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 27: A good man's practices leave no trace; a good man's words are free from fault. A skilled mathematician does not use counting tools; a skilled closer locks without bolts yet cannot be opened, and a skilled binder ties without rope yet cannot be untied.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 27 一位优秀的选手不会留下痕迹。善言者不留攻击破绽。善算者不使用计数器。好门不用闩，却打不开。绳结打得好，不用绳子也解不开。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 27、善跑者不留痕迹。好的演讲不会留下任何攻击的漏洞。一个好的算盘者不使用计数器。密闭的门没有使用螺栓，但无法打开。打结的结不用绳子，却无法解开。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 善跑者无迹可寻，善说者无漏可击。善算者不借筹码，用时心中无碍。关紧门不用闩锁，却无法开启；系良结不借绳索，亦无法解开。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人常善救人，故无弃人；常善救物，故无弃物，是谓袭明。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage is good at helping men; for that reason there is no rejected (useless) person. He is good at saving things;For that reason there is nothing rejected. This is called stealing the Light.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that the saint is always good at saving people, so he does not abandon them; he is always good at saving things, so he does not abandon them, and this is called attacking the bright.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage is always good at saving people, so he never abandons others; he is always good at saving things, so he never abandons things. This is called enlightenment.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage is always good at rescuing people, so there are no abandoned ones; always good at rescuing things, so there are no discarded things. This is called the enlightenment of inheriting illumination.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故圣人善救人，故无弃人（无用之人）。故圣人善救物，故无弃物。这就是所谓的偷光。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人善于帮助人；因此，不存在被拒绝（无用）的人。善于救物，是故无物不废。这就是所谓的窃取光。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人善于帮助人；所以没有被废弃的人。他善于挽救事物；所以没有被丢弃的东西。这就叫做偷光。

text.ori_cn: 故善人者，不善人之师；不善人者，善人之资。
text.man_en: Therefore the good man is the Teacher of the bad. And the bad man is the lesson of the good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the good man is the teacher of the bad man; and the bad man is the capital of the good man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, good people are teachers of bad people; bad people are resources of good people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, a good person is the teacher of a bad person; a bad person is the resource for a good person.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，好人是坏人的老师。坏人是好人的教训。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故善人为恶人之师。而坏人就是好人的教训。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故善人者，不善人之师；不善人者，善人之资。

text.ori_cn: 不贵其师，不爱其资，虽智大迷，是谓要妙。
text.man_en: He who neither values his teacher nor loves the lesson is one gone far astray, though he be learned. Such is the subtle secret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Not valuing his teacher, not loving his capital, though his wisdom is greatly lost, is to be wonderful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not appreciating his teacher, not loving his talent, even though his wisdom is great and deluded, it is said that he wants to be wonderful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one neither respects his teacher nor treasures his knowledge, even the wisest will be greatly confused. This is considered the essential subtlety.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 既不重视老师，也不热爱课程的人，即使学识渊博，也会误入歧途。这就是微妙的秘密。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不重视老师，不喜爱课程的人，虽然有学问，但已经误入歧途了。这就是微妙的秘密。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不重师、不爱学，虽聪明亦迷途，此乃微妙之秘。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十八章 知其雄，守其雌，为天下溪。
text.man_en: 28He who is aware of the Male but keeps to the Female becomes the ravine of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXVIII Knowing the male and keeping the female for the world's streams.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 28: Knowing the male and guarding the female are the streams of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 28: Know the strength, keep the gentleness; be the stream of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 28 知其雄而守其雌的人，会成为世界的峡谷。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 28、明知男性而固守女性的人，将成为世界的深渊。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知其雄，守其雌，为天下溪。

text.ori_cn: 为天下溪，常德不离，复归于婴儿。
text.man_en: Being the ravine of the world, he has the original character (teh) which is not cut up. And returns again to the (innocence of the) babe.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the world's streams, constant virtue is not departed from, but restored to infants.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For the world's stream, everlasting virtue will never leave, and return to the baby.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Be the watercourse of the world, constant virtue never departing, returning to the state of an infant.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 作为世界的沟壑，他拥有不被割裂的原始性格（teh）。再次回归（纯真的）婴儿。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 作为世界的沟壑，他有不被割断的本性（teh）。并再次回到婴儿（的纯真）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 作为世界的深谷，他拥有不被割裂的原始本性（德），并再次回归到婴儿的（纯真）。

text.ori_cn: 知其白，守其黑，为天下式。
text.man_en: He who is conscious of the white (bright) but keeps to the black (dark) becomes the model for the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowing its whiteness and keeping its blackness is the style of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Know its whiteness and guard its blackness, this is the way of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Know its brightness, maintain its darkness, and be the standard for the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他意识到了白色（明亮），却坚持黑色（黑暗），成为世界的楷模。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 意识到白色（明亮）但保留黑色（黑暗）的人成为世界的典范。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知其白，守其黑，为天下式。

text.ori_cn: 为天下式，常德不忒，复归于无极。
text.man_en: Being the model for the world, he has the eternal power which never errs, and returns again to the Primordial Nothingness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the world's style, the constant virtue is not the same, and it is restored to the limitlessness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is the style of the world, always virtuous but not too late, and returns to Wuji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To be an exemplar for the world, always maintain constant virtue and return to the boundless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 作为世界的楷模，他拥有永不犯错的永恒力量，并再次回归原始的虚无。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 作为世界的典范，他拥有永恒的力量，永不出错，回归本初虚无。
