text.man_en2gpt_cn: 作为世界的榜样，他拥有永不出错的永恒力量，并回归到本初的虚无。

text.ori_cn: 知其荣，守其辱，为天下谷，常德乃足，复归于朴。
text.man_en: He who is familiar with honor and glory but keeps to obscurity becomes the valley of the world. Being the valley of the world, he has an eternal power which always suffices, and returns again to the natural integrity of uncarved wood.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowing his honour and keeping his shame, he is the world's grain, and his constant virtue is enough to return to simplicity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing its glory and abiding by its disgrace, it is the valley of the world. It is sufficient to always be virtuous and return to simplicity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Know its glory, adhere to its humility, be the valley of the world. When your virtue is constant, you will return to simplicity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 熟知荣誉和荣耀，却一直默默无闻的人，会成为世界之谷。作为世界之谷，他拥有一种永恒的力量，这种力量总是足够的，并再次回归到未经雕琢的木头的自然完整性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 熟悉荣华富贵而默默无闻的人，就会成为世界的山谷。作为世界之谷，他拥有永远足够的永恒力量，并再次回归原木的自然完整性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 熟悉荣誉与光辉却守住默默无闻的人，成为了世界的谷。作为世界的谷，他拥有永恒的力量，永远充足，并再次回归到未经雕琢的天然本性。

text.ori_cn: 朴散则为器， 圣人用之，则为官长，故大制不割。
text.man_en: Break up this uncarved wood and it is shaped into vessel in the hands of the Sage they become the officials and magistrates. Therefore the great ruler does not cut up.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Park scattered is a tool, the saints use it, it is the official long, so the big system is not cut.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The simple powder is used as a weapon, and if a sage uses it, he becomes an official, so the great system cannot be cut off.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When simplicity is shaped, it becomes a tool. When the sage uses it, he becomes a leader, thus the great form does not cut off.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 把这些未经雕琢的木头打碎，在圣人手中就会变成器皿，他们就会成为官员和地方官。故大君不伐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 将这种未雕刻的木头打碎，在圣人手中塑造成器皿，他们成为官员和县令。故大君不斩。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 破此朴而为器，在智者手中化为官吏。因此，大治者不割裂。

text.ori_cn: § 第二十九章 将欲取天下而为之，吾见其不得已。
text.man_en: 29 There are those who will conquer the world and make of it (what they conceive or desire). I see that they will not succeed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXIX The world will be taken for the sake of the world, and I see that it is not to be taken for the sake of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 29: The general wants to take over the world, but I see that he has no choice but to do so.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 29: Those who wish to take the world and act upon it, I see that they will not succeed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 29 有些人要征服世界，把世界变成（他们所设想或渴望的）。我看他们不会成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 29 有些人将征服世界并创造它（他们所设想或渴望的）。我看到他们不会成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 二十九，有些人将征服世界，并使之成为（他们设想或渴望的样子）。我看他们不会成功。

text.ori_cn: 天下神器，不可为也，不可执也,为者败之，执者失之。
text.man_en: (For) the world is God's own VesselIt cannot be made (by human interference). He who makes it spoils it. He who holds it loses it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The divine weapon under heaven cannot be made or held, and those who make it will lose it, and those who hold it will lose it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The divine weapon in the world cannot be used or held. The one who tries it will lose it, and the one who holds it will lose it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The world is a sacred thing; it cannot be made, it cannot be held. Those who try to make it will fail, and those who try to hold it will lose it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (因为）世界是上帝自己的器皿，不能（通过人为干预）创造。制造它的人会毁坏它。持有它的人会失去它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （因为）世界是上帝自己的器皿，不可能（通过人类干预）创造出来。创造它的人就会破坏它。拥有它的人就会失去它。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为世界是神的容器，它不能被人为干预。他试图制造它，反而破坏了它。他试图掌控它，反而失去了它。

text.ori_cn: 故物或行或随，或歔或吹。
text.man_en: For: Some things go forward, some things follow behind; some blow hot, and some blow cold;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, things are either travelling or following, or snorting or blowing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The old things may move or follow, may be shaken or blown.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, things either act or follow, either sigh or blow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为有的东西向前走，有的东西跟在后面；有的东西吹得热，有的东西吹得冷；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为：有些事在前，有些事在后；有的吹热，有的吹冷；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有的事情向前推进，有的事情紧随其后；有的热烈，有的冷淡；

text.ori_cn: 或强或羸，或挫或隳。
text.man_en: some are strong, and some are weak; some may break, and some may fall.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Either strong or weak, frustrated or senatorial.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Either strong or weak, frustrated or defeated.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Whether you are strong or weak, whether you succeed or fail.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有的坚强，有的软弱；有的可能破碎，有的可能倒下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有的强，有的弱；有些可能会破裂，有些可能会掉落。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有些坚强，有些脆弱；有些可能会断裂，有些可能会倒下。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人去甚，去奢，去泰。
text.man_en: Hence the Sage eschews excess, eschews extravagance, eschews pride.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the sages who go to the extreme, to the extravagant, to the thaumaturgical.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage eliminates extremes, luxury, and tai.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage avoids excess, extravagance, and arrogance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人摒弃过度，摒弃奢侈，摒弃骄傲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人戒骄奢淫逸，戒骄奢淫逸，戒骄横。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人避开过度，避开奢华，避开骄傲。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十章 以道佐人主者，不以兵强天下。
text.man_en: 30He who by Tao purposes to help the ruler of men will oppose all conquest by force of arms.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXX He who supports his lord with the Way does not strengthen the world with his armies.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 30: He who assists his master with Dao will not strengthen the world with military force.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 30: Those who assist a ruler with the Dao do not conquer the world with force.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 30 以 "道 "助人君者，必反对一切武力征服。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 30 以道来帮助人君的人，将反对一切武力的征服。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以道辅君者，反对一切武力征服。

text.ori_cn: 其事好还。
text.man_en: For such things are wont to rebound.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Its a good thing to return.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It's a good thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It's a good thing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为这种事情总是会反弹。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为这样的事情往往会反弹。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为这类事情往往会产生反弹。

text.ori_cn: 师之所处，荆棘生焉。
text.man_en: Where armies are, thorns and brambles grow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Where the division is, thorns are born.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Where the teacher is, there are thorns.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where the army is stationed, thorns and brambles grow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 军队所到之处，荆棘丛生。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有军队的地方，就会长出荆棘和荆棘。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 兵家所至，荆棘丛生。

text.ori_cn: 大军之后，必有凶年。
text.man_en: The raising of a great host is followed by a year of dearth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: After the great army, there will be a bad year.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: After the army, there will be bad years.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: After a great army, there will inevitably be a year of calamity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在养育了一大批主人之后，随之而来的是一年的匮乏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 养育了一位伟大的主人之后，便是一年的匮乏。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 兴师动众之后，往往是一年的饥荒。

text.ori_cn: 善者果而已，不以取强。
text.man_en: Therefore a good general effects his purpose and stops. He dares not rely upon the strength of arms;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are good are only fruitful, not strong by taking.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Good deeds are just the result, do not seek to gain strength.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The benevolent reap their rewards without resorting to force.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，一个好的将军会达到他的目的，并且止步不前。他不敢依靠兵力；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，一个好的将军达到他的目的就会停止。他不敢依靠武力；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故善战者，其势险，其节止。敢不恃其力。

text.ori_cn: 果而勿矜，果而勿伐，果而勿骄。
text.man_en: effects his purpose and does not glory in it; effects his purpose and does not boast of it; effects his purpose and does not take pride in it;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Don't be reserved, don't cut down the fruit, don't be proud of the fruit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Don't be proud of the fruits, don't cut down the fruits, don't be arrogant if the fruits are fruitful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Achieve success without self-glorification, accomplish deeds without boasting, attain victory without arrogance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 实现自己的目标，而不以此为荣；实现自己的目标，而不以此自夸；实现自己的目标，而不以此为荣；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 实现他的目的而不以此为荣；实现他的目的而不自夸；实现他的目的，但并不以此为荣；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 成就了他的目的，却不以此为荣；成就了他的目的，却不夸耀；成就了他的目的，却不自豪；

text.ori_cn: 果而不得已，果而勿强。
text.man_en: effects his purpose as a regrettable necessity; effects his purpose but does not love violence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you have to do something, don't force it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Do it as a last resort, do it as a result but don't force yourself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Act only if necessary, and do not exert force.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在令人遗憾的必要情况下实现自己的目的；实现自己的目的，但不热爱暴力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 令人遗憾的是，他的目的必须实现；实现他的目的，但不喜欢暴力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 实现他的目的是一种令人遗憾的必要；实现他的目的，但不喜欢暴力。

text.ori_cn: 物壮则老，是谓不道，不道早已。
text.man_en: (For) things age after reaching their prime. That (violence) would be against the Tao. And he who is against the Tao perishes young.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When things grow strong, they grow old, and it is a long time since they have been in the wrong way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Things grow old when they are strong, which is called immorality, and immorality has already happened.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Things that reach their peak inevitably decline; this is against the Way, and what is against the Way comes to an early end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (因为）万物皆有衰老之时。那（暴力）就违背了道。而违背道的人则会英年早逝。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （因为）事物在达到鼎盛时期后就会老化。那（暴力）就是违背道的。逆道者，早亡。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 事物在达到鼎盛时期后会衰老。这种暴力行为是违反道的。而与道相抗者，早夭。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十一章 夫佳兵者，不祥之器，物或恶之，故有道者不处。
text.man_en: 31 Of all things, soldiers are instruments of evil, hated by men. Therefore the religious man (possessed of Tao) avoids them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 31 The good soldier is an ominous weapon, and things may be evil; therefore those who have the way do not live in it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 31: A good soldier is an unlucky weapon, something that may be evil, so he who has the right to do so will not live there.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Thirty-One: Good weapons are not instruments of fortune; they are despised by all things. Therefore, those who follow the Way do not rely on them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 31 在万物中，士兵是邪恶的工具，为人所憎恶。因此，虔诚的人（拥有 "道"）会避开他们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 31 在一切事物中，士兵是邪恶的工具，为人们所憎恨。因此，宗教人士（拥有道）会避开它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 三十一 不祥之器，兵也。故有道者不处。

text.ori_cn: 君子居则贵左，用兵则贵右。
text.man_en: The gentleman favors the left in civilian life, but on military occasions favors the right.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A gentleman's residence is to his left, and his use of arms is to his right.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When a gentleman lives, he values ​​the left; when using troops, he values ​​the right.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When at home, a gentleman values the left; in conducting military affairs, he values the right.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这位绅士在平民生活中偏爱左派，但在军事场合却偏爱右派。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君子在平民生活中偏左，在军事场合则偏右。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子在日常生活中喜好左边，但在军事场合喜好右边。

text.ori_cn: 兵者不祥之器，非君子之器，不得已而用之，恬淡为上。
text.man_en: Soldiers are weapons of evil. They are not the weapons of the gentleman. When the use of soldiers cannot be helped, the best policy is calm restraint.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The soldier is an ominous weapon, not a gentleman's weapon, and must not be used as a last resort; tranquillity is paramount.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Soldiers are an ominous weapon and are not the weapons of a gentleman. They should be used as a last resort, and tranquility is the best.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Weapons are instruments of ill omen, not instruments of a gentleman. They should be used only when necessary, and peace and tranquility are preferred.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 士兵是邪恶的武器。它们不是君子的武器。当无法避免使用士兵时，最好的政策就是冷静克制。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 士兵是邪恶的武器。它们不是绅士的武器。当用兵无计可施时，上策就是冷静克制。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 士兵是邪恶的武器。它们不是君子的武器。不得已而用兵时，最好的策略是冷静克制。

text.ori_cn: 胜而不美，而美之者，是乐杀人。
text.man_en: Even in victory, there is no beauty, and who calls it beautiful is one who delights in slaughter.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who wins and is not beautiful, but is beautiful, is happy to kill.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is victorious but not beautiful, and those who are beautiful are happy to kill people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Victory is not beautiful, and those who find beauty in it take pleasure in killing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 即使是胜利，也没有美丽可言，谁说胜利是美丽的，谁就是以屠杀为乐的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即使胜利了，也没有什么美，谁说美，就是喜欢杀戮的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 即使在胜利中也没有美感，称之为美的人是喜欢杀戮的。

text.ori_cn: 夫乐杀人者，则不可以得志于天下矣。
text.man_en: He who delights in slaughter will not succeed in his ambition to rule the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who delights in killing people will not be able to win the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who kill people in Fule cannot succeed in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one takes pleasure in killing, it is impossible for them to achieve their aspirations in the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以屠杀为乐的人，其统治世界的野心不会得逞。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 喜欢杀戮的人，他统治世界的野心是不会成功的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 喜好屠杀的人将无法实现统治世界的野心。

text.ori_cn: 吉事尚左，凶事尚右。
text.man_en: The things of good omen favor the left. The things of ill omen favor the right.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Good things come to the left, bad things come to the right.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Good things happen to the left, bad things happen to the right.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Auspicious events favor the left, while inauspicious events favor the right.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 好兆头的事情有利于左派。不祥之兆有利于右边。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 吉兆之事有利于左派。不祥之事有利于正义。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 吉祥的事情偏向左边。不祥的事情偏向右边。

text.ori_cn: 偏将军居左，上将军居右，言以丧礼处之。
text.man_en: The lieutenantgeneral stands on the left, the general stands on the right. That is to say, it is celebrated as a Funeral Rite.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The partial general was on the left and the superior general was on the right, and he said that he would be treated with funeral rites.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The general on the left is on the left, and the general on the right is on the right. It is said that they will be treated as funerals.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The vice general resides on the left, the top general resides on the right, and they conduct the rites as if it were a funeral.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 中将站在左边，将军站在右边。也就是说，这是一种葬礼仪式。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 中将站在左边，将军站在右边。也就是说，它是作为葬礼来庆祝的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 中将站在左边，将军站在右边。也就是说，这是作为葬礼仪式进行的。

text.ori_cn: 杀人之众，以哀悲泣之，战胜，以丧礼处之。
text.man_en: The slaying of multitudes should be mourned with sorrow. A victory should be celebrated with the Funeral Rite.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The multitude that kills, weeps with sorrow, overcomes, and is punished with funeral rites.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who kill people should mourn and weep, overcome them, and treat them with funeral rites.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When many lives are taken, mourn them with sorrow and tears. When you achieve victory in war, handle it as you would a funeral.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 众人被杀应悲痛哀悼。胜利应该用葬礼仪式来庆祝。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大量的屠杀应该引起悲伤的哀悼。胜利应该通过葬礼来庆祝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 众多人的杀戮应当以悲伤哀悼。胜利应当以丧礼庆祝。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十二章 道常无名，朴虽小，天下莫能臣也。
text.man_en: 32Tao is absolute and has no name. Though the uncarved wood is small, it cannot be employed (used as vessel) by anyone.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXXII The Way is often nameless, and though the Park is small, there is no one in the world who can minister to it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 32 The Tao is often nameless, and although it is simple, there is no one in the world who can do it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Thirty-Two: The Dao is always nameless. Though it is simple and small, nothing under heaven can subjugate it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 32 道是绝对的，没有名称。朽木虽小，不可为器。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 32道是绝对的，没有名字。未雕刻的木头虽小，却不能被任何人使用（用作器皿）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道是绝对的，无名。虽然这块未雕琢的木头很小，但谁也不能用它作为器物。

text.ori_cn: 侯王若能守之，万物将自宾。
text.man_en: If kings and barons can keep (this unspoiled nature), the whole world shall yield them lordship of their own accord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the Husbandman can keep it, all things will be his own guests.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the princes and kings can guard it, all things will be safe.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the rulers and nobility can adhere to it, all things will naturally come to them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果国王和男爵能够保持（这种未受破坏的天性），整个世界都会主动让他们称王称霸。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果国王和贵族能够保持（这种未受破坏的自然），整个世界都会自动归还他们的统治权。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果国王和男爵们能够保持（这片未经破坏的自然），整个世界就会自愿地臣服于他们。

text.ori_cn: 天地相合，以降甘露，民莫之令而自均。
text.man_en: The Heaven and Earth join, and the sweet rain falls, beyond the command of men, yet evenly upon all.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heavens and the earth are united in order to send down manna, and the people are not ordered to equalise themselves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heaven and earth are united to bring down nectar, and the people do not obey orders but act in harmony.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When heaven and earth are in harmony, sweet dew descends; the people are not commanded, yet they prosper equally.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天地相合，甘霖降下，虽非人力所能控制，但却均匀地洒向所有人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天地合一，甜雨倾盆而下，不受人的控制，但却均匀地落在所有人身上。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地合而甘霖降，不违人之命，均洒万物。

text.ori_cn: 始制有名，名亦既有，夫亦将知止，知止所以不殆。
text.man_en: Then human civilization arose and there were names. Since there were names, it were well one knew where to stop. He who knows where to stop may be exempt from danger.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The beginning of the system has a name, the name also has, the husband will also know stop, know stop so not dangerous.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a name in the beginning, and the name is already there. You will also know the stop. Knowing the stop, you will not be in danger.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the earliest distinctions were made, names came into existence. Once names exist, we should also understand their boundaries. Understanding these boundaries is why there is no danger.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 后来，人类文明兴起，有了名字。既然有了名字，人们就应该知道在哪里停下脚步。知道在哪里停下脚步的人，就可能免于危险。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 然后人类文明出现了，有了名字。既然有名字，就知道该停在哪里。知止者，可免危险。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然后人类文明产生了，名字也就有了。既然有了名字，就应当知道何时停止。知道何时停止的人可以免于危险。

text.ori_cn: 譬道之在天下，犹川谷之于江海。
text.man_en: Tao in the world may be compared to rivers that run into the sea.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For example, the way of the world is like the river and the valley in the river and the sea.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: For example, the Tao is in the world, just like the rivers and valleys are in the rivers and seas.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of the Dao in the world is like the rivers and valleys to the great seas.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世界上的 "道 "可以比作汇入大海的河流。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世间之道，好比江河入海。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道在世间可以比作流入大海的河流。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十三章 知人者智，自知者明。
text.man_en: 33He who knows others is learned; he who knows himself is wide.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXXIII Knowledge of others and self-knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 33: He who knows others is wise, and he who knows himself is wise.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 33: He who understands others is intelligent; he who understands himself is enlightened.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 33 知人者博，自知者宽。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 33、懂得别人的人，就是有学问的人；自知者宽。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知人者智，自知者明。

text.ori_cn: 胜人者有力，自胜者强。
text.man_en: He who conquers others has power of muscles; he who conquers himself is strong.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who wins is powerful, and he who wins himself is strong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He who conquers others is powerful, and he who conquers himself is strong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 征服他人者，肌肉有力；征服自己者，身体强壮。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 征服别人的人，有肌肉的力量；战胜自己的人是坚强的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 能征服别人的人，有肌肉的力量；能征服自己的人，才是真正的强者。

text.ori_cn: 知足者富。
text.man_en: He who is contented is rich.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are contented are rich.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He who is content is rich.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Contentment is wealth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知足者富。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知足的人是富有的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知足者富。

text.ori_cn: 强行者有志。
text.man_en: He who id determined has strength of will.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Strong walkers have a will.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The strong have the will.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who are strong-willed have determination.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有决心的人就有力量。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 下定决心的人就有坚强的意志。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有志者事竟成。

text.ori_cn: 不失其所者久。
text.man_en: He who does not lose his center endures.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: He who does not lose his place for a long time.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who do not lose their place will last forever.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who do not lose their position endure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不失去中心的人，才能持久。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不失去中心的人就能忍受。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不失其所者久存。

text.ori_cn: 死而不亡者寿。
text.man_en: He who dies yet (his power) remains has long life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who die and do not die live.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He who dies but does not die will live longer.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who die but are not forgotten live forever.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 死而（其力）不灭者长寿。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 死者（其力量）尚存者，寿命较长。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 死而不亡者寿。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十四章 大道泛兮，其可左右。
text.man_en: 34 The Great Tao flows everywhere, (Like a flood) it may go left or right.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 34: The Great Way is Panacea, and it can be swayed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 34: The road is vast and can be controlled.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 34: The great Dao is broad and expansive, it can be both left and right.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 34 "大道之行也，天下为公。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 34 大道无处不在，可左可右。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 三十四章：大道泛兮，其可左右。

text.ori_cn: 万物恃之而生而不辞，功成不名有。
text.man_en: The myriad things derive their life from it, and it does not deny them. When its work is accomplished, it does not take possession.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All things are born on the back of it without resignation, and the work is done without the name thereof.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All things rely on it to come into existence without hesitation, and achievements are not recognized.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things depend on it for life and do not resent it, achieving success but not claiming credit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 万物从它那里获得生命，而它并不否认它们。当它的工作完成时，它不会占有它们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 万物从它得生，它也不否定它们。当它的工作完成后，它不会占有。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 万物生于此，而不拒绝它们。功成事遂，而不居功。

text.ori_cn: 衣养万物而不为主，常无欲，可名于小；万物归焉而不为主，可名为大。
text.man_en: It clothes and feeds the myriad things, yet does not claim them as its own. Often (regarded) without mind or passion, it may be considered small. Being the home of all things, yet claiming not, it may be considered great.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Clothes that nourish all things without being dominant, often without desire, can be named small; all things that return without being dominant, can be named large.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Clothes nourish all things but do not take over, and are always without desires, which can be called small; when all things return without taking over, they can be called big.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Clothes nurture all things yet do not become their master; being always free of desire, it can be called small. All things return to it without it becoming their master; it can be called great.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它为无数万物提供衣食，却并不将它们据为己有。它常常（被认为）没有思想或激情，因此可能被认为是渺小的。它是万物的家园，却不以万物为己有，可谓伟大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 它为万物提供衣食，却不将万物据为己有。通常（被认为）没有头脑或热情，它可能会被认为是小事。为万物之所，而不自称，可谓伟大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 它使万物得以穿衣和饱食，却不将它们据为己有。常常被视为无心无情，它可以被认为是渺小的。作为万物的家，却不据为己有，它可以被认为是伟大的。

text.ori_cn: 以其终不自为大，故能成其大。
text.man_en: Because to the end it does not claim greatness, its greatness is achieved.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: By the fact that it does not end up being great, it can become great.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Because in the end he does not think he is great, he can become great.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Because it never considers itself great, it is able to achieve greatness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为到最后，它并不要求伟大，它的伟大已经实现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为到最后它并不声称伟大，它的伟大已经实现了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正因为它从不自夸伟大，所以才成就了它的伟大。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十五章 执大象，天下往。
text.man_en: 35Hold the Great Symbol and all the world follows,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 35 The world goes in the direction of the elephant in the sky.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 35: Holding the elephant, the world will go.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 35: Embracing the Great Image, the world follows.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 35 握住伟大的象征，全世界都会跟随、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 35、举起伟大的标志，全世界都会跟随，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 执大象，天下往。

text.ori_cn: 往而不害，安平太。
text.man_en: follows without meeting harm, (and lives in) health, peace, commonwealth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Go to and do no harm, Anping Tai.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Go without harming, Anpingtai.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Advance without causing harm, and you will find peace and stability.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不受伤害，（并生活在）健康、和平、富裕之中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 继而不受伤害，（并生活在）健康，和平，联邦。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 跟随没有遇到伤害，（并且生活在）健康、和平、普遍的福祉中。

text.ori_cn: 乐与饵，过客止。
text.man_en: Offer good things to eat and the wayfarer stays.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Joy and bait, passers-by stop.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Pleasure and bait, passers-by stop.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With music and bait, travelers are halted.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 提供好吃的，路人就会留下来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 提供好东西让行人留下来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 提供美食，旅人就会留下。

text.ori_cn: 道之出口，淡乎其无味，视之不足见，听之不足闻，用之不可既。
text.man_en: But Tao is mild to the taste. Looked at, it cannot be seen; listened to, it cannot be heard;applied, its supply never fails.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The exit of the Tao is so light that it is tasteless; it is not enough to see it, not enough to hear it, and not enough to use it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The outlet of the Tao is so bland and tasteless that it cannot be seen by sight, cannot be heard by hearing, and cannot be used.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Dao that can be spoken is bland and without flavor; look at it and it is not visible, listen to it and it cannot be heard, use it and it is inexhaustible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但 "道 "是温和的。视而不见，听而不闻，用而不竭。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但陶的味道很温和。看着，却看不见；听之，则不可闻；应用之，则其源不绝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是，道尝起来很温和。看它，看不见；听它，听不到；用它，它的供应永远不会失败。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十六章 将欲歙之，必固张之；将欲弱之，必固强之；将欲废之，必固兴之；将欲夺之，必固与之。
text.man_en: 36 He who is to be made to dwindle (in power) must first be caused to expand. He who is to be weakened must first be made strong. He who is to be laid low must first be exalted to power. He who is to be taken away from must first be given,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 36: If a man wishes to be shewed, he must be spread out; if he wishes to be weakened, he must be strengthened; if he wishes to be abolished, he must be raised up; if he wishes to be taken away, he must be taken away with him.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 36: If you want to eliminate something, you must strengthen it; if you want to weaken it, you must strengthen it; if you want to destroy it, you must strengthen it; if you want to seize it, you must strengthen it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 36: To compress something, one must first expand it; to weaken something, one must first strengthen it; to abolish something, one must first promote it; to seize something, one must first give it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 36 要使（力量）减弱的人，必须先使力量增强。欲使其衰弱者，必先使其强大。欲使其衰微者，必先使其强大。欲夺之者，必先予之、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 36 欲使其衰弱者，必先使其扩张。欲弱者，必先强者。欲被贬低的人必须首先被提升为权力。欲被夺走的人必须先被给予，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 将欲歙之，必固张之；将欲弱之，必固强之；将欲废之，必固兴之；将欲夺之，必固与之。

text.ori_cn: 是谓微明。
text.man_en: this is the Subtle Light.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's called micro-mindfulness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It's called twilight.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called subtle illumination.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是微妙之光。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是微妙的光。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是微妙的光。

text.ori_cn: 柔弱胜刚强。
text.man_en: Gentleness overcomes strength:
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Softness is better than strength.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Weakness prevails over strength.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gentleness overcomes strength.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以柔克刚
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 温柔胜过力量：
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 柔能克刚

text.ori_cn: 鱼不可脱于渊，国之利器不可以示人。
text.man_en: fish should be left in the deep pool, and sharp weapons of the state should be left where none can see them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A fish must not be dislodged from the abyss, and the weapon of the state must not be shown to the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Fish cannot be escaped from the abyss, and the sharp weapons of the country cannot be shown to others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A fish cannot leave the deep waters, and the nation's vital tools should not be revealed to others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 鱼应该被留在深潭里，国家的利器应该被放在无人能看到的地方。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 鱼要放在深潭里，国家的利器要放在别人看不见的地方。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 鱼应当留在深池，国家的锐器应当藏于无形。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十七章 道常无为而无不为。
text.man_en: 37The Tao never does, yet through it everything is done.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 37: The Tao is always doing nothing and not doing anything.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 37 The Tao always does nothing but does everything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 37: The Dao always takes no action, yet leaves nothing undone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 37 "道 "从不做任何事，但通过 "道 "却能完成一切。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 37、道从来不做事，但通过它，一切都得以完成。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道常无为而无不为。

text.ori_cn: 侯王若能守之，万物将自化。
text.man_en: If princes and dukes can keep the Tao, the world will of its own accord be reformed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the Husbandman can keep it, all things will transform themselves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the princes and kings can guard it, all things will transform themselves.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the rulers and nobility can adhere to it, all things will naturally transform.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 王公守道，天下自化。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 诸侯、诸侯若能守道，天下自然而然。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 若王侯能守道，天下自会改良。

text.ori_cn: 化而欲作，吾将镇之以无名之朴。
text.man_en: When reformed and rising to action, let it be restrained by the Nameless pristine simplicity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the transformation is ready to be made, I will subdue it to the nameless simplicity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you want to transform it into something, I will suppress it with nameless simplicity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When desires arise, I shall quell them with the simplicity of the nameless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当改革和行动起来时，让无名的质朴来约束它。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当改革并采取行动时，让它受到无名的原始简单的约束。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当改过自新、奋起行动时，让它受到无名的原始简朴的约束。

text.ori_cn: 无名之朴，夫亦将无欲。
text.man_en: The Nameless pristine simplicity is stripped of desire (for contention).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The simplicity of the nameless, the husband will also have no desire.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Nameless simplicity, the husband will also have no desires.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nameless simplicity will also lead to a lack of desire.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无名的质朴被剥夺了欲望（为了争夺）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无名的质朴被剥夺了欲望（争夺）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无名的纯朴被剥夺了竞争的欲望。

text.ori_cn: 不欲以静，天下将自定。
text.man_en: By stripping of desire quiescence is achieved, and the world arrives at peace of its own accord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you don't want to be quiet, the world will set itself.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't want to be still, the world will be determined by itself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without desiring stillness, the world will settle itself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 欲望被剥离，世界就会自动归于平静。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 通过剥夺欲望，就可以达到寂静，世界就会自动达到和平。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 剥离欲望，便获得宁静，世界将自然归于平和。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十八章 上德不德，是以有德；下德不失德，是以无德。
text.man_en: 38The man of superior character is not (conscious of his) character. Hence he has character. The man of inferior character (is intent on) not losing character. Hence he is devoid of character.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXXVIII The upper virtues are not virtuous; the lower virtues do not lose their virtue.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 38: Being virtuous is not virtuous, so it is virtuous; being virtuous is not virtuous, so it is unvirtuous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 38: The highest virtue is not virtuous, and thus it possesses virtue. Lower virtue never loses virtue, and thus it lacks virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 38 品格高尚的人不会（意识到自己的）品格。因此他有品格。品格低劣的人，（一心想）不失去品格。因此他没有品格。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 38、品德高尚的人并不（意识到自己的）品格。因此他有性格。品格低下的人（一心）不失品格。因此他缺乏个性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上德不德，是以有德；下德不失德，是以无德。

text.ori_cn: 上德无为而无以为；下德为之而有以为。
text.man_en: The man of superior character never acts, nor ever (does so) with an ulterior motive. The man of inferior character acts, and (does so) with an ulterior motive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The upper virtues do nothing but think nothing; the lower virtues do something but think something.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The superior virtues do nothing but have no thoughts; the inferior virtues do nothing but have thoughts.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The highest virtue is to act without striving; the lower virtue is to act with deliberate effort.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 品格高尚的人从不行动，也从不（出于不可告人的动机）行动。品行低劣的人行事，（这样做）却别有用心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 高品格的人从来不做事，也不做别有用心的事。品德低下的人行事，并且是别有用心的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上德不德，是以有德；下德不失德，是以无德。

text.ori_cn: 上仁为之而无以为；上义为之而有以为。
text.man_en: The man of superior kindness acts, but (does so) without an ulterior motive. The man of superior justice acts, and (does so) with an ulterior motive.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The upper benevolence is for it without thought; the upper righteousness is for it with thought.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The superior benevolence does it without thinking; the superior righteousness does it without thinking.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The highest virtue acts without seeking to act; the highest righteousness acts yet seeks to act.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 仁者无敌，但（这样做）却别有用心。高尚正义的人行事，（这样做）却别有用心。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 至善之人的行为，却没有别有用心。正义至上的人行事，而且是别有用心的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上德之人行事，却没有私心。上义之人行事，却怀有私心。

text.ori_cn: 上礼为之而莫之应， 则攘臂而扔之。
text.man_en: (But when) the man of superior li acts and finds no response, he rolls up his sleeves to force it on others.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are unable to respond to the courtesies of your superiors, you will throw your arms at them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you don't respond to the gift, you will throw it away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If the highest form of courtesy is met with no response, then one shall roll up their sleeves and toss it aside.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (但是，当）高人一等的人采取行动却得不到回应时，他就会卷起袖子强加于人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 礼上人有所作为，得不到回应，就卷起袖子强加于人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君子行礼而无应者，捋袖强之。

text.ori_cn: 故失道而后德，失德而后仁，失仁而后义，失义而后礼。
text.man_en: Therefore: after Tao is lost, then (arises the doctrine of) humanity. After humanity is lost, then (arises the doctrine of) justice. After justice is lost, then (arises the doctrine of) li.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you lose the Way, then you will have virtue; if you lose virtue, then you will have benevolence; if you lose benevolence, then you will have righteousness; if you lose righteousness, then you will have rites.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, losing virtue will lead to virtue, losing virtue will lead to benevolence, losing benevolence will lead to righteousness, and losing righteousness will lead to propriety.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, when the Way is lost, there comes virtue; when virtue is lost, there comes benevolence; when benevolence is lost, there comes righteousness; when righteousness is lost, there comes propriety.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此：道失，则（产生）人性论。人道既失，则（产生）正义学说。正义既失，则（产生）利之说。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故道失而后人。人性丧失后，正义就会出现。失去正义之后，便产生了礼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以：失道而后德，失德而后仁，失仁而后义，失义而后礼。

text.ori_cn: 夫礼者，忠信之薄，而乱之首。
text.man_en: Now li is the thinning out of loyalty and honesty of heart. And the beginning of chaos.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ritual is the thinning of loyalty and trust, and the first of chaos.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband's propriety is weak in loyalty and leads to chaos.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Indeed, propriety is the thin layer of loyalty and trust, yet the source of disorder.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，"李 "是忠诚和诚实之心的稀释。乱之始也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在的“礼”，就是内心的忠诚和诚实的淡化。以及混乱的开始。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如今，礼已经是忠诚和诚心的稀薄之物，也是一切混乱的开始。

text.ori_cn: 前识者，道之华，而愚之始。
text.man_en: The prophets are the flowering of Tao and the origin of folly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The former knowledge is the splendour of the Way, but the beginning of foolishness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who know before are the brilliance of Tao and the beginning of foolishness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Foreknowledge is the flower of the Way, but it is also the beginning of folly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 先知是道的花朵，也是愚蠢的起源。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 先知是道的绽放，也是愚昧的起源。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 先知是道的盛开，也是愚蠢的根源。

text.ori_cn: 是以大丈夫处其厚，不居其薄；处其实，不居其华。
text.man_en: Therefore the noble man dwells in the heavy (base), and not in the thinning (end). He dwells in the fruit, and not in the flowering (expression).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that a great man is in his thickness, not in his thinness; in his truth, not in his splendour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a true man should be concerned with what is good and not what is weak; he should be concerned with truth and not be concerned with luxury.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a true gentleman upholds substance over superficiality and values reality over ornamentation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，高尚的人居住在厚重（底部），而不是稀薄（末端）。他住在果实中，而不是住在花朵（表达）中。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故君子居于重（下），不居于薄（末）。他住在果实中，而不是在开花（表达）中。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故君子居厚而不居薄，居实而不居华。

text.ori_cn: 故去彼取此。
text.man_en: Therefore he rejects the one and accepts the other.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: So go to the other side and take this one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: So go to that one and take this one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Abandon that, seize this.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，他拒绝了一个，接受了另一个。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此他拒绝其中之一并接受另一个。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，他拒绝了一个，接受了另一个。

text.ori_cn: § 第三十九章 昔之得一者，天得一以清，地得一以宁，神得一以灵，谷得一以盈，万物得一以生，侯王得一以为天下正。
text.man_en: 39 There were those in ancient times possessed of the One; through possession of the One, the Heaven was clarified, through possession of the One, the Earth was stabilized, through possession of the One, the gods were spiritualized, through possession of the One, the valleys were made full, through possession of the One, all things lived and grew, through possession of the One, the princes and dukes became the ennobled of the people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 39 In the past, when a person obtained one, heaven obtained one to be clear, the earth obtained one to be peaceful, God obtained one to be spiritual, grain obtained one to be full, everything obtained one to be born, and the king obtained one to be the rightful ruler of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter Thirty-Nine: In the past, those who had one, the sky would be clear, the earth would be peaceful, the gods would be spiritual, the grains would be full, all things would be alive, and the princes would think the world is right.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 39: Those who attained the One in ancient times: Heaven attained the One and became clear, Earth attained the One and became serene, Spirits attained the One and became powerful, Valleys attained the One and became full, All things attained the One and received life, Rulers attained the One and became the correct leaders of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 39 古代有人拥有 "一"；拥有 "一"，天得以澄清；拥有 "一"，地得以稳固；拥有 "一"，诸神得以灵化；拥有 "一"，山谷得以丰满；拥有 "一"，万物得以生生不息；拥有 "一"，王公贵族成为人民的贵族。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 39 古时有人拥有“一”；因一而天清，因一而地安，因一而神灵，因一而山谷充盈，因一而充盈。万物生生，拥有一者，诸侯诸侯成为人民的贵人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古之得一者，天得一以清，地得一以宁，神得一以灵，谷得一以盈，万物得一以生，侯王得一以为天下正。

text.ori_cn: 其致之，天无以清将恐裂，地无以宁将恐废，神无以灵将恐歇，谷无以盈将恐竭，万物无以生将恐灭，侯王无以贵高将恐蹶。
text.man_en: that was how each became so. Without clarity, the Heavens would shake, without stability, the Earth would quake, without spiritual power, the gods would crumble, without being filled, the valleys would crack, without the lifegiving power, all things would perish, without the ennobling power, the princes and dukes would stumble.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The result of this, the sky is not to clear will be afraid of cracking, the ground is not to Ning will be afraid of waste, God is not to the spirit will be afraid of rest, the valley is not to the surplus will be afraid of exhaustion, everything is not to the birth will be afraid of extinction, the king of the marquis is not to the noble and high will be afraid of the collapse.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: As a result, if the sky is not clear, it will burst into pieces; if the earth is not peaceful, it will be ruined; if the gods are not spirited, it will be afraid of resting; if the grains are not full, they will be exhausted; if all things are not alive, they will be destroyed; if the princes and kings are not noble, they will be destroyed. Will be terrified.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If it reaches this point, the heaven would lose its clarity, fearing it may split; the earth would lose its tranquility, fearing it may collapse; the spirits would lose their vitality, fearing they may perish; the valleys would lose their fullness, fearing they may dry up; all living things would lose their life, fearing they may be extinguished; the lords and kings would lose their exalted status, fearing they may fall.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 每个人都是这样变成的。没有清明，天会摇晃；没有稳定，地会震动；没有灵力，神会崩溃；没有充盈，山谷会裂开；没有生命力，万物会消亡；没有崇高的力量，王公贵族会跌倒。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是每个人都变成这样的原因。没有清明，天会震动，没有安稳，大地会震动，没有灵力，诸神就会崩溃，没有充盈，山谷就会裂开，没有生灵，万物就会灭亡，没有灵力，神灵就会崩溃。王子和公爵会跌倒。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 每个都因此而成为这样。没有明晰，天会动摇；没有稳定，地会震动；没有灵力，神会崩溃；没有充满，山谷会裂开；没有赋予生命的力量，万物会枯萎；没有崇高的力量，王公贵族会踉跄。

text.ori_cn: 故贵以贱为本，高以下为基。
text.man_en: therefore the nobility depend upon the common man for support, and the exalted ones depend upon the lowly for their base.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the noble is based on the lowly, and the high is based on the lowly.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, nobility is based on lowliness, and high and low are the basis.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the noble value the humble as their foundation, and the high regard the low as their base.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，贵族要靠平民养活，高贵者要靠卑贱者养活。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故贵人依附于庶人，贵人依附于下人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，贵族依赖平民的支持，尊贵的人依靠卑微者作为他们的基础。

text.ori_cn: 是以侯王自称孤﹑寡﹑不谷。
text.man_en: That is why the princes and dukes call themselves "the orphaned, " "the lonely one, " "the unworthy. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the king calls himself a loner, a widower, and a non-cultivator.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the princes claim to be lonely, widowed, and poor.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the lords and kings refer to themselves as 'solitary,' 'bereft,' and 'unworthy'.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是为什么王子和公爵们称自己为 "孤儿"、"孤独者"、"不配者"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以王公们自称“孤儿”、“孤儿”、“不肖者”。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么诸侯王公自称为“孤”、“寡”、“不谷”的原因。

text.ori_cn: 故致数舆无舆，不欲琭琭如玉，珞珞如石。
text.man_en: Truly, take down the parts of a chariot, and there is no chariot (left). Rather than jingle like the jade, rumble like the rocks.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you do not want to be like jade or like stone, you will not be able to carry a public carriage without a public carriage.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, there are many people who have no public opinion, and they don’t want to be like jade, or like stones.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, he aspired to simplicity without excess, not desiring to be as polished as jade, but as unpretentious as a common stone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诚然，卸下战车的部件，就没有战车（了）。与其像玉石一样叮当作响，不如像岩石一样隆隆作响。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 确实，把战车的零件拆下来，就没有战车了（左）。与其像玉石一样叮当响，不如像岩石一样隆隆作响。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 确实，如果拆下战车的部件，就没有战车了。与其像玉石般叮当作响，不如像岩石般隆隆作响。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十章 反者道之动，弱者道之用。
text.man_en: 40Reversion is the action of Tao. Gentleness is the function of Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 40: The Opposition is the Movement of the Way, and the Weakness of the Way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 40: The opposite is the movement of Tao, and the weak is the use of Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 40: Reversion is the movement of the Tao; weakness is the use of the Tao.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 40 "反 "是 "道 "的作用。柔和是道的功能。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 40回归是道的行动。温柔是道的作用。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 反复是道的作用。柔和是道的功能。

text.ori_cn: 天下万物生于有，有生于无。
text.man_en: The things of this world come from Being, and Being (comes) from Nonbeing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Everything under heaven is born from something, and something is born from nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All things in the world are born from being, and being is born from nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things in the world are born of being; being is born of non-being.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世间万物来自 "存在"，而 "存在"（来自）"不存在"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 世间之物，生于有，有，生于无。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世间万物来自于存在，而存在来自于虚无。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十一章 上士闻道，勤而行之；中士闻道，若存若亡；下士闻道，大笑之。
text.man_en: 41When the highest type of men hear the Tao (truth), they try hard to live in accordance with it. When the mediocre type hear the Tao, they seem to be aware and yet unaware of it. When the lowest type hear the Tao, they break into loud laughter
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLI The superior man, when he hears of the Way, acts diligently; the intermediate man, when he hears of the Way, if he survives, dies; the inferior man, when he hears of the Way, laughs at it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Forty-one: When a sergeant hears the Tao, he or she will practice it diligently; when a sergeant hears the Tao, he or she will survive or perish; when a junior officer hears the Tao, he or she will laugh.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 41: When the best student hears about the Way, they practice it diligently; when the average student hears about the Way, they follow it intermittently; when the unworthy student hears about the Way, they laugh out loud.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 41最高境界的人听到 "道"（真理），就会努力按照 "道 "去生活。庸者闻道，似知而不知。最低级的人听到 "道"，就会放声大笑
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 41当最高类型的人听到道（真理）时，他们会努力按照它生活。庸人闻道，似知亦似不知。下等人闻道，大笑起来
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上士闻道，勤而行之；中士闻道，若存若亡；下士闻道，大笑之。

text.ori_cn: 不笑，不足以为道。
text.man_en: If it were not laughed at, it would not be Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not enough to laugh.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Not smiling is not enough for the Tao.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Without laughter, it is not worth discussing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 非笑不足以为道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果不被嘲笑，那就不是道了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道若不被嘲笑，便不是道。

text.ori_cn: 故建言有之﹕明道若昧，进道若退，夷道若类，上德若谷，大白若辱，广德若不足，建德若偷，质真若渝，大方无隅，大器晚成，大音希声，大象无形，道隐无名。
text.man_en: Therefore there is the established saying: "Who understands Tao seems dull of comprehension; who is advance in Tao seems to slip backwards; who moves on the even Tao (Path) seems to go up and down. "Superior character appears like a hollow (valley); sheer white appears like tarnished; great character appears like infirm; pure worth appears like contaminated. Great space has no corners; great talent takes long to mature; great music is faintly heard; great form has no contour; and Tao is hidden without a name.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, there are words of construction: Mingdao if obscure, into the road if the retreat, razing the road if the class, on the virtue of Ruogu, Dabai Ruohui, wide virtue if insufficient, build virtue if stolen, the quality of the real if the Yu, generous and no corner, the big weapon late, the big sound, the elephant is invisible, the road is hidden without a name.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, there are suggestions: The way to know is like ignorance, the way to advance is like retreat, the way to be ignorant is like the same kind, the virtue to be great is like a valley, the truth is like humiliation, the virtue to be great is like a grain, the virtue is to be stolen, the quality is to be true, there is no corner in the generosity, the great talent is late, the sound is great. Xisheng, the elephant is invisible and the road is nameless.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the ancient sages have said: The clear way seems obscure, the path forward seems to lead backward, the smooth way seems rough, great virtue seems like a valley, great purity seems like disgrace, abundant virtue seems deficient, established virtue seems deceitful, pure essence seems changed, the greatest square has no corners, the greatest vessel takes long to complete, the greatest sound is seldom heard, the greatest form has no shape, the Tao is hidden and without name.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，有句俗话说"悟道之人，似愚似钝；进道之人，似退似进；均道之人，似上似下。"上品似空（谷），纯白似污，大品似弱，纯值似污。大空无隅，大才久成，大音希声，大形无廓，道隐无名。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故有云：“悟道者，似愚昧；道进者，似后退；行于平道者，似上下起伏。”谷）;纯粹的白色看起来就像失去了光泽；伟大的品格看似体弱多病；纯粹的价值似乎被污染了。大空间没有角落；伟大的才华需要很长时间才能成熟；隐隐约约听到美妙的音乐；伟大的形式没有轮廓；而道则隐藏无名。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此有句成语："懂道理的人看起来似乎迟钝；进步的人看起来似乎倒退；在平坦的道上前进的人似乎上下起伏。" 上等的品德看起来像空谷；纯白看起来像污垢；伟大的品德看起来像虚弱；纯净的价值看起来像被污染。 大空间没有角落；大才需要很长时间才能成熟；伟大的音乐隐隐约约能听到；伟大的形态没有轮廓；而道是隐藏无名的。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯道，善贷且成。
text.man_en: It is this Tao that is adept at lending (its power) and bringing fulfillment.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only way to do this is to be a good lender and a success.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband is just the way, good at lending and successful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only the Dao is adept at giving and bringing things to fruition.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 正是这种 "道 "善于借用（其力量）并带来成就感。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 正是这种道善于借用（它的力量）并带来圆满。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 正是这种道擅长于借用（它的力量）并实现圆满。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十二章 道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。
text.man_en: 42 Out of Tao, One is born; Out of One, Two; Out of Two, Three; Out of Three, the created universe.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 42 The Tao begets one, one begets two, two begets three, and three begets all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 42: Tao gives birth to one, gives birth to two, two gives birth to three, and three gives birth to all things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 42: The Dao gives birth to One, One gives birth to Two, Two gives birth to Three, Three gives birth to all things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 42 道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 42、从道而生，从道而生。一、二；二、三；三者之中，创造的宇宙。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道生一，一生二，二生三，三生万物。

text.ori_cn: 万物负阴而抱阳，冲气以为和。
text.man_en: The created universe carries the yin at its back and the yang in front; through the union of the pervading principles it reaches harmony.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: All things are negative Yin and embrace Yang, and they are in harmony with each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All things bear yin and embrace yang, and the energy is in harmony.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: All things carry yin and embrace yang, achieving harmony through the balance of these energies.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 被创造的宇宙背阴面阳，通过阴阳的结合达到和谐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 创造的宇宙，背后是阴，前面是阳；通过普遍原则的结合，它达到了和谐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天地万物背负阴，面向阳，通过普遍原则的结合而达到和谐。

text.ori_cn: 人之所恶，唯孤﹑寡不毂，而王公以为称。
text.man_en: To be "orphaned, " "lonely" and "unworthy" is what men hate most. Yet the princes and dukes call themselves by such names.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that people hate is that they don't have a hub, and the princes and kings think that they do.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What is evil about people is being lonely and widowed, but the princes think they are famous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What people normally despise, such as being solitary, childless, or unwelcomed, are precisely the titles that princes and kings take pride in.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 成为 "孤儿"、"孤独 "和 "不配 "是人们最痛恨的事情。然而，王子和公爵们却用这样的名字称呼自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “孤儿”、“孤独”、“无价值”，是男人最讨厌的。然而诸侯、诸侯却用这样的名字来称呼自己。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 「寡」、「孤」、「不谷」是人们最厌恶的。然而，王公贵族却自称这些名字。

text.ori_cn: 故物或损之而益，或益之而损。
text.man_en: For sometimes things are benefited by being taken away from, and suffer by being added to.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, things are either lost and gained, or gained and lost.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, things may be damaged and benefited, or they may be benefited and lost.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, material things may either be damaged to benefit, or benefited to damage.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为有时候，事物会因为被剥夺而受益，也会因为被增加而受苦。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为有时事物因被剥夺而受益，因被添加而受苦。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有时候，减少反而能带来好处，而增加却会导致损害。

text.ori_cn: 人之所教，我亦教之。
text.man_en: Others have taught this maxim, which I shall teach also: "the violent man shall die a violent death. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: What man teaches, I teach.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What others teach, I also teach.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What others teach, I also teach.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 别人传授了这句格言，我也要传授："暴力者必暴毙"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 其他人教导了这句格言，我也将教导这句格言：“暴力之人必死于暴力。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 别人也曾教过这个格言，我也将教导它：“暴力的人将死于暴力。”

text.ori_cn: 强梁者不得其死，吾将以为教父。
text.man_en: This I shall regard as my spiritual teacher.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The strongest beams shall not die, and I shall think of them as godfathers.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are strong will not be allowed to die, I will be your godfather.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who resort to violence will die an untimely death; I will use this as a lesson for future generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我将把他视为我的精神导师。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我将视此为我的精神导师。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这将被我视为我的精神导师。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十三章 天下之至柔，驰骋天下之至坚。
text.man_en: 43The softest substance of the world goes through the hardest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLIII The Most Flexible in the World, Galloping the Most Firm in the World.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 43: The most soft in the world, the strongest in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 43: The softest substance of the world drives and overcomes the hardest.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 43世界上最柔软的物质要经历最坚硬的考验。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 43、世界上最柔软的物质，也能经历最坚硬的物质。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天下最柔弱的东西能够穿透最坚硬的物质。

text.ori_cn: 无有人无间，吾是以知无为之有益,不言之教，无为之益，天下希及之。
text.man_en: Thatwhichiswithoutform penetrates thatwhichhasnocrevice; through this I know the benefit of taking no action. The teaching without words and the benefit of taking no action are without compare in the universe.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no one, no room, I know that the benefits of inaction, the teaching of no words, the benefits of inaction, the world and the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no one without a world, so I know the benefits of doing nothing, and I don’t teach you the benefits of doing nothing. The whole world hopes to see the benefits of doing nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With no one being disregarded, I thus understand the benefit of non-action; the teaching without words, the benefit of non-action, these are rare in the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无形之物穿透无形之物，我由此而知无为之益。无言之教，无为之益，宇宙无双。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 无形者穿透无隙；通过这件事我知道不采取行动的好处。无言之教，无为之利，是宇宙间无有可比的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无形之物穿透无隙之处；由此我知道无为的好处。无言的教诲和无为的利益在宇宙中是无与伦比的。

text.ori_cn: 是故甚爱必大费，多藏必厚亡，知足不辱，知止不殆，可以长久。
text.man_en: Therefore: he who loves most spends most, He who hoards much loses much. The contented man meets no disgrace; Who know when to stop runs into no danger He can long endure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you love a lot, you will have to pay a lot of money, if you hide a lot, you will have to die a lot, if you know that you will not be humiliated, if you know that you will not be in danger, you will be able to last long.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you love too much, you will spend a lot of money; if you hoard too much, you will be rich and perish; if you are satisfied, you will not be disgraced; if you know how to stop, it will not be ruined, and it will last for a long time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, excessive love leads to great expenditures, and hoarding leads to significant losses. Knowing contentment avoids disgrace, and understanding when to stop prevents danger, allowing for long-lasting stability.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此：爱得最多的人花得最多，囤积得多的人损失得最多。知足者不辱，知止者不殆。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以说：爱得最多的人花得最多，囤得多的人失去得也多。知足的人不会受辱；知道什么时候停止的人不会遇到他可以长期忍受的危险。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以：爱得最深的人花费最多，囤积很多的人失去更多。满足的人不会遇到耻辱；知道什么时候停止的人不会遇到危险，他能够长久坚持。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十五章 大成若缺，其用不弊。
text.man_en: 45The highest perfection is like imperfection, and its use is never impaired.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLV If a great success is lacking, its use will not be detrimental.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 45: If a great achievement is missing, its use will not be harmful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Forty-Five: Great accomplishment appears flawed, yet its utility remains unimpaired.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 45最高的完美就像不完美，它的用途永远不会受损。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 45、最高的完美就像不完美一样，它的使用永远不会受到损害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 最完美的像是不完美一样，其用永不受损。

text.ori_cn: 大盈若冲，其用不穷。
text.man_en: The greatest abundance seems meager, and its use will never fail.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A great surplus is a rush, and its use is inexhaustible.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is a big surplus, it will be of endless use.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The great fullness appears empty, yet its usefulness is inexhaustible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 再丰富的资源看似微不足道，但其用途却永不枯竭。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最大的富足似乎也微不足道，而它的利用却永远不会失败。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 最大的丰盈看似微薄，但它的用途永不枯竭。

text.ori_cn: 大直若屈，大巧若拙大辩若讷。
text.man_en: What s most straight appears devious, the greatest skill appears clumsiness; the greatest eloquence seems like stuttering.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Great straightness is like bending, great subtlety is like clumsiness and great eloquence is like speech.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Great straightness seems like bending, great skill seems like clumsiness, great debate seems like indifference.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Great straightness appears bent, great skill appears clumsy, great eloquence appears stammering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最正直的东西显得狡猾，最高超的技巧显得笨拙，最雄辩的语言显得结巴。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最直的却显得狡诈，最精明的却显得笨拙；最伟大的口才似乎都结结巴巴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 最正直的看起来好像是迂回的，最伟大的技艺看起来像是笨拙的；最伟大的口才看起来像是结巴的。

text.ori_cn: 躁胜寒，静胜热。
text.man_en: Movement overcomes cold, (but) keeping still overcomes heat.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Restlessness is better than cold, and quietness is better than heat.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Agitation beats cold, calmness beats heat.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Restlessness overcomes cold, while tranquility overcomes heat.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 动能胜寒，（但）静能胜热。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 运动可以克服寒冷，（但）保持静止可以克服炎热。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 动则能御寒，静则能祛热。

text.ori_cn: 清静为天下正。
text.man_en: Who is calm and quiet becomes the guide for the universe.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Clear and quiet is the right thing for the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Tranquility is the righteousness of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Serenity is the world's truth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谁能沉着冷静，谁就能成为宇宙的向导。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 谁能平静、安静，谁就成为宇宙的向导。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谁平静而安详，便成为宇宙的导引者。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十六章 天下有道，却走马以粪。
text.man_en: 46When the world lives in accord with Tao, racing horses are turned back to haul refuse carts.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLVI There is a way in the world, but walking horses take dung.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 46: There is a way in the world, but it is like dung.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 46: When the world is in harmony, even warhorses are used to plow the fields.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 46当世人与 "道 "和谐相处时，赛马就会变成拉垃圾的车。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 46、天下顺道，赛马归来拉垃圾车。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当世界与道和谐共处时，赛马将被派去拉垃圾车。

text.ori_cn: 天下无道，戎马生于郊。
text.man_en: When the world lives not in accord with Tao, cavalry abounds in the countryside.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no way in the world, and the military is born in the suburbs.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no way in the world, and soldiers and horses are born in the suburbs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When there is no justice in the land, warhorses are bred in the suburbs.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 世道不顺，则骑兵横行。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天下不合道时，乡间多有骑兵。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当世界不遵循道的时候，乡间就会骑兵遍地。

text.ori_cn: 祸莫大于不知足；咎莫大于欲得。
text.man_en: There is no greater curse than the lack of contentment. No greater sin than the desire for possession.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no greater evil than not knowing enough; there is no greater blame than wanting to have.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No disaster is greater than dissatisfaction; no fault is greater than desire.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is no greater disaster than not knowing contentment; no greater fault than the desire for gain.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最大的诅咒莫过于不知足。最大的罪过莫过于占有欲。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没有什么比缺乏满足更大的诅咒了。没有比占有欲更大的罪恶了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 没有比不知足更大的诅咒。没有比贪图占有更大的罪恶。

text.ori_cn: 故知足之足，常足矣。
text.man_en: Therefore he who is contented with contentment shall be always content.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is always enough to know what is enough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, knowing what is enough is always enough.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, understanding true contentment means perpetual satisfaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，知足者常乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，知足者常知足。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，知足常乐，常乐常在。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十七章 不出户，知天下；不窥牖，见天道。
text.man_en: 47Without stepping outside one's doors, one can know what is happening in the world, without looking out of one's windows, one can see the Tao of heaven.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLVII Without going out of the house, I know the world; without peeping into the house, I see the way of heaven.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 47: Know the world without leaving home; see the way of heaven without peeking into the window.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 47: Without leaving the house, one can know the world; without looking through the window, one can see the way of heaven.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 47足不出户，便知天下事；不窥窗外，便见天道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 47、足不出户，便能知天下事；不出窗，便能见天道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不出户，知天下；不窥牖，见天道。

text.ori_cn: 其出弥远，其知弥少。
text.man_en: The farther one pursues knowledge, the less one knows.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is far out, and it is little known.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Its journey is far away and its knowledge is limited.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The farther one goes, the less one knows.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 追求知识越远，知道的就越少。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 追求知识越远，知道的就越少。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 追求知识越多，懂得越少。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人不行而知，不见而名，不为而成。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage knows without running about, understands without seeing, accomplishes without doing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that the saint does not act but knows, does not see but is known, and does not act but becomes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a sage knows something without doing it, is famous without seeing it, and becomes something without doing it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage accomplishes without action, understands without seeing, and achieves renown without striving.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人知而不奔，明而不视，成而不作。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人不奔波而知，不见而知，不为而成。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人不跑动而知，不见而明，不为而成。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十八章 为学日益，为道日损。
text.man_en: 48The student of knowledge (aims at) learning day by day; the student of Tao (aims at) losing day by day.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLVIII For the sake of learning to grow, and for the sake of the way to be lost.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 48: Learning is getting better day by day, but doing Taoism is getting worse every day.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Forty-Eight: Pursuing knowledge involves daily progress, while pursuing the Way involves daily reduction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 48 求知者，日日学；求道者，日日损。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 48、知识的学生日复一日地学习；道之学生日渐失利。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 学知识的学生每天都在学习；修道的人每天都在减少。

text.ori_cn: 损之又损，以至于无为。
text.man_en: By continual losing One reaches doing nothing (laissezfaire).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The loss is so great that it leads to nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Damage after damage, to the point of doing nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Reduce and reduce again, until you achieve non-action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过不断的失败，人达到了无所作为（自由放任）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 通过不断的失败，一个人达到无所事事（自由放任）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不断地放下，方能达到无为而治。

text.ori_cn: 无为而无不为。
text.man_en: He who conquers the world often does so by doing nothing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is nothing to do and nothing to be done.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Do nothing and do nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: By doing nothing, everything is done.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 征服世界的人往往无所作为。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 征服世界的人往往什么也不做。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 征服世界的人往往通过无为而有所成就。

text.ori_cn: 取天下常以无事，及其有事，不足以取天下。
text.man_en: When one is compelled to do something, the world is already beyond his conquering.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The world is often taken by nothing, and when it is taken by something, it is not enough to take the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To conquer the world, it is often necessary to have nothing to do, and even if there is something to do, it is not enough to conquer the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To rule the world is often achieved through non-action, but when there are actions, it is not sufficient to rule the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当一个人被迫去做一件事的时候，世界已经无法被他征服。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当一个人被迫去做一件事时，这个世界就已经超出了他的征服范围。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当一个人被迫去做某事时，这个世界已经超出了他的征服范围。

text.ori_cn: § 第四十九章 圣人无常心，以百姓心为心。
text.man_en: 49The Sage has no decided opinions and feelings, but regards the people's opinions and feelings as his own.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XLIX The sage has no constant mind, but takes the mind of the people as his own.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 49: The sage has an impermanent heart and takes the hearts of the people as his heart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 49: The sage has no constant mind; he takes the mind of the people as his own.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 49 圣人没有决定性的意见和感受，却把人们的意见和感受视为自己的意见和感受。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 49圣人没有一定的意见和感情，而把人民的意见和感情当作自己的意见和感情。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人没有固定的意见和感情，而是将百姓的意见和感情视为自己的。

text.ori_cn: 善者吾善之；不善者吾亦善之，德善.信者吾信之；不信者，吾亦信之，德信。
text.man_en: The good ones I declare good; the bad ones I also declare good. That is the goodness of Virtue. The honest ones I believe; the liars I also believe; that is the faith of Virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I am good to those who are good; I am good to those who are not good, and virtue is good. He that believeth, I believe; and he that believeth not, I believe also, De Faith.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I will be good to those who are good; I will also be good to those who are not good, and virtue is good. I believe in those who believe; I also believe in those who do not believe in virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: I am good to those who are good; I am also good to those who are not good, thus gaining goodness. I have faith in those who have faith; I also have faith in those who do not have faith, thus gaining trust.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 好的我说是好的，坏的我也说是坏的。这就是美德的善。诚实的人我相信，撒谎的人我也相信，这就是美德之信。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 善者我谓之善；坏的我也说好的。这就是德行的美好之处。我相信诚实的人；骗子我也信；这就是对美德的信仰。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 善者我以之为善，恶者我亦以之为善，此乃德之善。诚者我信之，诈者我亦信之，此乃德之信。

text.ori_cn: 圣人在天下怵怵,为天下浑其心，百姓皆注其耳目，圣人皆孩之。
text.man_en: The Sage dwells in the world peacefully, harmoniously. The people of the world are brought into a community of heart, and the Sage regards them all as his own children.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints are afraid in the world, and they are all in their hearts for the world, and the people are all watching their ears and eyes, and the saints are all children of the saints.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage is fearful in the world, and his heart is clear for the world. The people all pay attention to his ears and eyes, and the sage is a child.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sage is cautious in the world and keeps his mind pure for the world. The common people all pay attention to him, and the sage treats them all like children.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人和平、和谐地生活在世界上。圣人将世人视为自己的孩子，与他们心心相印。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人安详地安居于世间。天下百姓结为心系，圣人视之如自己的孩子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人和平地、和谐地居住在世上。世人的心被带入一个共同体，圣人视他们为自己的孩子。

text.ori_cn: §第五十章 出生入死。
text.man_en: 50 Out of life, death enters.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: chapter fiftieth birth and death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 50: Life and death.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 50: To Face Life and Death.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 50 生离死别
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 50、死亡从生出来，进入。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 50 出生入死。

text.ori_cn: 生之徒，十有三；死之徒，十有三；人之生，动之死地，亦十有三。
text.man_en: The companions (organs) of life are thirteen; the companions (organs) of death are (also) thirteen. What send man to death in this life are also (these) thirteen.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are three out of ten who are born; three out of ten who die; and three out of ten who are born and move to the place of death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are three out of ten people who will be born, three out of ten people will be affected by death, and there are also three out of ten people who will die in their life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Of those who live, one-third are destined to live; of those who die, one-third are destined to die; among those who live, one-third move towards the place of death.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 生命的伴侣（器官）有十三个；死亡的伴侣（器官）（也）有十三个。今生送人去死的也是（这）十三个。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 生命的同伴（器官）有十三；死亡的同伴（器官）是（也）十三。今生使人死亡的，也有十三种。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 生命的伴侣（器官）有十三个，死亡的伴侣（器官）也有十三个。让人死于这个世上的也是这些十三个。

text.ori_cn: 以其生生之厚。
text.man_en: Because of the intense activity of multiplying life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: With its raw thickness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Because of its richness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With its profound vitality.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为生命繁衍的活动十分激烈。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为繁衍生命的激烈活动。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为繁衍生命的激烈活动。

text.ori_cn: 盖闻善摄生者，陆行不遇兕虎，入军不被甲兵；无所投其角，虎无所措其爪，兵无所容其刃。
text.man_en: It has been said that the who is a good preserver of his life meets no tigers or wild buffaloes on land, is not vulnerable to weapons in the field of battle. The horns of the wild buffalo are powerless against him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I have heard that those who are good at taking care of their health will not encounter a bull or tiger on land, and will not be armoured in the army; there is nothing to throw their horns at, no tigers to catch their claws, and no soldiers to accommodate their blades.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Gai heard that those who are good at maintaining health will not encounter tigers when traveling on land, and will not be attacked by armored soldiers when entering the army; they will not be able to throw their horns, tigers will not be able to use their claws, and soldiers will not be able to use their blades.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is said that those who are skilled in preserving life can walk on land without encountering rhinoceroses or tigers, and can enter an army without being harmed by weapons; the rhinoceros finds no place to thrust its horn, the tiger finds no place to lay its claws, and soldiers find no place to drive their blades.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有人说，一个善于保护自己生命的人，在陆地上不会遇到老虎或野牛，在战场上也不会被武器所伤。野牛的犄角对他也无能为力。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 据说，善于保全生命的人，陆地上不遇老虎、野水牛，在战场上不会受到武器的伤害。野水牛的角对他无能为力。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 据说，那些善于保护自己生命的人在陆地上不会遇到老虎或野牛，在战场上也不会被武器所伤。野牛的角对他毫无办法。

text.ori_cn: 以其无死地。
text.man_en: Because he is beyond death.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: With its deathless ground.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With its immortality.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Place them in a position where they have no way to survive.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为他已经超越了死亡。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为他超越了死亡。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为他超越了死亡。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十一章 道生之，德畜之，物形之，势成之。
text.man_en: 51 Tao gives them birth, teh (character) fosters them. The material world gives them form. The circumstances of the moment complete them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 51 The Tao is born, the Virtue is raised, the Object is shaped, and the Potential is formed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 51: Tao is born, virtue is the animal, physical shape is the form, and potential is the result.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 51: The Dao gives life to them, Virtue nurtures them, Material gives them shape, Potential completes them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 51 道生万物，万物育道。物质世界赋予它们形式。当下的环境使其完整。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 51 道生他们，德养他们。物质世界赋予它们形式。当下的情况使它们变得完整。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道生之，德蓄之。物形之，势成之。

text.ori_cn: 是以万物莫不尊道而贵德。
text.man_en: Therefore all things of the universe worship Tao and exalt Teh.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is why all things respect the Way and honour virtue.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, all things respect Tao and value virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, all things revere the Dao and value virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，宇宙万物都崇拜 "道"，推崇 "德"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故宇宙万物崇道崇德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，宇宙万物都尊崇道和推崇德。

text.ori_cn: 道之尊，德之贵，夫莫之命而常自然。
text.man_en: Tao is worshipped and Teh is exalted Without anyone's order but is so of its own accord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Dao is honoured, the virtue is noble, and the order of the Fumo is always natural.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The respect of Tao, the nobility of virtue, and the destiny of the husband are always natural.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Way is esteemed, Virtue is precious, and both are naturally ever-abiding without anyone's command.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 道可道，德可德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 崇道，尊德，不需任何人的命令，而是自然而然的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道是被尊崇的，德是被推崇的，不需任何人的命令，而是自然而然的。

text.ori_cn: 故道生之，德畜之。
text.man_en: Therefore Tao gives them birth, Teh fosters them,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the Way gives birth to it, and the Virtue animals it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the Tao is born, and virtue is the animal.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Tao gives birth to them; virtue nurtures them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 道生之，德育之、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故道生其，德养其，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，道生育他们，德抚育他们，

text.ori_cn: 长之育之，亭之毒之，养之覆之。
text.man_en: makes them grow, develops them, gives them a harbor, a place to dwell in peace, feeds them and shelter them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Growing of the nurturing, pavilion of the poison, raising of the covering.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Nurture it when it grows, poison it when it is pavilion, and cover it when it is nurtured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nurture them for a long time, discipline them rigorously, nourish them carefully, and shield them protectively.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 让他们成长，让他们发展，给他们一个港湾，一个可以安居乐业的地方，给他们食物，为他们遮风挡雨。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 使他们成长，发展他们，给他们一个港湾，一个安宁居住的地方，给他们食物和庇护。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 使他们成长、发展，给他们一个港湾、一个和平栖息的地方，供养他们并庇护他们。

text.ori_cn: 生而不有，为而不恃，长而不宰，是谓玄德。
text.man_en: It gives them birth and does not own them, acts (helps) and does not appropriate them, is superior, and does not control them. This is the Mystic Virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be born and not to have, to be and not to be relied upon, to grow and not to dominate, is to be Xuan De.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be born without having something, to work without relying on it, to grow without being killed is called Xuande.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Create without possessing, act without expecting, lead without dominating: this is called profound virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它生而不有，行（助）而不占，优而不控。这就是神秘的美德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 它赋予它们生命，但并不拥有它们；它起作用（帮助）但不占有它们；它是优越的，但不控制它们。这就是玄德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 它生养万物而不占有，助益万物而不自恃，为贵而不加以驱使。这就是玄德。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十二章 天下有始，以为天下母。
text.man_en: 52There was a beginning of the universe which may be regarded as the Mother of the Universe.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 52 There is a beginning of the world, and it is thought to be the mother of the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 52: The world has a beginning, and we think it is the mother of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Two: The world has a beginning, which is considered the mother of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 52宇宙有一个开端，它可以被视为宇宙之母。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 52宇宙有一个开端，可以被视为宇宙之母。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 宇宙有一个起始点，可以视为宇宙之母。

text.ori_cn: 既得其母，以知其子，既知其子，复守其母，没身不殆。
text.man_en: From the Mother, we may know her sons. After knowing the sons, keep to the Mother. Thus one's whole life may be preserved from harm.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When he has obtained his mother to know his son, and when he has known his son, he keeps his mother, and is not in danger of losing his life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Now that he has his mother, he can know his son; now that he has known his son, he can keep his mother again and not be in danger even if she is not alive.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Having understood the mother, one comes to understand the child. Having understood the child, one can then abide by the mother and remain unscathed for life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从母亲那里，我们可以知道她的儿子。了解儿子之后，我们就可以继续追随母亲。这样，人的一生就不会受到伤害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从母亲那里，我们可以认识她的儿子们。知子后，守于母。这样，一个人的一生就可以免受伤害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从母亲可以认识她的儿子。认识了儿子之后，要依靠母亲。这样就可以保全一生免于灾害。

text.ori_cn: 塞其兑，闭其门，终身不勤。
text.man_en: Stop its apertures, close its doors, and one's whole life is without toil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Plugging their tui and closing their doors for a lifetime of inactivity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you keep your money shut, you will never work hard for the rest of your life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Stuff their ears and shut their doors, thus they will never toil in their life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 停止它的光圈，关闭它的大门，人的一生就不再劳累。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 闭其孔，闭其门，一生无劳。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 塞其兑，闭其门，终身不勤。

text.ori_cn: 开其兑，济其事，终身不救。
text.man_en: Open its apertures, be busy about its affairs, and one's whole life is beyond redemption.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Open their Tui, help them, and they will not be saved for the rest of their lives.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Open it up and help it, but you will not save it for the rest of your life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Open their gates and resolve their issues; thus, they will never need rescue for life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 打开它的窗口，忙于它的事务，人的一生就无法挽回。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 开其窍，忙其事，一生万劫不复。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 耳目聪明，务于营务，终身一世，不可消除。

text.ori_cn: 见小曰明，守柔曰强。
text.man_en: He who can see the small is clearsighted; he who stays by gentility is strong.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Seeing the small is said to be bright, keeping the soft is said to be strong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: See small and say bright, keep soft and say strong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Seeing the small is called clarity; maintaining gentleness is called strength.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 见微知著者明，温文尔雅者强。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 能看到细微的人，就是明眼人；保持温柔的人是坚强的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 善于察微者明智，坚守仁德者强大。

text.ori_cn: 用其光，复归其明无遗身殃，是为习常。
text.man_en: use the light, and return to clearsightedness thus cause not yourself later distress. This is to rest in the Absolute.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To use its light and return to its brightness without sparing the body from suffering is the habit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is a habit to use its light to restore its brightness without leaving any harm to the body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Using its light to return to its brilliance without leaving any harm to oneself, this is called practicing constancy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 用光，回归清明，这样才不会给自己带来困扰。这就是安于绝对。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 使用光线，恢复视力清晰，以免给自己带来以后的痛苦。这就是安息在绝对之中。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 用光明，回归清醒，从而避免之后的烦恼。这就是安住于绝对。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十三章 使我介然有知，行于大道，唯施是畏。
text.man_en: 53If I were possessed of Austere Knowledge, walking on the Main Path (Tao), I would avoid the bypaths.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 53 So that I may have knowledge between me, and walk in the way of the Way, and the only thing to be feared is to give.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 53: I am enlightened and able to walk on the great road with only fear.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Three: If I were to have but a little knowledge and walk in the Great Way, it is only the acts of giving and receiving that I would be cautious of.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 53 如果我拥有渊博的知识，行走在大道（道）上，我就会避开旁门左道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 53、我若具苦知识，行正道，则能避开旁道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果我拥有严肃的智慧，走在大道上，我会避免走旁道。

text.ori_cn: 大道甚夷，而民好径。
text.man_en: The Main path is easy to walk on, yet people love the small bypaths.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The road is very barbaric, and the people are good at travelling.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The roads are barren, but the people like them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The great way is very level, yet people prefer shortcuts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 主路很好走，但人们也喜欢走小路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 主路很容易行走，但人们喜欢小路。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大道易行，世人却喜小路。

text.ori_cn: 朝甚除，田甚芜，仓甚虚；服文彩，带利剑，厌饮食，财货有余。
text.man_en: The (official) courts are spic and span, (While) the fields go untilled, and the (people's) granaries are very low. (Yet) clad in embroidered gowns, and carrying find swords, surfeited with good food and drinks, (They are) splitting with wealth and possessions.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The dynasty is very removed, the fields are very barren, and the warehouse is very empty; they are dressed in civil colours, they carry sharp swords, they are tired of eating and drinking, and they have a surplus of goods.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The dynasty is in chaos, the fields are barren, and the warehouses are empty; he wears literary skills, carries a sharp sword, hates food and drink, and has more than enough wealth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The court is extraordinarily busy, the fields are neglected, the granaries are empty; adorned in fine clothes, carrying sharp swords, indulging in food and drink, and possessing excess wealth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 官）衙门整齐划一，（而）田地无人耕种，（百姓）粮仓十分贫乏。(然而）身着绣花长袍，手持宝剑，酒足饭饱，（他们）财源滚滚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 朝廷整洁，田地不耕，粮仓很低。身着绣衣，持剑，饱食美酒，分财物。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 官庭整洁，而田地荒芜，民众的粮仓空虚。但他们身穿绣衣，腰佩利剑，饱享美食美酒，富足得无法容纳更多财物。

text.ori_cn: 是为夸盗。
text.man_en: This is to lead the world toward brigandage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It's a quahog theft.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is to praise the thief.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is praising a thief.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是把世界引向强盗行径。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这是为了引导世界走向抢劫。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是要引导世界走向强盗行为。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十四章 善建者不拔，善抱者不脱，子孙以祭祀不辍。
text.man_en: 54Who is firmly established is not easily shaken. Who has a firm grasp does not easily let go. From generation to generation his ancestral sacrifices shall be continued without fail.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 54 The good builder does not pull up, the good hugger does not take off, and the children and grandchildren do not stop with their sacrifices.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 54: Those who are good at building will never pull up, those who are good at hugging will not take off, and descendants will continue to offer sacrifices.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Four: What is well established cannot be uprooted; what is well embraced cannot slip away. Future generations will continue the practices.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 54稳固的人不容易动摇。牢牢抓住的人不会轻易放手。他的祖先祭祀将代代相传，永不中断。
