text.man_en2ggl_cn: 54、坚定的人不容易动摇。抓得牢的人就不会轻易放手。他的祖先的祭祀将世世代代延续下去，不会有任何中断。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 坚固的人不容易动摇。牢牢把握的人不容易放手。祖先的祭祀世世代代将持续不断。

text.ori_cn: 修之于身，其德乃真；修之于家，其德乃余；修之于乡，其德乃长；修之于国，其德乃丰；修之于天下，其德乃普。
text.man_en: Cultivated in the individual, character will become genuine; cultivated in the family, character will become abundant; cultivated in the village, character will multiply; cultivated in the state, character will prosper; cultivated in the world, character will become universal.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Cultivate in the body, its virtue is true; cultivate in the family, its virtue is surplus; cultivate in the township, its virtue is long; cultivate in the country, its virtue is abundant; cultivate in the world, its virtue is universal.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Cultivate it in the body, and its virtue will be true; cultivate it in the family, and its virtue will be residual; cultivate it in the village, and its virtue will be long; cultivate it in the country, and its virtue will be abundant; cultivate it in the world, and its virtue will be universal.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Cultivated within oneself, one's virtue becomes genuine; cultivated within the family, one's virtue becomes abundant; cultivated within the community, one's virtue becomes enduring; cultivated within the nation, one's virtue becomes prosperous; cultivated within the world, one's virtue becomes universal.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 修之于人，其性必真；修之于家，其性必厚；修之于乡，其性必隆；修之于邦，其性必盛；修之于世，其性必普。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 个人修养了，品格就会变得真诚；家庭修养，品格就会丰富；乡里耕耘，品格倍增；修于国家，品格就会发达；修身于世，品格将变得普遍。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 修之于身，其德乃真；修之于家，其德乃厚；修之于乡，其德乃长；修之于国，其德乃丰；修之于天下，其德乃普。

text.ori_cn: 故以身观身，以家观家，以乡观乡，以国观国，以天下观天下。
text.man_en: Therefore: according to (the character of ) the individual, judge the individual; according to (the character of ) the family, judge the family; according to (the character of ) the village, judge the village; according to (the character of ) the state, judge the state; according to (the character of ) the world, judge the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the body is viewed as the body, the home as the home, the township as the township, the country as the country, and the world as the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, observe the body through the body, observe the family through the family, observe the township through the township, observe the country through the country, and observe the world through the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, observe the body with the body, observe the family with the family, observe the village with the village, observe the country with the country, and observe the world with the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此：根据（个人的）特征，判断个人；根据（家庭的）特征，判断家庭；根据（村庄的）特征，判断村庄；根据（国家的）特征，判断国家；根据（世界的）特征，判断世界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此：根据个人（的性格），判断个人；根据家庭（的性格），判断家庭；根据村庄（的性质），判断村庄；根据国家（的性质），判断国家；根据世界（的性质），判断世界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此：根据个人的品格，判断个人；根据家庭的品格，判断家庭；根据村庄的品格，判断村庄；根据国家的品格，判断国家；根据世界的品格，判断世界。

text.ori_cn: 以此。
text.man_en: By this.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Take this.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As such.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过这一点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过这个。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十五章 含德之厚，比于赤子。
text.man_en: 55Who is rich in character is like a child.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 55 Containing virtue thicker than a red son.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 55: The virtue of Han is greater than that of an innocent child.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 55: The profound virtue is comparable to an infant.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 55 富有个性的人就像一个孩子。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 55、品格丰富的人就像个孩子。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 富有品格的人像孩子一样。

text.ori_cn: 毒虫不螫，猛兽不据，攫鸟不搏。
text.man_en: No poisonous insects sting him, no wild beasts attack him, and no birds of prey pounce upon him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Poisonous insects do not sting, ferocious beasts do not attack, and birds are not seized.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Poisonous insects do not sting, ferocious beasts do not take hold, and snatching birds do not fight.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The poisonous insects do not sting, the ferocious beasts do not attack, and the predatory birds do not strike.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有毒虫叮咬他，没有野兽袭击他，也没有猛禽扑向他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没有毒虫蜇伤他，没有野兽攻击他，没有猛禽扑向他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 没有毒虫叮咬他，没有野兽攻击他，也没有猛禽扑击他。

text.ori_cn: 骨弱筋柔而握固。
text.man_en: His bones are soft, his sinews tender, yet his grip is strong.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The bones are weak, the tendons are soft and the grip is firm.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The bones are weak and the muscles are soft but firm to hold.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With weak bones and supple muscles, one maintains a firm grip.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他的骨头是软的，他的筋是嫩的，但他的握力是强的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他的骨头很软，他的筋很软，但他的抓地力却很强。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他的骨头柔软，筋脉也很脆弱，但他的握力却很强。

text.ori_cn: 未知牝牡之合而全作，精之至也。
text.man_en: Not knowing the union of male and female, yet his organs are complete, which means his vigor is unspoiled.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Unknown to the female and the male and the female is fully made, the essence is also the most important.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is unknown that the combination of male and female can produce a complete work, which is extremely refined.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Creating without knowing the union of male and female is the utmost refinement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他不知道雌雄的结合，但他的器官是完整的，这意味着他的活力没有被破坏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不知雌雄结合，而五脏六腑完整，说明元气未损。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不知男女之合，而其器官完备，这意味着他的精力未受破坏。

text.ori_cn: 终日号而不嗄，和之至也。
text.man_en: Crying the whole day, yet his voice never runs hoarse, which means his (natural) harmony is perfect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The number of the whole day, but not the hoarseness, and the harmony of the most also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Howling all day long without croaking, harmony is achieved.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To wail all day without hoarseness is the epitome of harmony.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 哭了一整天，嗓子却从未沙哑过，这说明他的（自然）和谐是完美的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 哭了一整天，声音却从不沙哑，说明他的（自然）和谐是完美的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 整天哭喊着，他的声音却从未嘶哑，这意味着他的天赋和声调非常完美。

text.ori_cn: 知和曰常，知常曰明。
text.man_en: To know harmony is to be in accord with the eternal, (and) to know eternity is called discerning.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowing the harmony is said to be constant, and knowing the constant is said to be clear.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing harmony is called Changing, knowing Changing is called Ming.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Understanding and embracing constancy is wisdom, and recognizing constancy is enlightenment.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知道和谐就是符合永恒，（而）知道永恒就叫做明辨。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知和，则合于恒，知恒，谓明。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知和曰常，知常曰明。

text.ori_cn: 益生曰祥。
text.man_en: (But) to improve upon life is called an illomen;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Beneficial life is said to be auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Yisheng said Xiang.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Virtue brings forth good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (但是）改善生活被称为 "病态"；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （但是）改善生活被称为 illomen；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （但是）改善生活被称为不祥之兆；

text.ori_cn: 心使气曰强。
text.man_en: to let go the emotions through impulse is called assertiveness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The heart makes the qi say strong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The heart makes Qi strong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When the mind directs the energy, it is called strength.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 通过冲动来释放情绪被称为自信。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 通过冲动来释放情绪，这叫自信。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过冲动释放情感被称为自信。

text.ori_cn: 物壮则老，谓之不道，不道早已。
text.man_en: (For) things age after reaching their prime; That (assertiveness) would be against Tao. And he who is against Tao perishes young.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When things are strong, they are old, and they are said to be ungodly, and they have been ungodly for a long time.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Things grow old when they are strong, which is called immorality, but they have already been immoral.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Things that reach their peak inevitably age; this is called going against the Way. Going against the Way leads to an early end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (物壮则老，老而不争，是谓反道。违背道的人就会英年早逝。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （因为）事物在达到鼎盛时期后就会老化；那（自信）就会违背道。逆道者，早逝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 物壮则老；这是违背道的。而违道者早亡。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十六章 知者不言，言者不知。
text.man_en: 56He who knows does not speak; he who speaks does not know.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 56: Those who know do not speak, and those who speak do not know.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 56: Those who know do not speak, and those who speak do not know.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Six: Those who know do not speak; those who speak do not know.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 56 知者不言，言者不知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 56、知者不言，知者不言。说话的人并不知道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知者不言，言者不知。

text.ori_cn: 塞其兑，闭其门，挫其锐，解其分，和其光，同其尘，是谓玄同。
text.man_en: Fill up its apertures, close its doors, dull its edges, untie its tangles, soften its light, submerge its turmoil, this is the Mystic Unity.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Plugging its Dui, closing its door, thwarting its sharpness, unravelling its division, harmonising its light, and sharing its dust, is called Xuan Tong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Blocking its dui, closing its door, blunting its sharpness, dissolving its parts, harmonizing its light and being the same as its dust, this is called Xuantong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Fill the gaps, close the openings, blunt the sharpness, resolve the differences, harmonize the light, assimilate with the dust—this is called profound unity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 填满它的孔隙，关闭它的大门，磨钝它的棱角，解开它的纠结，柔化它的光芒，淹没它的骚动，这就是神秘的统一。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 充其孔，闭其门，钝其棱，解其缠，柔其光，淹没其乱，是玄一也。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 塞其兑，闭其门，钝其锐，解其纷，和其光，同其尘，是谓玄同。

text.ori_cn: 故不可得而亲，不可得而疏；不可得而利，不可得而害；不可得而贵，不可得而贱，故为天下贵。
text.man_en: Then love and hatred cannot touch him. Profit and loss cannot reach him. Honor and disgrace cannot affect him. Therefore is he always the honored one of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is not possible to be close to the family, or to be distant; it is not possible to be advantageous, or to be detrimental; it is not possible to be expensive, or to be cheap; therefore, it is the world's noblest.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you are not available, you will be close; if you are not available, you will be distant; if you are not available, you will benefit; if you are not available, you will be harmed; if you are not available, you will be noble; if you are not available, you will be humble; therefore, you are noble in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, it cannot be approached, nor can it be distanced; it cannot be benefited, nor can it be harmed; it cannot be honored, nor can it be despised. Thus, it is valued by the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那么，爱与恨都无法触及他。利害不能触及他。荣辱不能及。因此，他永远是世界上最尊贵的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那么爱与恨就无法触及他了。盈亏都无法触及他。荣辱不能影响他。所以他永远是世人的尊贵者之一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 于是爱恨无法触及他，得失不能影响他，荣辱不能动摇他，所以他永远是世间尊贵的人。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十七章 以正治国，以奇用兵，以无事取天下。
text.man_en: 57Rule a kingdom by the Normal. Fight a battle by (abnormal) tactics of surprise. Win the world by doing nothing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 57: Ruling the Country by Righteousness, Using the Army by Oddity, and Taking the World by Nothing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 57: Rule the country with integrity, use military force with surprise, and conquer the world with nothing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 57: Govern the state with integrity; use unconventional tactics in warfare; achieve peace through non-action.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 57 用（正常）战术统治王国。以（非正常）奇袭战术进行战斗。以无为赢得天下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 57、以常理治国。通过（异常）奇袭战术进行战斗。无为而胜天下。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以正常规矩治理国家。以非常的奇策应战。不作为而赢得天下。

text.ori_cn: 以此:天下多忌讳，而民弥贫；民多利器，国家滋昏；人多伎巧，奇物滋起；法令滋彰，盗贼多有。
text.man_en: Through this: the more prohibitions there are, the poorer the people become. The more sharp weapons there are, the greater the chaos in the state. The more skills of technique, the more cunning things are produced. The greater the number of statutes, the greater the number of thieves and brigands.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In this way: the world is full of taboos, and the people are poor; the people are full of sharp instruments, and the country is becoming faint; the people are full of tricks, and the strange things are rising; the decrees are becoming clear, and the thieves are many.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In this way: There are many taboos in the world, but the people are poor; there are many sharp weapons among the people, and the country is in a state of confusion; there are many people with clever tricks, and strange things are many; there are many laws and regulations, and there are many thieves.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore: The more prohibitions in the world, the poorer the people become; the more sharp tools the people possess, the more troubled the country becomes; the more cunning the people become, the more strange things arise; the more laws and decrees proliferate, the more thieves and robbers emerge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 由此可见：禁令越多，百姓越穷。利器越多，国家越乱。技艺越多，狡猾的东西就越多。法令越多，盗贼和强盗就越多。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 由此可见：禁令越多，人民就越穷。利器越多，国家就越混乱。技巧越多，产生的东西就越狡猾。法令的数量越多，盗贼和盗贼的数量就越多。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过这一点：禁令越多，人民就越贫困。利器越多，国家就越混乱。技术技巧越多，产生的狡猾事物也就越多。法令越多，盗贼和强盗也就越多。

text.ori_cn: 故圣人云﹕“我无为而民自化，我好静而民自正，我无事而民自富，我无欲而民自朴。”
text.man_en: Therefore the sage says: “I do nothing and the people are reformed of themselves. I love quietude and the people are righteous of themselves. I deal in no business and the people grow rich by themselves. I have no desires and the people are simple and honest by themselves. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the sage said, "I do nothing and the people transform themselves; I am quiet and the people are righteous; I do nothing and the people are rich; I have no desires and the people are simple."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage said: "If I do nothing, the people will be harmonious. If I like to be quiet, the people will be upright. If I do nothing, the people will be rich. If I have no desires, the people will be simple."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage says: 'By doing nothing, I let the people transform themselves; by loving tranquility, I let the people correct themselves; by being free of desires, I let the people become simple.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故圣人曰："吾无为而民自化。我爱静，民自正。我无生意，而民自富。我无欲，民自朴。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人说：“我无为而民自化。吾爱清静，民自正。我不做生意，老百姓自己富。我无欲无求，民本朴实。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 是以圣人曰：我无为而民自化，我好静而民自正，我无事而民自富，我无欲而民自朴。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十八章 其政闷闷，其民淳淳；其政察察，其民缺缺。
text.man_en: 58When the government is lazy and dull, its people are unspoiled; when the government is efficient and smart, its people are discontented.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 58 His government is stuffy, and his people are simple; his government is perplexed, and his people are deficient.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 58: Its government is boring, but its people are honest; its government is chaotic, but its people are deficient.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Eight: When the government is dull and unwitting, the people are simple and honest; when the government is scrutinizing and exacting, the people are cunning and lacking.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 58当政府懒惰而无趣时，它的人民就不会受到玷污；当政府高效而精明时，它的人民就会心怀不满。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 58、当政府懒惰而迟钝时，其人民就不会受到污染；当政府高效而聪明时，人民就会不满。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当政府懒惰迟钝时，人民就淳朴；当政府高效聪明时，人民就不满。

text.ori_cn: 祸兮福之所倚，福兮祸之所伏。
text.man_en: Disaster is the avenue of fortune, (and) fortune is the concealment for disaster.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: What goes around comes around, and what goes around comes around.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Misfortunes are where blessings depend, and blessings are where misfortunes lie.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Misfortune is where fortune rests; fortune is where misfortune lies hidden.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 灾难是财富的途径，（而）财富是灾难的掩饰。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 祸为福之大道，福为祸之隐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 祸兮福所倚，福兮祸所伏。

text.ori_cn: 其无正。
text.man_en: (As it is), there would never be the normal.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Its no positive.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no justice in it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It has no definite direction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (就像现在这样），永远不会有正常人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （事实上​​），永远不会有常态。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （就像这样），正常永远不会存在。

text.ori_cn: 正复为奇，善复为妖。
text.man_en: But the normal would (immediately) revert to the deceitful. And the good revert to the sinister.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The positive is compounded by the strange, and the good is compounded by the evil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The good ones become strange again, and the good ones become monsters again.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What is right turns to odd, and what is good turns to strange.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但正常人会（立即）变回骗子。善良的人也会变得阴险。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但正常的情况会（立即）恢复到欺骗性的状态。又善复恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但常态会（立即）回到虚伪。而好的会回到阴险。

text.ori_cn: 人之迷，其日固久。
text.man_en: Thus long has mankind gone astray!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People are lost for a long time.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People's confusion lasts for a long time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Man's delusion, indeed, has persisted for a long time.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人类误入歧途已久！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人类已经误入歧途这么久了！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人类已经迷失了这么久！

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人方而不割，廉而不刿，直而不肆，光而不耀。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage is square (has firm principles), but not cutting (sharpcornered), has integrity but does not hurt (others), is straight, but not highhanded, bright, but not dazzling.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the saint's square and not cut, clean and not 600, straight and not wanton, light and not shine.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage is square but not cutting, honest but not prudent, straight but not unruly, bright but not dazzling.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage is square but does not cut, incorruptible but does not harm, straight but not unrestrained, bright but not dazzling.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故圣人方（有坚定的原则）而不割（锐角），廉而不伤（他人），直而不亢，明而不眩。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人方正而不尖锐，有正直而不伤人，正直而不霸道，光明而不耀眼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故方而不割，廉而不刿，直而不肆，光而不耀。

text.ori_cn: § 第五十九章 治人事天，莫若啬。
text.man_en: 59In managing human affairs, there is no better rule than to be sparing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 59: There is nothing like miserliness in the cure of human nature.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 59: When governing people and nature, nothing should be done more than being stingy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Fifty-Nine: In governing people and serving Heaven, there is nothing like frugality.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 59 在管理人类事务方面，最好的规则莫过于 "节约"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 59、治人之道，莫过于节俭。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 59在处理人类事务时，没有比节俭更好的法则了。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯啬，是谓早服；早服谓之重积德；重积德则无不克，无不克则莫知其极；莫知其极，可以有国；有国之母，可以长久。
text.man_en: To be sparing is to forestall; to forestall is to be prepared and strengthened; to be prepared and strengthened is to be evervictorious; to be evervictorious is to have infinite capacity; he who has infinite capacity is fit to rule a country, and the Mother (principle) of a ruling country can long endure.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only mean, is called early service; early service is called heavy accumulation of virtue; heavy accumulation of virtue is no unk, no unk is no knowledge of the extreme; no knowledge of the extreme, you can have a country; there is the mother of the country, you can be long.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Being stingy means early obedience; early obedience means emphasizing accumulation of virtue; if you emphasize accumulation of virtue, you will be able to overcome everything; if you are unable to overcome everything, you will not know the extreme; if you do not know the extreme, you can have a country; if you have the mother of a country, you can last a long time.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only by being frugal can one act early; acting early is called accumulating virtue; accumulating virtue leads to invincibility, and invincibility means no one can fathom one's limits; if no one can fathom one's limits, one can possess a nation; the mother of a nation ensures its longevity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 苟利国家生死以，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之；苟全性命于危难之中，岂因祸福避趋之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 节约就是抢先；预防就是有准备、有加强；做好准备，加强力量，才能百战百胜；常胜则有无限能力；有无限能力的人可以统治国家，统治国家的母亲可以长久。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 节俭即是预先预防；预先预防即是准备和增强；准备和增强即是常胜；常胜即是拥有无限的能力；拥有无限能力者适合统治国家，而统治国家的母性（原则）可以长久存续。

text.ori_cn: 是谓深根固柢，长生久视之道。
text.man_en: This is to be firmly rooted, to have deep strength, the road to immortality and enduring vision.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the way of deep roots and long life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is the way to have deep roots and a long-lasting vision.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called deeply rooted and firmly grounded, the way of long life and enduring vision.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是扎根，这就是深厚的力量，这就是通往不朽和永恒愿景的道路。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是根深蒂固、功力深厚、不朽之道、恒久远见。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这是要扎根于深厚的力量，通往永恒不朽和久远愿景的道路。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十章 治大国，若烹小鲜。
text.man_en: 60Rule a big country as you would fry small fish.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 60 Ruling a large country is like cooking a small meal.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 60: Governing a big country is like cooking small delicacies.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 60: Governing a large country is like cooking a small fish.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 60 治大国如烹小鲜。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 60治大国如煎小鱼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 治大国若烹小鲜。

text.ori_cn: 以道莅天下，其鬼不神；非其鬼不神，其神不伤人；非其神不伤人，圣人亦不伤人。
text.man_en: Who rules the world in accord with Tao Shall find that the spirits lose their power. It is not that the spirits lose their power, but that they cease to do people harm. It is not (only) that they cease to do people harm, the Sage (himself) also does no harm to the people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the world is governed by the Way, its ghosts are not divine; if its ghosts are not divine, its gods do not hurt people; if its gods do not hurt people, the saints do not hurt people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If the Tao comes to the world, its ghosts will not be gods; if it is not its ghosts, it will not be gods, its gods will not hurt people; if it is not its gods, it will not hurt people, and its saints will not hurt people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Governing the world with the Dao, its spirits will not haunt; it is not that the spirits do not haunt, but that their hauntings do not harm people; it is not that their hauntings do not harm people, but that the sage also does not harm people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以 "道 "治天下的人，会发现鬼神失去了力量。不是鬼神失去力量，而是鬼神不再害人。不只是不再伤害人，圣人（自己）也不伤害人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 以道治天下者，神将失其力。并不是神灵失去了力量，而是他们不再伤害人类了。不但不为民所害，圣人亦不为民所害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 依道统治天下的人，会发现鬼神失去了威力。其实鬼神并未失去威力，只是它们不再加害于人。其实不仅是它们不再加害于人，圣人自己也不伤害人民。

text.ori_cn: 夫两不相伤，故德交归焉。
text.man_en: When both do not do each other harm, the original character is restored.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If the two do not hurt each other, the virtue will be returned to them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Husbands and wives do not hurt each other, so their virtues return to each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, as they do not harm each other, virtue mutually returns to them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当两者互不伤害时，就会恢复原来的特性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当两者不互相伤害时，就会恢复原来的性格。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当双方都不伤害对方时，原本的性格就会恢复。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十一章 大国者下流，天下之交，天下之牝。
text.man_en: 61A big country (should be like) the delta lowregions, being the concourse of the world, (and) the Female of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 61 The Great Powers are inferior to the world's friends and the world's mare.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 61: Those of great powers are inferior, friends of the world, and women of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 61: A great nation is like the low ground toward which all streams flow. It is the receptive feminine of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 61 一个大国（应该像）三角洲低地一样，是世界的中心，（也）是世界的女性。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 61一个大国（应该像）三角洲低地，是世界的中心，（和）世界的女性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大国应当像三角洲低洼地区，是世界的汇合之处，(就像)世界的女人。

text.ori_cn: 牝常以静胜牡，以静为下。
text.man_en: The Female overcomes the Male by quietude, and achieves the lowly position by quietude.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The female often outperforms the male by being quiet, and being quiet is the next best thing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The female often wins over the male by being quiet, and the male is inferior by being quiet.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The female often prevails over the male through stillness, considering stillness as humility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 雌性以安静战胜雄性，以安静获得卑微的地位。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 女以静胜男，以静而居卑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 雌性通过安静克服雄性，并通过安静取得低微的地位。

text.ori_cn: 故大国以下小国，则取小国；小国以下大国，则取大国。
text.man_en: Therefore if a big country places itself below a small country it absorbs the small country. (And) if a small country places itself below a big country, it absorbs the big country.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if a large country is below a small country, then a small country is taken; if a small country is below a large country, then a large country is taken.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if a big country is below a small country, then it is a small country; if a small country is below a big country, it is a big country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, if a great nation serves a smaller one, it will gain the smaller nation; if a smaller nation serves a great one, it will gain the great nation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，如果一个大国把自己置于一个小国之下，它就会吞并小国。(而）如果一个小国把自己置于大国之下，它就会吞并大国。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，如果一个大国将自己置于一个小国之下，它就会吸收这个小国。 （并且）如果一个小国将自己置于大国之下，它就会吸收大国。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 故大道下小国，则取小国；小国下大国，则取大国。

text.ori_cn: 故或下以取，或下而取。
text.man_en: Therefore some place themselves low to absorb (others), some are (naturally) low and absorb (others).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is either down to take, or down to take.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, you can either go down to get it, or you can go down and get it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, sometimes obtaining by going lower, or obtaining through humility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，有些人把自己放在低处以吸收（他人），有些人（自然）处于低处并吸收（他人）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，有些人将自己置于低位，难以吸收（其他人），有些人（自然）处于低位并吸收（其他人）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，有些人使自己处于低位以吸收他人，有些人则天生处于低位以吸收他人。

text.ori_cn: 大国不过欲兼畜人，小国不过欲人事人。
text.man_en: What a big country wants is but to shelter others, and what a small country wants is but to be able to come in and be sheltered.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A large country is only interested in both animals and people, while a small country is only interested in people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A big country just wants to be a beast and a human being, a small country just wants to be a human being.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Great nations seek only to encompass and nurture people, while small nations solely aspire to serve and attend to others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大国想要的只是庇护他人，而小国想要的只是能够进来并得到庇护。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大国所求不过是庇护他人，小国所求不过是能进来受庇护。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大国所追求的不过是庇护他人，而小国所希望的不过是能够进入并得到庇护。

text.ori_cn: 夫两者各得其所欲，大者宜为下。
text.man_en: Thus (considering) that both may have what they want, a big country ought to place itself low.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If each of the two is desirable, the greater is preferable to the lesser.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Each of them gets what they want, and the bigger one should be the lower one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If both parties each get what they desire, it is fitting that the greater one should yield.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，（考虑到）双方都可能得到自己想要的东西，大国应该把自己放在低位。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以大国应该各取所需，把自己摆低点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此（考虑到）双方都能得到他们想要的东西，大国应该谦虚处下。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十二章 道者万物之奥。
text.man_en: 62Tao is the mysterious secret of the universe,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 62 The Tao is the mystery of all things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 62: Tao is the secret of all things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Sixty-Two: The Dao is the profound mystery of all things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 62 道是宇宙的奥秘、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 62道是宇宙的神秘秘密，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 道是宇宙的神秘秘密，

text.ori_cn: 善人之宝，不善人之所保。
text.man_en: the good man's treasure, and the bad man's refuge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The treasure of the good man is preserved by the ungodly.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The treasure of good people is the preserve of bad people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The treasure of a good person is something that a bad person cannot keep.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 好人的宝藏，坏人的避难所。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 善人的宝藏，坏人的皈依处。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 好人的珍宝，坏人的庇护所。

text.ori_cn: 美言可以市尊,美行可以加人。
text.man_en: Beautiful saying can be sold at the market, noble conduct can be presented as a gift.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A good word will bring honour to the city, and a good deed will increase the number of people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Good words can attract people, and good deeds can attract people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Pleasant words can earn respect, and good deeds can enhance one's reputation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 美言可以在市场上出售，高尚的行为可以作为礼物赠送。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 美言可以市售，高尚品行可以送礼。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 美好的言辞可以拿到市场上出售，高尚的品行可以作为礼物赠送。

text.ori_cn: 故立天子，置三公，虽有拱璧以先驷马，不如坐进此道。
text.man_en: Therefore on the crowning of an emperor, on the appointment of the Three Ministers, rather than send tributes of jade and teams of four horses, send in the tribute of Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the establishment of the Son of Heaven, set up the three princes, although there are archbishops to first team of horses, not as good as sitting in this way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, when the emperor is established and the three princes are installed, even if he has a jade to ride his horse first, it is not as good as sitting in this way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, to establish the Emperor and assign the Three Dukes, even though one may present precious jade and fine horses, it is not as valuable as promoting this Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，在皇帝登基、任命三公时，与其进贡玉帛和四马，不如进贡道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故称帝，任三大臣，不进贡玉石、四马队，而进贡道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，在皇帝加冕和三公任命之时，与其送上玉器和四马车队的贡品，不如送上道的贡品。

text.ori_cn: 故为天下贵。
text.man_en: Therefore is (tao) the treasure of the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, it is precious for the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is noble in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, it is valued by the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故（道）为天下之宝。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故为天下之宝。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，道是世界的宝藏。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十三章 为无为，事无事，味无味。
text.man_en: 63 Accomplish donothing. Attend to noaffairs. Taste the flavorless.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER LXIII There is nothing to be done, nothing to be done, and nothing to be tasted.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 63: Doing nothing, doing nothing, tasteless.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 63: Act without striving, manage without meddling, savor the flavorless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 63 无所事事。无事可做。品味无味。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 63 不做任何事。不去管任何事务。尝尝无味。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为无为，事无事，味无味。

text.ori_cn: 大小多少，报怨以德。
text.man_en: Whether it is big or small, many or few, requite hatred with virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: How big or small, pay back the grudge in kind.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No matter how big or small, report grievances with virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: No matter the size, repay grievances with virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 无论大小、多寡，都要以德报怨。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不论大小，多寡，以德报怨。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 无论大或者小，无论多或者少，以德报怨。

text.ori_cn: 图难于其易，为大于其细；天下难事必作于易，天下大事必作于细。
text.man_en: Deal with the difficult while yet it is easy; deal wit the big while yet it is small. The difficult (problems) of the world must be dealt with while they are yet easy;the great (problems) of the world must be dealt with while they are yet small.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The figure is harder than it is easy, and the work is greater than it is fine; the world's difficult things must be made easy, and the world's great things must be made fine.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The picture is more difficult than the easy, and the details are greater than the details; the difficult things in the world must be done in the easy, and the great things in the world must be done in the details.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Tackle difficulties while they are easy; handle the great while they are small. The world's difficult tasks are done starting with the easy ones; the world's great tasks are done starting with the small ones.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天下难事，必作于易；天下大事，必作于细。天下难事，必作于易；天下大事，必作于细。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 处理困难，其实很容易；处理大事却又处理小事。天下之难，须趁其轻而易之；天下之大，须趁其小而去。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 图难于其易，为大于其细。天下难事，必作于易；天下大事，必作于细。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人终不为大，故能成其大。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage by never dealing with great (problems) accomplishes greatness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the saints are not great in the end that they can become great.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the saint is not great in the end, so he can become great.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage never seeks to be great, and therefore can achieve greatness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人从不处理重大（问题），从而成就了伟大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人不处理大事，就能成就大事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，圣人以不处理重大（问题）来成就伟大。

text.ori_cn: 夫轻诺必寡信，多易必多难。
text.man_en: He who lightly makes a promise will find it often hard to keep his faith. He who makes light of many things will encounter many difficulties.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man who makes light promises will have little faith, and much ease will make much difficulty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a husband makes a promise lightly, he will be distrustful; if it is easy, it will be difficult.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A promise made lightly is seldom kept; taking things too easily often leads to difficulties.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 轻率许诺的人往往难以守信。轻言许多事的人，会遇到许多困难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 轻率许下承诺的人往往很难兑现自己的信念。轻视许多事情的人会遇到许多困难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 轻诺者常难以守信，视事轻者将遇到许多困难。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人犹难之，故终无难矣。
text.man_en: Hence even the Sage regards things as difficult, and for that reason never meets with difficulties.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the saints are still difficult, so there is no difficulty in the end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is still difficult for a saint, so it will not be difficult in the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, even the sage finds it difficult, but in the end, there are no difficulties.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，即使是圣人也会把事情看得很困难，并因此从不遇到困难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人也认为事情是困难的，所以从来不会遇到困难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，即使是圣人也认为事情困难，正因如此，才从来不会遇到困难。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十四章 其安易持，其未兆易谋。
text.man_en: 64That which lies still is easy to hold; that which is not yet manifest is easy to forestall;
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 64 Its peace is easy to hold, and its unaccountable signs are easy to plan.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 64: Its security is easy to maintain, and its lack of warning is easy to plan.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Sixty-Four: What is stable is easy to maintain; what is yet unborn is easy to plan for.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 64静者易守，未显者易防；
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 64、保持静止，容易抓住；尚未显现的事情很容易被预防；
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 静者易持，未兆者易谋；

text.ori_cn: 其脆易泮，其微易散。
text.man_en: that which is brittle (like ice) easily melts; that which is minute easily scatters.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is brittle and easy to pam, and its micro is easy to disperse.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is brittle and easy to spread, and its texture is easy to fall apart.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is brittle and easily crumbles, delicate and easily scatters.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 脆的（如冰）容易融化；微小的容易散开。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 易碎的东西（如冰）很容易融化；微小的东西容易分散。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 脆如冰者易融化；微如尘者易散开。

text.ori_cn: 为之于未有，治之于未乱。
text.man_en: Deal with a thing before it is there; check disorder before it is rife.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: For the sake of the unseen, to rule over the unruly.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Do it before it exists, and fix it before it is in chaos.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Handle it before it appears; organize it before it becomes chaotic.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 防患于未然，治乱于未萌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在事情发生之前就处理它；在混乱蔓延之前进行检查。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 事前处理问题，防微杜渐。

text.ori_cn: 合抱之木，生于毫末；九层之台，起于垒土；千里之行，始于足下。
text.man_en: A tree with a full span's girth begins from a tiny sprout; a ninestoried terrace begins with a clod of earth. A journey of a thousand li beings at one's feet.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A tree is born at the end of a millimetre; a nine-storey platform is built on a base; a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The tree that hugs each other is born from the smallest grain; the nine-story platform starts from the base of the earth; the journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A towering tree grows from a small sprout; a nine-story terrace starts with a pile of earth; a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 合抱之木，生于毫末；九层之台，起于累土。千里之行，始于足下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一棵树的周长是从一个微小的芽开始的；九层露台始于一块土。脚下千里众生之行。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 合抱之木，生于毫末；九层之台，起于垒土；千里之行，始于足下。

text.ori_cn: 为者败之，执者失之。
text.man_en: He who acts, spoils; he who grasps, lets slip.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who work for it lose it, and those who enforce it lose it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who do it will fail, and those who insist will lose it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He who acts will fail; he who grasps will lose.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谁行动，谁遭殃；谁抓住，谁失足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 行动者，破坏；抓住的人就会溜走。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为者败之，执者失之。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人无为故无败，无执故无失。
text.man_en: Because the Sage does not act, he does not spoil, because he does not grasp, he does not let slip.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the sages do nothing that they do not lose, and because they do not hold on to anything that they do not lose.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is because the sage has no motives and therefore has no failures, and has no attachments and therefore has no failures.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage acts without striving and hence suffers no defeat, remains detached and hence incurs no loss.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为圣人不为，所以不溺；因为圣人不抓，所以不漏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人因为不作为，所以不破坏，因为不执着，所以不放失。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为圣人无为，他不破坏；因为他不执着，他不失去。

text.ori_cn: 民之从事，常于几成而败之。
text.man_en: The affairs of men are often spoiled within an ace of completion.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The people's engagement is often defeated in a few successes.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: People often succeed and fail in their pursuits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People often fail just when they are about to succeed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人世间的事，往往在完成的一瞬间就被毁掉了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 男人的事情往往会在王牌完成后被破坏。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人类的事物常常在接近完成时弄糟。

text.ori_cn: 慎终如始，则无败事。
text.man_en: By being careful at the end as at the beginning failure is averted.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are careful with the end as you are with the beginning, you will not fail.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you are as careful as you are at the end, you will never fail.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If one remains as cautious at the end as at the beginning, there will be no failures.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只要在最后和开始时一样小心谨慎，就能避免失败。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 通过在最后像开始时一样小心，可以避免失败。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 慎始如终，避祸于无形。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人欲不欲，不贵难得之货；学不学，复众人之所过。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage desires to have no desire, and values not objects difficult to obtain. Learns that which is unlearned, and restores what the multitude have lost.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is why the saint desires not to be expensive for hard-to-get goods; and learns not to be learned, but to compound the excesses of the multitude.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if a sage has desires or desires, he does not value hard-to-find goods; if he learns or does not learn, he will repeat the mistakes of others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage desires no desires, does not value rare commodities; learns without learning, and rectifies the mistakes of the multitude.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 故圣人欲无欲，不贵难得之物。学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人欲无欲，贵不难得之物。学习未学之物，恢复大众所失去的东西。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 是以聖人欲不欲，不貴難得之貨，學不學，復眾人之所過。

text.ori_cn: 以辅万物之自然，而不敢为。
text.man_en: That he may assist in the course of Nature and not presume to interfere.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: to supplement the nature of all things, and dare not do so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To supplement the nature of all things, but not dare to do anything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Assisting all things in accordance with nature, without daring to interfere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他可以协助大自然的进程，但不能妄加干涉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 他可以协助自然的进程而不是干涉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他可以帮助自然的进程而不是妄图干涉。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十五章 古之善为道者，非以明民，将以愚之。
text.man_en: 65The ancients who knew how to follow the Tao aimed not to enlighten the people. But to keep them ignorant.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 65 The good men of old, who were good at the Way, were not to enlighten the people, but would fool them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 65: Those who were good in ancient times would not enlighten the people, but they would make them stupid.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 65: Those excellent in practicing the Way in ancient times did not seek to enlighten the people, but intended to keep them simple.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 65 懂得遵循 "道 "的古人的目的不是为了启迪民众。而是让他们愚昧无知。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 65古人知道，不以教民为目的。但为了让他们无知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古代懂得遵循道的人，不是为了启发民众，而是为了让他们保持愚昧。

text.ori_cn: 民之难治，以其智多。
text.man_en: The reason it is difficult for the people to leave in peace is because of too much knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The people are hard to rule because they have a lot of wisdom.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The people are difficult to govern because of their wisdom.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The difficulty in governing the people lies in their excessive intelligence.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们之所以难以平静地离开，是因为知识太多。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人们之所以难以安心离开，是因为知识太多了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 百姓难以安居乐业的原因是知识过多。

text.ori_cn: 故以智治国，国之贼；不以智治国，国之福。
text.man_en: Those who seek to rule a country by knowledge are the nation's curse. Those who seek not to rule a country by knowledge are the nation's blessing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, if you rule by wisdom, you are a thief of the country; if you do not rule by wisdom, you are a blessing of the country.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you govern a country with wisdom, you will be a traitor to the country; if you do not govern a country with wisdom, you will be a blessing to the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, governing the country with cleverness is a bane to the nation; not governing with cleverness is a blessing to the nation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 以知识治国者，国之祸也。不以知治国者，国之福也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些试图以知识统治国家的人是国家的诅咒。不以知识治国的人，是国家之福。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 以知识治理国家的人是国家的祸害；不以知识治理国家的人是国家的福音。

text.ori_cn: 知此两者亦稽式。
text.man_en: Those who know these two (principles) also know the ancient standard,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Know that both of them are also in the same style.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing that these two are also similar.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Knowing these two principles also conforms to the standard.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 知道这两点（原则）的人也就知道了古代的标准、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 知此二者，亦知古标准，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知晓这两个原则的人，也知道古代的标准，

text.ori_cn: 常知稽式，是谓玄德。
text.man_en: and to know always the ancient standard is called the Mystic Virtue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The constant knowledge of the auditing style is called Xuan De.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Changzhi Jishi is called Xuande.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Understanding and adhering to the ancient principles is called profound virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 常知古标，谓之玄德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 常知古法，谓之玄德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 常知古之道，是谓玄德。

text.ori_cn: 玄德深矣，远矣，与物反矣，然后乃至大顺。
text.man_en: When the Mystic Virtue becomes clear, farreaching, and things revert back (to their source) then and then only emerges the Grand Harmony.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Xuan De is deep, far away, and things against, and then even the Great Shun.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Xuande is deep, far away, contrary to things, and then even smooth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Profound and distant is the virtue, reversing the natural course of things, and then attaining great harmony.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 当神秘的美德变得清晰、深远，万物回归（其本源）时，才会出现大和谐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当玄德明了、深远了、万物还归时，才出现太和。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当玄德变得清澈、广泛，万物复归（本源），那时才会出现大和谐。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十六章 江海所以能为百谷王者，以其善下之，故能为百谷王。
text.man_en: 66How did the great rivers and seas become the Lords of the ravines? By being good at keeping low. That was how they became Lords of the Ravines.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 66: Jiang Hai is therefore able to be the king of all the valleys, because he is good at going down.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 66 The reason why Jiang Hai can be the king of hundreds of valleys is because he is good at handling it, so he can be the king of hundreds of valleys.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Sixty-Six: The reason why the sea can be the king of all valleys is because it lies below them; therefore, it can be the king of all valleys.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 66 大江大海是如何成为峡谷之主的？因为它们善于低调。它们就是这样成为峡谷之王的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 66大江大海何为峡谷之主？善于保持低调。这就是他们成为峡谷领主的方式。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 江海所以能为百谷王者，以其善下之，故能为百谷王。

text.ori_cn: 是以欲上民，必以言下之。
text.man_en: Therefore in order to be the chief among the people, one must speak like their inferiors.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that if you want to go up to the people, you must go down with words.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if you want to go up to the people, you must speak down.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, to lead the people, one must speak to them humbly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，要想成为人民的首领，就必须像他们的下级那样说话。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故欲为民中之长者，必如其下者言也。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，若想成为众人之首，必须像卑微者那样说话。

text.ori_cn: 欲先民，必以身后之。
text.man_en: In order to be foremost among the people, one must walk behind them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you want to precede the people, you must follow them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you want to lead the people, you must leave them behind.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If you wish to lead the people, you must place yourself behind them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 要想在众人中脱颖而出，就必须走在众人的后面。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 要想成为人民中的佼佼者，就必须走在人民的后面。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 要在众人之先，须居于众人之后。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人处上而民不重，处前而民不害。
text.man_en: Thus it is that the Sage stays above, and the people do not feel his weight; walks in front, and the people do not wish him harm.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the sages are at the top and the people are not heavy, and they are at the front and the people are not harmed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, when a sage is at the top, the people do not take him seriously, and when he is at the front, the people do not harm him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage resides above but the people do not feel burdened; he places himself before others but the people do not feel harmed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 是故圣人居上，而民不觉其重；行于前，而民不忍其害。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 是故圣人居于上，民不觉其重；走在前面，百姓不希望他受到伤害。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人居于上位，人们不感到他的压力；走在前面，人们不愿伤害他。

text.ori_cn: 是以天下乐推而不厌，以其不争，故天下莫能与之争。
text.man_en: Then the people of the world are glad to uphold him forever. Because he does not contend, No one in the world can contend against him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the world is happy to push and not get tired of it, and because it does not compete, there is no one in the world who can compete with it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the world is happy to push and never tire of it, and because it does not fight, no one in the world can fight with it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the world takes joy in supporting him and does not tire of it. Because he does not compete, no one in the world can compete with him.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 于是，世人乐于永远拥护他。因为他不争，所以世上无人能与他抗衡。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那么天下人民就乐意永远拥护他。因他不争，天下无人能与他争。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 然后，世界上的人们很高兴永远支持他。因为他不争斗，世界上没有人能够与他抗衡。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十七章 天下皆谓我道大，似不肖。
text.man_en: 67All the world says: my teaching (Tao) greatly resembles folly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER LXVII All the world says that I am a great Taoist, and seem to be unworthy of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 67: Everyone in the world calls me great, which seems unworthy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 67: All under heaven say that my Dao is great but seems unrefined.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 67 世人皆曰：吾之教（道）大似愚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 67、天下人都说：我的道，大如愚昧。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所有人都说：我的教诲（道）极像愚蠢。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯大，故似不肖。
text.man_en: Because it is great; therefore it resembles folly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man is only big, so he seems to be unworthy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: My husband is big, so he seems unworthy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because it is great that it seems unbecoming.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为它伟大，所以它像愚蠢。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为它伟大；因此它类似于愚蠢。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为它是伟大的；因此它看起来像愚蠢。

text.ori_cn: 一曰慈，二曰俭，三曰不敢为天下先。
text.man_en: The first is Love. The second is, never too much. The third is, never be the first in the world.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first is to be kind, the second is to be frugal, and the third is not to dare to be the first in the world.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The first is compassion, the second is frugality, and the third is not daring to be the first in the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First is kindness, second is frugality, and third is not daring to be ahead of the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一是爱。第二是永不嫌多。第三是，永远不做世界第一。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第一个是爱。第二个是，永远不要太多。第三是，永远不做世界第一。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第一是爱。第二是，永不嫌多。第三是，永远不要做世界第一。

text.ori_cn: 慈故能勇；俭故能广；不敢为天下先，故能成器长。
text.man_en: 1Through Love, one has no fear; through not doing too much, one has amplitude (of reserve power); through not presuming to be the first in the world, one can develop one's talent and let it mature.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are kind, you can be brave; if you are frugal, you can be broad; if you don't dare to be the first in the world, you can become a long-lasting organ.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Kindness leads to courage; frugality leads to broadness; not daring to be the first in the world, so one can become a leader.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Because of compassion, one can be courageous; because of frugality, one can be generous; because of not daring to be ahead of the world, one can become a leader.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1通过爱，人就没有恐惧；通过不做太多的事，人就有（后备力量的）余地；通过不妄自菲薄，人就能发挥自己的才能，让它成熟。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 1 因爱，人不再有恐惧；不做太多，就有幅度；不争天下第一，才能发挥才华，使其成熟。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 通过爱，人没有恐惧；通过不做过多的事情，人有充足的储备力量；通过不自认为是世界第一，人可以发展自己的才华并使其成熟。

text.ori_cn: 夫慈以战则胜，以守则固。
text.man_en: For love is victorious in attack, and invulnerable in defense.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are merciful, you will win by fighting, and you will be strong by the code.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A kind husband will win by fighting, and he will be strong by observing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He who fights with compassion will win, and he who defends with compassion will be steadfast.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为爱是进攻的胜利者，也是防守的无懈可击者。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为爱在进攻中是胜利的，在防御中是无懈可击的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为爱在进攻中胜利，在防守中无懈可击。

text.ori_cn: 天将救之，以慈卫之。
text.man_en: Heaven arms with love those it would not see destroyed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: God will save it and defend it with mercy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heaven will save him and protect him with mercy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When heaven intends to save someone, it guards them with compassion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上天用爱拥抱那些它不愿看到毁灭的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天堂用爱武装那些它不希望被毁灭的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上天用爱保护那些它不愿看到被毁灭的人。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十八章 善为士者不武；善战者不怒；善胜敌者不与；善用人者为之下。
text.man_en: 68The brave soldier is not violent; the good fighter does not lose his temper; the great conqueror does not fight (on small issues); the good user of men places himself below others.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER LXVIII He who is good as a soldier is not martial; he who is good at war is not angry; he who is good at winning over the enemy is not with him; he who makes good use of men is under him.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 68: He who is good at being a soldier will not use force; he who is good at fighting will not be angry; he who is good at defeating the enemy will not fight against him; he who is good at using people will be subordinate.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Sixty-Eight: The one skilled in being a warrior is not bellicose; the one skilled in battle is not wrathful; the one skilled in defeating the enemy does not engage them; the one skilled in using people positions himself below them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 68勇敢的士兵不暴躁，优秀的战士不发脾气，伟大的征服者不（在小问题上）争斗，善于使用人的人将自己置于他人之下。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 68、勇猛的士兵不暴力；善斗者不发脾气；伟大的征服者不打仗（在小事上）；善用人的人将自己置于他人之下。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 勇敢的士兵不暴力；优秀的战士不轻易发怒；伟大的征服者不为了小事作战；善于用人的人把自己置于他人之下。

text.ori_cn: 是谓不争之德，是谓用人之力，是谓配天，古之极。
text.man_en: This is the virtue of notcontending, is called the capacity to use men, is reaching to the height of being Mated to Heaven, to what was of old.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the virtue of non-competition, the power of using people, and the ancient pole of being worthy of heaven.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is called the virtue of not fighting, it is called using human strength, it is called coordinating with heaven, it is the pinnacle of ancient times.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called the virtue of not contending, the strength of utilizing others, the alignment with Heaven, the ultimate ideal of antiquity.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是 "不争 "的美德，被称为 "用人之能"，达到了 "天人合一"、"古为今用 "的高度。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 此乃不争之德，名曰用人之才，达到与天相配的高度，达到了古人的境界。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是不争的美德，谓之用人之才，达到了与天合一的境界，回归古昔的状态。

text.ori_cn: § 第六十九章 用兵有言﹕“吾不敢为主而为客，不敢进寸而退尺。”
text.man_en: 69There is the maxim of military strategists; I dare not be the first to invade, but rather be the invaded. Dare not press forward an inch, but rather retreat a foot.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 69 There is a saying in the use of war, "I dare not be a host but a guest; I dare not advance an inch but retreat a foot."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 69: There is a saying in using troops: "I dare not act as a guest for the host, nor dare to retreat even an inch."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Sixty-Nine: On the Art of War, it is said, 'I do not dare to take the initiative as a host, but rather act as a guest; I do not dare to advance an inch, but rather retreat a foot.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 69军事家有句格言：我不敢率先入侵，而宁愿被入侵。不敢前进一寸，宁可后退一尺。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 69、兵家有格言，我不敢做第一个入侵者，但宁愿成为被入侵者。不敢进一寸，却敢退一尺。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 军事战略家有一句名言：我不敢首先发动侵略，而宁可被侵略。不敢前进一步，而宁可退后一步。

text.ori_cn: 是谓行无行，攘无臂，仍无敌，执无兵。
text.man_en: That is, to march without formations, to roll up the sleeves, to charge not in frontal attacks, to arm without weapons.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is said that there are no rows, no hustling, no arms, still no enemies, and no armies to execute.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that there is no action in action, no arms in fighting, but there is still no enemy, and no soldiers in holding.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called acting without action, brandishing without arms, being invincible without an adversary, and wielding without weapons.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是，行军不列队，挽起袖子，冲锋不正面进攻，武装不带武器。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 即行军无阵，卷起袖子，不正面冲锋，武装无武器。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 也就是，无需编队行军，挽起衣袖，不进行正面攻击，不带武器武装。

text.ori_cn: 祸莫大于轻敌，轻敌几丧吾宝。
text.man_en: There is no greater catastrophe than to underestimate the enemy. To underestimate the enemy might entail the loss of my treasures.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The worst thing that can happen to us is that we will lose our treasure if we are not careful with our enemies.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no greater disaster than underestimating the enemy. Underestimating the enemy will cost us our treasure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is no greater misfortune than underestimating the enemy; underestimating the enemy nearly cost us our treasure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最大的灾难莫过于轻敌。低估敌人可能会让我失去宝藏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没有比轻敌更大的灾难了。低估敌人可能会导致我的财宝丢失。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 没有比低估敌人更大的灾难了。低估敌人可能会导致我失去宝贵的东西。

text.ori_cn: 故抗兵相加，哀者胜矣。
text.man_en: Therefore when two equally matched armies meet, it is the man of sorrow who wins.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the resistance is added to the war, and the mourners win.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if the resisting troops add up, the one who mourns will win.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, when two armies oppose each other, it is the one that mourns which will be victorious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，当两支势均力敌的军队相遇时，悲伤的人才能获胜。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故两军相逢，悲者胜。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，当两支势均力敌的军队相遇时，胜利的将是那个充满忧伤的人。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十章 吾言甚易知，甚易行。
text.man_en: 70My teachings are very easy to understand and very easy to practice,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 70 My words are very easy to know and very easy to do.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 70 My words are easy to understand and easy to do.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 70: My words are very easy to understand and very easy to practice.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 70 我的教诲非常容易理解，也非常容易实践、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 70我的教法很容易理解，也很容易修行，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的教义非常容易理解，非常容易实践，

text.ori_cn: 天下莫能知，莫能行。
text.man_en: but no one can understand them and no one can practice them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is nothing in heaven that can be known or done.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No one in the world can know it, and no one can do it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: No one in the world can understand it, no one can accomplish it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但没有人能理解它们，也没有人能实践它们。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但没有人能够理解它们，也没有人能够实践它们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但是没有人能理解它们，也没有人能实践它们。

text.ori_cn: 言有宗，事有君。
text.man_en: In my words there is a principle. In the affairs of men there is a system.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a clan for words and a ruler for deeds.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Words have a lineage, and affairs have a king.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Words have principles, actions have their rulers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我的话里有一个原则。在人的事务中，有一个系统。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 用我的话来说，有一个原则。人类的事务有一个系统。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 我的话里有原则。人与人之间的事务有规矩。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯无知，是以不我知。
text.man_en: Because they know not these, they also know me not.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that is ignorant is that it is not my knowledge.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: I am ignorant, because I don’t know.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because you do not know, that you do not understand me.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为他们不知道这些，所以他们也不知道我。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为他们不知道这些，他们也不知道我。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为他们不知道这些事，所以他们也不了解我。

text.ori_cn: 知我者希，则我者贵。
text.man_en: Since there are few that know me, therefore I am distinguished.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you know me, then I am precious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who know me are desirable, and those who know me are valuable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who understand me are few, hence those who value me are precious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因为认识我的人很少，所以我很出众。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因为认识我的人很少，所以我很尊贵。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 由于了解我的人很少，所以我才显得与众不同。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人被褐怀玉。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage wears a coarse cloth on top and carries jade within his bosom.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the saints who are brown and pregnant.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the saint is cherished by the emperor.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage wears coarse clothes but conceals jade within.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人上衣粗布，怀中揣玉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人身上披着粗布，怀里怀着玉佩。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人外表穿着粗布衣服，怀中却藏着美玉。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十一章 知不知，上；不知知，病。
text.man_en: 71Who knows that he does not know is the highest; who (pretends to) know what he does not know is sickminded.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 71 Knowing and not knowing, supra; not knowing and not knowing, sickness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 71: Knowing or not knowing is the best; not knowing is the disease.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 71: To know that one does not know is best; to not know but think one knows is a disease.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 71 知道自己不知道的，是最高的；（假装）知道自己不知道的，是有病的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 71、知者无知者为最高；那些（假装）知道自己不知道的人是有病的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 知其不知者，高矣；伪知其不知者，病态也。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯病病，是以不病。
text.man_en: And who recognizes sickmindedness as sickmindedness is not sickminded.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only way to be sick is to be sick.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Wu Wei is sick, so he is not sick.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only by being constantly vigilant can you avoid trouble.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 把病态当作病态的人就不是病态。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些承认病态是病态的人就不是病态。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 能认识到病态心理是病态心理的人，本身就不是病态心理。

text.ori_cn: 圣人不病，以其病病，是以不病。
text.man_en: The Sage is not sickminded. Because he recognizes sickmindedness as sickmindness, therefore he is not sickminded.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saints are not sick, because they are sick.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage is not sick because he is sick because he is sick, so he is not sick.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A sage does not fall ill because he views illness as illness, thus he does not fall ill.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人没有病态。因为他认识到 "病态 "就是 "病态"，所以他不是 "病态"。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人没有病态。因为他认识到病态就是病态，所以他不是病态。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人没有病态心理。因为他能认识到病态心理是病态心理，所以他没有病态心理。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十二章 民不畏威，大威至矣。
text.man_en: 72When people have no fear of force, then (as is the common practice) great force descends upon them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 72 The people do not fear the mighty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 72: The people are not afraid of authority, and great authority comes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 72: When the people do not fear authority, great authority descends upon them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 72当人们不惧怕武力时，巨大的力量就会降临到他们身上（这是常见的做法）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 72当人们不畏惧武力时，巨大的武力就会降临到他们身上（这是常见的做法）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当人们对武力没有恐惧时，就像通常的情况一样，巨大的武力会降临在他们身上。

text.ori_cn: 无狭其所居，无厌其所生。
text.man_en: Despise not their dwellings, dislike not their progeny.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no narrowing of their dwellings, no loathing of their births.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No matter where he lives, no matter where he lives.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: They neither resent their dwelling places nor detest their births.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不要鄙视他们的住所，不要嫌弃他们的后代。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 不要轻视他们的住所，不要厌恶他们的子孙。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 不要蔑视他们的住所，不要厌恶他们的后代。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯不厌，是以不厌。
text.man_en: 1Because you do not dislike them, you will not be disliked yourself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that I don't get tired of is that I don't get tired of it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Husband never gets tired of it, so he never gets tired of it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is precisely because you do not seek satisfaction that you do not experience dissatisfaction.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1因为你不讨厌他们，所以你自己也不会被讨厌。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 1因为你不讨厌他们，所以你自己也不会被讨厌。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因为你不讨厌他们，所以你自己也不会被讨厌。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人自知不自见；自爱不自贵。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage knows himself, but does not show himself, loves himself, but does not exalt himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that the saint knows himself and does not see himself; loves himself and does not value himself.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the saint knows himself but does not see himself; he loves himself but does not value himself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage knows himself but does not seek to be seen; loves himself but does not seek to be esteemed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人自知而不自显，自爱而不自高。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人知己而不显己，爱己而不自高。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人知己而不自显，爱己而不自伐。

text.ori_cn: 故去彼取此。
text.man_en: Therefore he rejects the one (force) and accepts the other (gentility).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: So go to the other side and take this one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: So go to that one and take this one.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Abandon that, seize this.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，他拒绝了一种（武力），接受了另一种（温和）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 因此，他拒绝其中之一（强制）并接受另一个（温柔）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此他拒绝了一个（力量），接受了另一个（温文尔雅）。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十三章 勇于敢则杀，勇于不敢则活。
text.man_en: 73Who is brave in daring (you) kill, who is brave in not daring (you) let live.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 73: If you are brave enough to dare, you will kill; if you are brave enough not to dare, you will live.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 73: If you are brave enough, you will be killed; if you are brave, you will live.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Seventy-Three: The courageous who dare are killed, the courageous who do not dare live.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 73 谁敢于（你）杀人，谁就敢于不敢（你）放生。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 73、谁敢杀，谁勇不敢活。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谁敢杀，是勇气；谁敢不杀，是更大的勇气。

text.ori_cn: 此两者，或利或害。
text.man_en: In these two, there is some advantage and some disadvantage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: These two, either beneficial or harmful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Both of these may be beneficial or harmful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: These two aspects can be either beneficial or harmful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这两者各有利弊。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这两者各有优点，也各有缺点。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这两者各有优劣。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人犹难之。
text.man_en: Therefore even the Sage regards it as a difficult question.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the saints are still difficult.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, it is still difficult for saints to do this.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, even a sage would find it difficult.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，就连圣人也认为这是一个难题。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以连圣人也认为这是一个难题。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，即使是贤人也认为这是一个难题。

text.ori_cn: 天之道，不争而善胜，不言而善应，不召而自来，繟然而善谋。
text.man_en: Heaven's Way (Tao) is good at conquest without strife, rewarding (vice and virtue) without words, making its appearance without call, achieving results without obvious design.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way of heaven is not to fight but to win, not to speak but to answer, not to call but to come, not to call but to plan.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way of heaven is to be good at winning without fighting, to be good at responding without saying anything, to come on your own without being called, and to be silent but good at planning.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of heaven is to win without contention, respond without words, come without being summoned, and devise without haste.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天道（道）善于征伐而不争，赏赐（恶德和美德）而不言，显现而不召，成就而不显。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天道善于征服而不争，奖赏而不言，使之出现而不呼，取得结果而不明显的设计。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天道善胜而不争，善报德与过而不言，善显现而不招，善成就而不设。

text.ori_cn: 天网恢恢，疏而不失。
text.man_en: The heaven's net is broad and wide. With big meshes, yet letting nothing slip through.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The net of heaven is wide open.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sky net is vast, sparse but not lost.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The net of heaven is vast and wide, but it lets nothing slip through.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天网恢恢，疏而不漏。大网恢恢，疏而不漏。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天上的网是宽广的。网眼很大，但又不让任何东西漏掉。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天网恢恢，疏而不漏。

text.ori_cn: 常有司杀者杀，夫代司杀者杀，是谓代大匠斫。
text.man_en: Often it happens that the executioner is killed. And to take the place of the executioner is like handling the hatchet for the master carpenter.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is always a division to kill the killers to kill, the husband on behalf of the division to kill the killers to kill, is said to be on behalf of the master craftsman hacking.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There are always those who are in charge of killing, and those who are in charge of killing are often killed by the husband. This is called Dai Dajiang.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Often, those who carry out executions are executing. To take over the executioner's role is like taking over the job of a master carpenter.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 刽子手经常被杀。取代刽子手的位置，就好比替木匠师傅打斧头。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 刽子手被杀的情况时常发生。代替刽子手就像为木匠师傅拿斧头一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 常常会发生刽子手被杀的情况。而取代刽子手的位置就像替木匠师傅操刀一样。

text.ori_cn: 夫代大匠斫者，希有不伤其手矣。
text.man_en: He who handles the hatchet for the master carpenter seldom escapes injury to his hands.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The man who carves on behalf of the master craftsman, and the man who doesn't hurt his hand.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is rare that the hands of the great craftsmen of my husband's generation would not be injured.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: He who takes the place of a master carpenter rarely avoids injuring his own hand.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为木匠师傅打斧的人，手很少能不受伤。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为木匠师傅拿斧头的人很少会避免双手受伤。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 帮主木匠斧头弄的人，很难避免手受伤。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十五章 民之饥，以其上食税之多，是以饥。
text.man_en: 75When people are hungry, it is because their rulers eat too much taxgrain.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 75 The people are hungry because of the amount of food and taxes on them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 75: The people are hungry because of the large food tax.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 75: The people are hungry because their rulers take too many taxes; that is why they are hungry.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 75人们挨饿，是因为统治者吃了太多的税粮。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 75、人民之所以挨饿，是因为他们的统治者吃太多的税粮。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 当人们饥饿时，这是因为他们的统治者吃掉了太多的赋税粮食。

text.ori_cn: 民之难治，以其上之有为，是以难治。
text.man_en: Therefore the unruliness of hungry people is due to the interference of their rulers. That is why they are unruly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The people are difficult to rule because of their superiority.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The people are difficult to treat because of the efforts made above.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: People are difficult to govern because their leaders interfere too much, hence the difficulty in governing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，饥饿的人们之所以桀骜不驯，是因为统治者的干预。这就是他们不守规矩的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以饥饿之民的不守规矩，是因为他们的统治者的干涉。这就是为什么他们不守规矩。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以饥民的无法无天是由于统治者的干涉。这就是他们为什么无视法纪的原因。

text.ori_cn: 民之轻死，以其求生之厚，是以轻死。
text.man_en: The people are not afraid of death, because they are anxious to make a living. 2That is why they are not afraid of death.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The people are light in death because they are thick in their quest for life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The people despise death because they are eager to survive.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The people take death lightly because they fervently seek to preserve their lives, and thus they treat death with little regard.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人们不怕死，因为他们急于谋生。2这就是他们不怕死的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 老百姓不怕死，是因为急于谋生。 2因此，他们不怕死亡。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人们不怕死亡，因为他们急于谋生。这就是为什么他们不怕死亡。

text.ori_cn: 夫唯无以生为者，是贤于贵生。
text.man_en: It is those who interfere not with their living that are wise in exalting life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only thing that is virtuous is the one who is not born to be born to be born to be born.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The husband who has nothing to do with life is a wise man who values ​​life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Indeed, those who do not cling to life are nobler than those who cherish it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 不干涉生活的人，才是崇尚生活的智者。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那些不干涉自己生活的人才是高尚生活的明智者。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 智慧在于那些不干扰自己生活的人，他们懂得如何提升生活的质量。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十六章 人之生也柔弱，其死也坚强。
text.man_en: 76When man is born, he is tender and weak; at death, he is hard and stiff.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER 76 A man is born soft and weak, but he dies strong.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 76: People are weak in life and strong in death.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 76: When a person is born, they are soft and weak; when they die, they are hard and strong.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 76、人之初，性本柔弱；人之初，性本刚强。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 76、人初生时，是柔弱的；死时，他又硬又僵。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 人之初，性本柔弱；其亡也，坚强而刚硬。

text.ori_cn: 万物草木之生也柔脆，其死也枯槁。
text.man_en: When the things and plants are alive, they are soft and supple; when they are dead, they are brittle and dry.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The life of all plants and trees is soft and brittle, and their death is withered.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: All plants and trees are soft and fragile when they are alive, and withered when they die.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The growth of all things, grasses, and trees is tender and fragile; in their death, they are withered and dry.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 万物和植物活着的时候，柔软而有弹性；死了的时候，却又脆又干。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 当事物和植物有生命时，它们是柔软的；当它们有生命时，它们是柔软的。当它们死后，它们又脆又干。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 物和植物在活着的时候，它们是柔软的；当它们死了，它们变得脆弱和干燥。

text.ori_cn: 故坚强者死之徒，柔弱者生之徒。
text.man_en: Therefore hardness and stiffness are the companions of death, and softness and gentleness are the companions of life.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the strong are the disciples of death, and the weak are the disciples of life.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the strong are the disciples of death, and the weak are the disciples of life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, those who are rigid and strong are companions of death, while those who are soft and weak are companions of life.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，坚硬和僵化是死亡的伴侣，而柔软和温和则是生命的伴侣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故刚与死为伴，柔与生为伴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，坚硬和刚强是死亡的伴侣，而柔软和温和是生命的伴侣。

text.ori_cn: 是以兵强则不胜，木强则折。
text.man_en: Therefore when an army is headstrong, it will lose in a battle. When a tree is hard, it will be cut down.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the case that a strong army will not win, and a strong wood will break.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if the army is strong, it will be invincible; if the wood is strong, it will fall.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a forceful army cannot achieve victory, and a rigid tree will break.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，军队刚愎自用，就会在战斗中失败。树硬，则砍之。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以军队刚愎自用，就会在战争中失败。当一棵树坚硬时，它就会被砍倒。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，当一支军队过于固执时，它将在战斗中失败。当一棵树过于坚硬时，它将被砍倒。

text.ori_cn: 强大处下，柔弱处上。
text.man_en: The big and strong belong underneath. The gentle and weak belong at the top.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Stronger at the bottom, softer at the top.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The strong is at the bottom, the weak is at the top.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Strength lies beneath, gentleness above.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 高大强壮的人属于下面。柔弱者属于顶端。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大而强者属下。温柔弱者属于上层。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 强者居下，弱者居上。

text.ori_cn: 高者抑之，下者举之；有余者损之，不足者补之。
text.man_en: The top comes down and the bottomend goes up, the extra (length) is shortened, the insufficient (width) is expanded.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are high are suppressed, those who are low are lifted up; those who are surplus are lost, those who are deficient are made up.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are high will suppress it, those who are low will lift it; those who have more will lose it, and those who are deficient will make up for it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The high shall be brought low; the low shall be elevated. The excess shall be diminished; the deficient shall be replenished.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上端向下，下端向上，多余（长度）缩短，不足（宽度）扩大。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 顶部下降，底部上升，多余的（长度）缩短，不足的（宽度）扩大。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上面往下，下面往上，多余的长度缩短，不足的宽度扩展。

text.ori_cn: 天之道，损有余而补不足。
text.man_en: It is the way of Heaven to take away from those that have too much and give to those that have not enough.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way of heaven is to make up for what is lost.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way of heaven is to make up for the deficiency when there is excess damage.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of Heaven is to diminish the excessive and supplement the deficient.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天道从拥有太多的人那里拿走，而给予不够的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天之道，夺取有余者，赐予不足者。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天之道，损有余而补不足。

text.ori_cn: 人之道则不然，损不足以奉有余。
text.man_en: Not so with man's way: he takes from those that have not and gives it as tribute to those that have too much.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is not the case with the way of man, which is not sufficient for the loss.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way of man is not like that, if the loss is not enough, there will be more than enough.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of man, on the other hand, is not so; it diminishes the insufficient to offer to the excessive.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 人类的方式却不是这样：他从没有的人那里拿走，然后作为贡品送给那些拥有太多的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 人的方式却不是这样：他从那些没有的人那里拿走，并将其作为贡品送给那些拥有太多的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 对于人的行为却不是这样: 他从那些没有的人那里夺走，并将它作为供奉给予那些拥有太多的人。

text.ori_cn: 孰能有余以奉天下，唯有道者。
text.man_en: Who can have enough and to spare to give to the entire world? Only the man of Tao.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The only person who can have more than enough to serve heaven is the Taoist.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Who has enough to serve the world, only the Taoist.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Who can have enough to offer to the world? Only those who follow the Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谁能有足够的余力来奉献给整个世界？唯有 "道 "之人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 谁能有足够的余力来奉献给整个世界？唯有道之人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 谁能足够宽裕到能给予整个世界？只有道之人。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人为而不恃，功成而不处，其不欲见贤。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage acts, but does not possess, accomplishes but lays claim to no credit, because he has no wish to seem superior.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is that the sages do not rely on them for their work, and they do not want to see the wise.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is because he does not rely on saints, he does not rely on his achievements, and he does not want to see virtuous people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, the sage acts without claiming credit, achieves success without dwelling on it, and does not desire to appear virtuous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人有作为却不拥有，有成就却没有功劳，因为他不想显得高人一等。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以圣人有作为而不拥有，有成就而不居功，因为他不希望显得高人一等。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人行动而不占有，成功但不居功，因为他无意显得高人一等。

text.ori_cn: § 第七十八章 天下莫柔弱于水，而攻坚强者莫之能胜，其无以易之。
text.man_en: 78There is nothing weaker than water but none is superior to it in overcoming the hard, for which there is no substitute.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 78 There is nothing in the world so soft and weak as water, and there is nothing strong enough to attack it, and there is nothing easy about it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 78: There is no one in the world who is soft and weak compared to water, and no one who attacks the strong can defeat him.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter Seventy-Eight: Nothing in the world is as soft and yielding as water, yet for dissolving the hard and inflexible, nothing can surpass it. Its weakness contains irreplaceable strength.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 78没有比水更弱的东西了，但在克服困难方面，没有任何东西比水更优越，没有任何东西可以替代水。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 78、没有什么比水更弱，但在战胜困难方面，没有什么比水更胜一筹，而水是无可替代的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 世上没有比水更柔弱的东西，但它克坚强者却无与伦比，也不可替代。

text.ori_cn: 弱之胜强，柔之胜刚，天下莫不知莫能行。
text.man_en: That weakness overcomes strength and gentleness overcomes rigidity, no one does not know; no one can put into practice.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Weakness overcomes strength, and softness overcomes hardness, and there is nothing in the world that does not know what can be done.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The weak overcomes the strong, the soft overcomes the strong, no one in the world knows how to do it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The weak overcomes the strong, the soft overcomes the hard. Everyone under heaven knows this, but no one can practice it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 柔弱胜刚强，无人不知，无人不晓。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 那柔弱胜刚强，温柔胜刚强，无人不知；没有人能够付诸实践。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 弱胜强、柔胜刚，天下莫不知，莫能行。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人云﹕“受国之垢，是谓社稷主；受国不祥，是为天下王。”
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage says: "who receives unto himself the calumny of the world is the preserver of the state. Who bears himself the sins of the world is king of the world. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: That is why the sages said, "The one who receives the dirt of the country is the lord of the gods of earth and grain; the one who receives the bad luck of the country is the king of the world."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is why the sage said: "If you accept the filth of your country, you are called the master of the country; if you accept the misfortune of your country, you are the king of the world."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hence the sage says, 'He who bears the dirt of the state is called the master of the society and the state; he who endures the misfortunes of the state is called the king of the world.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人说："受天下之谗者，国之守也。自负天下之罪者，天下之王也。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人曰：“自受天下谗言，则国之保也。自承天下罪孽，则天下之王。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此圣人说：“承担天下的污蔑者，是国家的保卫者；承受天下罪孽者，是天下之王。”

text.ori_cn: 正言若反。
text.man_en: 1Straight words seem crooked.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Positive words if reversed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Quite the contrary.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: True words may sound contrary.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 1直话看起来歪歪扭扭。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 1正直的言语显得歪曲。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 直言看似曲折。

text.ori_cn: 是以圣人执左契，而不责于人。
text.man_en: Therefore the Sage holds the left tally, and does not put the guilt on the other party.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because the saints hold the left covenant and do not blame it on others.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, the sage holds the contract and does not blame others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, the sage holds the left side of the contract but does not demand anything from others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，圣人持有左券，并不把罪责推给对方。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 故圣人持左理，不加罪于对方。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，圣人拿着左符，不把罪责归咎于对方。

text.ori_cn: 有德司契，无德司彻。
text.man_en: the virtuous man is for patching up; the vicious is for fixing guilt.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is a virtue of the Deeds, and there is no virtue of the Deeds of the Cherubim.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is Desiqi, but there is no Desiche.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With virtue comes achievement, without virtue comes failure.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 贤者补过，恶者治罪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有德行的人，是用来修补的；恶毒是为了弥补罪孽。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 贤人为修补；恶人是为了定罪。

text.ori_cn: 天道无亲，常与善人。
text.man_en: But "the way of Heaven is impartial; it sides only with the good man. "
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way of heaven is always with the good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heaven has no relatives and always associates with good people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Heaven does not show favoritism, but it consistently sides with good people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但 "天道是公平的，它只站在善人一边"。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但“天道不偏不倚，只与善人为伍。”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但“天道无亲，常与善人。”

text.ori_cn: § 第八十章 小国寡民。
text.man_en: 80(Let there be) a small country with a small population,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Chapter 80 - A Small Nation.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 80: A small country with few people.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 80: A Small Country with Few People.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 80（让）一个人口稀少的小国、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 80（要有）一个人口少的小国家，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 80（假如存在）一个小国，人口稀少，

text.ori_cn: 使有什伯之器而不用，使民重死而不远徙。
text.man_en: where the supply of goods are tenfold or hundredfold, more than they can use. Let the people value their lives and not migrate far.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: So that there is a shibboleth and it is not used, so that the people die heavily and do not migrate far.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It makes the people's weapons more powerful but not used, and makes the people die again and not move far away.
