text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Make use of the tools of an able ruler without employing them, so that the people value life and do not migrate far.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 那里的商品供应量是他们所能使用的十倍或百倍。让人们珍惜自己的生活，不要远走他乡。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 货物供应量十倍或百倍，超出他们的使用能力。让百姓珍惜生命，不远流。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 物产极其丰富，超过了人们的需求。让人民珍惜自己的生命，不要迁徙到远方。

text.ori_cn: 虽有舟舆，无所乘之，虽有甲兵，无所陈之。
text.man_en: Though there be boats and carriages, none be there to ride them. Though there be armor and weapons, no occasion to display them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Although there are boats and mopeds, there is nothing to ride on, and although there is armour, there is nothing to display.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Although there are boats and carriages, there is nothing to ride on them; although there are armor and soldiers, there is nothing to display them.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Even if there are boats and carriages, there is no place to ride them; even if there are armor and weapons, there is no place to deploy them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 虽然有船和马车，却没有人乘坐。虽然有盔甲和武器，却没有展示它们的机会。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 虽有船车，无人乘之。虽有铠甲兵器，却没有展示的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 虽有舟车，然无人乘驾。虽有铠甲武器，亦无用之之机。

text.ori_cn: 使人复结绳而用之，甘其食，美其服，安其居，乐其俗。
text.man_en: Let the people again tie ropes for reckoning, let them enjoy their food, beautify their clothing, be satisfied with their homes, delight in their customs.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: So that the people will return to the use of the rope, sweeten their food, beautify their clothes, live in peace, and enjoy their customs.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Make people re-knot ropes and use them, enjoy their food, dress them beautifully, make their homes comfortable, and enjoy their customs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Let the people return to tying knots for records; make their food delicious, their clothing beautiful, their homes peaceful, and their customs joyful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 让人们再次系绳算账，让他们享受美食，美化衣着，满足于自己的家园，愉悦于自己的习俗。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 让人民重新系绳算帐，让他们享受食物，美化他们的衣服，满足他们的家园，高兴他们的风俗。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 让人们重新用绳子记数，让他们享受美食，美化衣着，满足于自己的居所，喜爱他们的风俗。

text.ori_cn: 邻国相望，鸡犬之声相闻，民至老死，不相往来。
text.man_en: The neighboring settlements overlook one another so that they can hear the barking of dogs and crowing of cocks of their neighbors, and the people till the end of their days shall never have been outside their country.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Neighbouring countries look at each other, the sound of chickens and dogs are heard, and the people do not communicate with each other until they die of old age.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Neighboring countries look at each other, hear the sound of cocks and dogs, and the people do not interact with each other until they grow old and die.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Neighboring countries overlook each other; the sounds of roosters and dogs can be heard, but the people live out their lives without ever interacting.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 相邻的居民点相互眺望，可以听到邻居的犬吠和鸡鸣，人们直到生命的尽头也从未离开过自己的国家。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 邻村相望，闻邻家犬吠鸡鸣，百姓至死不离国门。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 邻近的村庄彼此俯瞰，他们可以听到邻居的狗叫声和鸡鸣声，而直到他们生命的尽头，这些人也从未离开过他们的国家。

text.ori_cn: § 第八十一章 信言不美，美言不信。
text.man_en: 81True words are not finesounding; finesounding words are not true.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: CHAPTER XXXI Faith is not beautiful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 81: Faithful words are not beautiful, and good words are not believed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Chapter 81: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 81真言非细语，细语非真言。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 81、真话不假，花言巧语并不真实。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真实的话语不会动听；动听的话语不一定真实。

text.ori_cn: 善者不辩，辩者不善。
text.man_en: A good man does not argue; he who argues is not a good man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are good do not argue, and those who argue are not good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A good person does not argue, and a person who debates is not good.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The virtuous do not argue, and those who argue are not virtuous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 好人不争辩，争辩的人不是好人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 好人不争辩；争论的人不是好人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 善者不辩，辩者不善。

text.ori_cn: 知者不博，博者不知。
text.man_en: the wise one does not know many things; he who knows many things is not wise.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who know are not knowledgeable, and those who are knowledgeable do not know.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A person who knows is not knowledgeable, and a person who is knowledgeable does not know.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who know do not speak much, and those who speak much do not know.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 聪明的人不知道许多事；知道许多事的人不聪明。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 智者不知多事；知道很多事情的人并不聪明。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 智者不知多事；知多事者不智。

text.ori_cn: 圣人不积，既以为人己愈有，既以与人己愈多。
text.man_en: The Sage does not accumulate (for himself). He lives for other people, and grows richer himself; he gives to other people, and has greater abundance.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The saint does not accumulate, both to think that people themselves the more they have, and both to be with people themselves the more they have.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sage does not accumulate. Since he thinks that others and himself have more, he has given more to others and himself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The sage does not hoard; the more he helps others, the richer he becomes; the more he gives to others, the more he has.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 圣人不（为自己）积累。他为他人而活，自己也变得更加富有；他为他人付出，自己也变得更加富足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 圣人不积累（为自己）。他为别人而活，自己也变得更加富有；他给予他人，并且拥有更多的财富。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 圣人不积（为自己）。他为他人而活，自己越发富有；他给予他人，拥有更多的丰盛。

text.ori_cn: 天之道，利而不害；圣人之道，为而不争。
text.man_en: The Tao of Heaven Blesses, but does not harm. The Way of the Sage accomplishes, but does not contend.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way of heaven is to benefit and not to harm; the way of the sage is to do and not to strive.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way of heaven is to benefit without harm; the way of saints is to act without fighting.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of heaven is to benefit without harming; the way of the sage is to act without competing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 天道福而不害。圣人之道，成而不争。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 天道有福，但无害。圣人之道有为，但不争。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 天道無親，常與善人。聖人之道，為而不爭。
